268096656 9 4----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:2 vehicl:1 bench:1 gener:1 exterior:1 xm:2 higher:1 seat:3 metal:1 carbon:1 mile:1 knob:1 option:3 control:2 theater:1 tune:1 without:1 row:1 aveo:1 much:1 flexibl:1 gm:1 often:1 better:2 materi:1 belt:2 split:1 complain:1 arriv:1 bin:1 car:1 woodgrain:1 result:1 cabin:1 model:1 put:1 loss:1 visibl:1 fiber:1 cargo:1 style:1 motor:1 setup:1 sunroof:1 best:1 cruis:1 trim:1 conveni:2 end:1 look:1 includ:1 rear:1 us:1 list:1 storag:1 sever:1 plan:1 larg:1 featur:1 radio:2 insid:1 tight:1 miss:1 found:2	||	Inside, the cabin has five seat belts, and after putting some miles on several Aveo models, one could plan on using four of those belts without too much complaining from the second row. Seating three in the back would be tight, however. The rear bench has theater-style seating (for better exterior visibility) and a 60/40 split for cargo flexibility. Better interior materials arrive for 2009, including optional woodgrain, metallic, and carbon-fiber-look trim on the options list. Storage and convenience bins are found all over the interior, and higher-end features such as cruise control, XM, and a large sunroof are also optional. Cars from General Motors often have one of the best XM radio setups, but the Aveo's radio controls are missing a tuning knob found on most other GM vehicles, resulting in a loss of convenience.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: XM; General Motors; XM; GM; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: cabin; seat belts; miles; Aveo models; belts; row; back; bench; seating; exterior visibility; split; cargo flexibility; materials; woodgrain; options list; Storage; convenience bins; interior; features; cruise control; XM; sunroof; Cars; General Motors; XM radio setups; Aveo; radio controls; tuning knob; GM vehicles; loss; convenience; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
268096656 9 5----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mph:1 mpg:2 good:1 macpherson:1 enough:1 epa:1 torqu:1 asian:1 expect:1 cylind:1 danger:1 gear:1 mile:1 pleasant:1 fourteen:1 mileag:1 tank:1 option:1 liter:1 anti:1 certainli:1 number:1 aveo:2 chevrolet:1 strictli:1 economi:1 torsion:1 town:1 wheelbas:1 pound:1 ride:1 car:2 model:1 wheel:1 pair:1 engin:2 run:1 automat:1 transmiss:2 short:1 ident:1 strut:1 horsepow:1 nervou:1 brake:1 feel:1 inch:2 standard:1 speed:2 rear:1 lock:1 feet:1 us:1 around:1 manual:1 per:1 compon:1 chassi:1 term:1 incher:1 beam:1	||	The 2009 Chevrolet Aveo and Aveo5 use identical engines, transmissions, and chassis components. EPA mileage for the pair is 27/34 mpg for models with a five-speed manual transmission and 25/34 mpg for those with a four-speed automatic. The engine is a 1.6-liter four-cylinder with 106 horsepower and 106 pound-feet of torque. Expect about 400 miles per tank. In terms of running gear, the Aveo is a strictly by-the-numbers Asian economy car: MacPherson struts, a torsion-beam rear, and a short 97.7-inch wheelbase. Fourteen-inch wheels are standard, while 15-inchers (and anti-lock brakes) are optional. Around town, the ride is good enough, but over 70 mph, the car feels nervous certainly not dangerous, but not pleasant.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chevrolet Aveo; EPA; 	PERSON: MacPherson; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Asian; 	NOUN: Chevrolet Aveo; Aveo5; engines; transmissions; chassis components; EPA mileage; pair; mpg; models; manual transmission; mpg; engine; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; miles; tank; terms; gear; Aveo; economy car; MacPherson; rear; wheelbase; wheels; 15-inchers; brakes; town; ride; mph; car; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
268096656 9 6----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	test:2 accept:1 score:1 fare:1 perform:1 iih:1 impact:5 airbag:1 dual:2 passeng:1 height:1 rate:2 insur:1 side:5 frontal:2 adjust:1 margin:1 offset:1 institut:1 option:1 crash:1 plu:1 talli:1 safeti:2 includ:1 standard:1 extra:2 feder:1 star:3 front:3 regard:1 offer:1 provid:1 aveo:2 lose:1 remain:1 sedan:1 comfort:1 shoulder:1 onstar:1 belt:1 measur:1 ab:1 competitor:1 found:1	||	Regarding safety, the 2009 Aveo includes front and side airbags, but ABS remains optional. We like the height-adjustable front shoulder belts because of the extra comfort they provide. Scores for the Aveo5 in federal crash tests are dual five-star ratings for frontal impacts and dual four-star tallies for side impacts. The Aveo sedan fares less well, losing one star each for the passengers in front and side impacts. In IIHS tests, the insurance institute rates the Aveo's offset frontal-impact performance as Acceptable and side impact as Marginal. On the plus side, GM's OnStar is also standard, offering an extra measure of safety not found in other competitors.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: ABS; IIHS; Aveo; GM; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: safety; Aveo; front; side airbags; ABS; front shoulder belts; comfort; Scores; Aveo5; crash tests; ratings; impacts; tallies; side impacts; Aveo sedan fares; star; passengers; front; side impacts; IIHS tests; insurance institute rates; Aveo; frontal-impact performance; impact; side; GM; OnStar; measure; safety; competitors; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

For instance, on the base Aveo LS (and Aveo5 LS), a tilt steering wheel, a rear-window defroster, an AM/FM audio system with an auxiliary input jack for an iPod or other device, intermittent windshield wipers, and OnStar is standard. The 1LT packages add air conditioning and a CD player to the audio system. The 2LT package packs on more, including cruise control, power heated outside rearview mirrors, XM Satellite Radio, and remote keyless entry. Larger wheels (15 inches, up from 14 inches) are standard on the 2LT-equipped cars. 268096656 10 9----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	increas:1 might:1 hp:1 mpg:2 can:1 gener:1 engin:2 bump:1 epa:1 torqu:1 automat:1 transmiss:1 cylind:1 estim:1 whine:1 rang:1 buzz:1 rpm:1 power:1 especi:2 inlin:1 option:1 throughout:1 liter:1 get:1 standard:1 quicker:1 whop:1 speed:3 annoyingli:1 regard:1 obtrus:1 number:1 lack:1 aveo:2 manual:1 anticip:1 loud:1 acceler:1 appropri:1 deliv:1 match:1 fast:1 blisteringli:1 small:1	||	The Aveo gets an appropriately small power increase for its 1.6-liter, inline four-cylinder engine, bumping hp from 103 to a whopping 106, with matching torque numbers. This will deliver EPA mpg estimates of 25/34 mpg with the optional four-speed automatic transmission and 27/34 with the standard five-speed manual. Acceleration is quicker than one might anticipate, especially with the five-speed, but still generally lacking. Still, if it can t be said that the Aveo is blisteringly fast, at least it s obtrusively loud, especially with regard to the engine, which buzzes and whines annoyingly throughout the RPM range.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: EPA; 	NOUN: Aveo; power increase; engine; hp; torque numbers; EPA mpg estimates; mpg; transmission; manual; Acceleration; five-speed; t; Aveo; regard; engine; RPM range; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

911049237 6 14----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	test:1 overal:1 profession:1 perform:1 agil:1 type:1 impact:1 intrud:1 becom:1 drive:1 report:1 limit:2 turn:1 coup:1 lack:1 tire:1 solid:1 alloi:1 season:1 boost:1 review:1 pound:1 ride:2 car:1 cabin:1 model:1 wheel:3 loss:1 road:2 grip:1 passeng:1 firmer:1 spongi:1 rougher:1 adequ:1 driver:1 especi:1 trim:1 heavi:1 find:1 brake:1 similar:1 emit:1 feel:1 ex:1 inch:1 corner:1 speed:1 rear:1 traction:1 true:1 sport:2 pretens:1 accord:1 translat:1 sever:1 handl:1 suspens:1 squeal:1 incher:1 improv:1 tight:1 maneuver:1	||	The firmer suspension improves handling overall, but translates into a rougher ride for passengers, with road impact intruding into the cabin. Most trims ride on 17-inch alloy wheels and all-season tires, but the EX-L V6 boosts its wheels to 18-inchers. Road grip feels solid, but any true sport pretensions become limited by the '09 Accord Coupe's lack of rear-wheel drive. A professional review of the similar 2008 model reports a loss of traction when cornering at high speeds. The heaviness of the coupe (3,200 pounds) also limits sports car-type agility and maneuverability, especially in tight turns. 911049237 4 17----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	littl:1 hp:1 smooth:1 can:1 engin:1 notabl:1 half:1 perform:2 automat:1 though:1 expect:1 cylind:3 time:1 level:1 adequ:1 fuel:1 power:1 effici:1 jerki:1 trim:1 worth:1 opt:1 ex:1 speed:1 premium:1 accord:2 monei:1 sale:1 pass:1 louder:1 sedan:1 strong:1 upshift:1 account:1 volum:1	||	The four-cylinder EX trim level is the high-volume Accord; it's expected to account for half of all Accord sedan sales. Its 190-hp four-cylinder has more-than-adequate power, though its high-speed passing performance isn't as strong as the V-6's. The engine is also notably louder than the V-6, and its automatic isn't as smooth; upshifts can be a little jerky at times. Still, if it were my money, I'd opt for the four-cylinder because the premium for the less fuel-efficient V-6 isn't worth the so-so performance.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: EX; level; Accord; half; Accord sedan sales; power; performance; V-6; engine; V-6; upshifts; jerky; times; money; premium; V-6; performance; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

911049237 11 3----Exterior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	detail:1 seren:1 exterior:1 slab:1 bend:1 bring:1 flow:1 though:1 modest:1 behold:1 slope:1 unmov:1 effici:1 greenhous:1 invigor:1 deconstruct:1 wind:1 control:1 form:1 qualiti:1 competit:1 lack:1 swoop:1 figur:1 roof:1 bit:1 visual:1 trunk:1 honda:1 intersect:1 bmw:2 appreci:1 angl:1 big:1 littl:1 reaction:1 seri:1 japanes:1 bore:1 camri:3 line:1 disturb:1 struck:1 toyota:1 dumb:1 side:1 carefulli:1 unlik:1 ve:1 noth:1 left:1 beauti:1 mind:1 reput:1 end:2 direct:1 sharp:1 crisp:1 ey:2 windshield:1 accord:5 glanc:1 seem:1 shock:1 sit:1 eleg:1 brand:1 inspir:1 calmli:1 wrong:1 altima:3 enhanc:1 nissan:1 studi:1 loyalist:1	||	I ve never been a Honda loyalist, but I do appreciate the brand s reputation for quality and efficiency. Beauty being in the eye of the beholder and all, I have never been struck dumb by a glance in the direction of Accord. I had to sit down and study Accord s exterior carefully to figure out why it left me unmoved. The big Japanese competition, Toyota Camry and Nissan Altima, inspire a reaction from me. Camry shocks me, and Altima invigorates me. There s nothing wrong with Accord its controlled, elegant lines flow calmly from end to end. No sharp angles disturb the serenity. The sloped windshield and swooping greenhouse seem formed by the wind, and the intersection of roof and trunk bring to mind the modest deconstruction of the BMW 5-series. Unlike the BMW, or Camry or Altima, though, Accord is a bit slab-sided, lacking crisp detail and visually enhancing bends. Accord is just a little boring, to my eye.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda; Toyota; Nissan Altima; BMW; 	NOUN: Honda loyalist; brand; reputation; quality; efficiency; Beauty; eye; beholder; glance; direction; Accord; Accord s; competition; Toyota Camry; Nissan Altima; reaction; Camry shocks; Altima; nothing; Accord; lines flow; end; angles; serenity; windshield; greenhouse; wind; intersection; roof; trunk; deconstruction; BMW 5-series; BMW; Camry; Altima; Accord; bit; detail; bends; Accord; boring; eye; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

911049237 3 4----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	littl:1 model:1 smooth:1 mpg:3 give:1 vcm:1 incorpor:1 variabl:1 engin:4 higher:1 line:1 former:1 bring:1 highwai:1 cargo:1 version:2 lx:1 neglig:1 cylind:3 help:1 latter:1 oper:1 drive:1 horsepow:2 fuel:1 luxuri:1 addit:1 ex:2 feel:1 liter:1 manag:1 elev:1 produc:1 refin:1 accord:2 pass:1 differ:1 peopl:1 pep:1 honda:1 oomph:1 deliv:1 economi:1 lot:1 improv:1 citi:1 prefer:1 haul:1	||	The V-6 engine incorporates Variable Cylinder Management (VCM), which helps improve fuel economy, but the difference between it and the four-cylinder is negligible, with the four delivering up to 21 mpg city, 31 mpg highway, and the V-6 at 2 mpg less with both. The V-6 is the preferred engine for hauling lots of people or cargo or when driving in higher elevations. It is a refined engine that gives the Accord a luxurious feel. Honda Accord LX and EX models get a 2.5-liter four-cylinder engine, the former producing 177 horsepower and the latter 190 horsepower. Both versions are smooth operators, but while the EX version brings a little more pep to passing, it doesn't have additional oomph off the line.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda Accord LX; EX; 	LOCATION: EX; 	NOUN: V-6 engine; Cylinder Management; VCM; fuel economy; difference; mpg city; mpg highway; V-6; mpg; V-6; engine; lots; people; cargo; elevations; engine; Accord; feel; Honda Accord LX; EX models; engine; horsepower; horsepower; versions; operators; EX version; pep; oomph; line; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The four-cylinder engines are available in five-speed manual or automatic transmission for both styles of the Accord, while the V6 sedan is only available in five-speed automatic. The V6 coupe is available with a six-speed manual. Cloth upholstery is standard, however EX-L models feature leather seats and a leather-covered steering wheel. Safety is enhanced on all Accords with six standard airbags, including side-impact air bags for front seats and side curtain air bags. Combined with standard 18-inch wheels, the result is a very supple suspension package that seems to soak up bumps almost imperceptibly, without numbing its road feel. The variable gear ratio steering is precise and supple, with a clear, on-center feel.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda; 	NOUN: Honda engineers; Accord Coupe; center; gravity; engineers; suspension geometry; setup; rear; wheels; result; suspension package; bumps; road feel; gear ratio steering; feel; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

911049237 0 1----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	ride:1 car:1 sporti:1 superior:1 bigger:1 segment:1 camri:2 midsiz:2 tad:1 toyota:1 sprung:1 softli:1 truth:1 caught:1 reput:1 isol:1 legion:1 want:2 live:1 top:1 decad:1 safeti:1 famili:1 redesign:1 choic:2 competit:1 refin:1 accord:3 perenni:1 came:1 brainer:1 honda:1 softer:1 decid:1 grown:1 adag:1 sedan:3 reliabl:1 often:1 satisfi:1 owner:1 chang:1 latest:1 rapidli:1 thing:2	||	For two decades now, there have been two perennial no-brainer choices for a midsize family sedan: the Honda Accord and the Toyota Camry. Both have legions of satisfied owners and top reputations for reliability and safety. Deciding between the two often came down to this: If you wanted a softly sprung car with superior isolation, the Camry was the way to go -- and if you wanted a sporty ride and could live with a tad less refinement, the Accord was the sedan of choice. There's still some truth to this adage for 2009, but things have changed rapidly in the midsize sedan segment. For one thing, the Accord has grown bigger and softer with its latest redesign; for another, the competition has caught up.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: decades; no-brainer choices; family sedan; Honda Accord; Toyota Camry; legions; owners; reputations; reliability; safety; car; isolation; Camry; way; ride; tad; refinement; Accord; sedan; choice; truth; adage; things; sedan segment; thing; Accord; redesign; competition; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The Honda is now roughly the fourth-sportiest entrant, by our count, trailing the canyon-king Nissan Altima, the upsized but still capable Mazda 6 and the often-overlooked Ford Fusion/Mercury Milan twins. It's also still hampered by traditional Honda foibles like elevated road noise and exaggerated brake pedal vibration during hard stops. Performance is likewise uninspiring -- while the upgraded 2.4-liter four-cylinder in the EX is pleasant, the base engine is merely adequate, and the top-of-the-line 3.5-liter V6 is overmatched in terms of acceleration by many rival six-cylinder engines.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda; Nissan Altima; Mazda; Ford Fusion\/Mercury Milan twins; Honda; 	NOUN: things; Accord; today; family sedan free-for-all; Honda; entrant; count; Nissan Altima; Mazda; Ford Fusion\/Mercury Milan twins; Honda foibles; road noise; brake pedal vibration; stops; Performance; EX; base engine; 3.5-liter V6; terms; acceleration; engines; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
911049237 0 3----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 reason:1 resal:1 infin:1 show:1 epa:1 center:1 time:1 button:1 moreov:1 appeal:1 varieti:1 luxuri:1 backseat:1 famili:1 sleev:1 balloon:1 degre:1 honda:2 sedan:2 reliabl:2 materi:1 undeni:1 stack:1 got:1 car:2 cabin:1 commodi:1 boast:2 seri:1 rival:1 accommod:1 sell:1 sterl:1 best:1 valu:1 reput:2 evok:1 look:1 feel:2 happi:1 premium:1 us:1 pai:1 accord:4 around:1 classifi:1 extraordinarili:1 remain:1 larg:1 ac:1 wrong:1 construct:1 cut:1 competitor:1	||	Don't get us wrong -- the 2009 Honda Accord remains an appealing car, for a variety of reasons. First of all, it's got an ace up its sleeve that most competitors don't: its sterling reputation for reliability. Also, the Accord has ballooned to such a degree that the EPA classifies it as a "large car," and it shows in the commodious cabin, which boasts one of the most accommodating backseats of any family sedan. The center stack is undeniably button-happy, but its premium look and feel evokes luxury sedans such as the Infiniti M series. Like most Hondas, the Accord feels extraordinarily well constructed, and its interior materials are a cut above the rival Camry's. Moreover, that reputation for reliability pays off when it's time to sell, as the Accord boasts one of the best resale values around.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: EPA; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Honda Accord; car; variety; reasons; First; ace; sleeve; competitors; sterling reputation; reliability; Accord; degree; EPA; car; cabin; backseats; family sedan; center; premium look; luxury sedans; Infiniti M series; Hondas; Accord; materials; cut; Camry; reputation; reliability; time; Accord; resale values; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Whichever style you prefer, the Accord remains a smart choice on the strength of its proven track record. However, unlike Accords of the past, it doesn't really elevate itself above the competition once you get behind the wheel. The LX and LX-P sedans are motivated by a 2.4-liter four-cylinder that generates 177 horsepower and 161 pound-feet of torque. An upgraded 190-hp version of that 2.4-liter engine powers EX sedans and all coupes. A five-speed manual is standard with the four-cylinder engines, and a five-speed automatic is optional. Available on the EX trim levels is a 3.5-liter V6 that produces 271 hp and 254 lb-ft of torque (251 lb-ft on manual-shift V6 coupes). Sedans with the V6 can only be had with a five-speed automatic, but a six-speed manual is a no-cost option on V6 coupes.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Honda Accord; engine choices; LX; LX-P sedans; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; version; engine powers EX sedans; coupes; manual; engines; EX; levels; V6; hp; lb-ft; torque; lb-ft; V6 coupes; Sedans; V6; manual; option; V6 coupes; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

In terms of fuel economy, four-cylinder Accords are about average, while V6-powered models receive slightly above-average ratings. Four-cylinder cars with automatic transmissions achieve 21 mpg city/30 mpg highway and 24 mpg combined, while the manual transmission bumps those numbers up to 22/31/25. The six-cylinder returns 19 mpg city/29 mpg highway (28 in automatic coupes) and 22 mpg combined with the automatic, though the manual-shift V6 coupe drops to 17/25/20, as its version of the V6 lacks cylinder-deactivation technology. 911049237 0 15----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	particularli:1 interior:1 foot:1 gener:1 clutter:1 overal:1 though:1 expect:1 contrast:1 center:1 love:1 bold:1 given:1 button:2 seat:1 longer:1 head:1 leather:1 option:1 knob:1 talli:1 screen:1 contour:1 support:1 cubic:1 far:1 qualiti:1 regard:1 competit:1 size:1 largest:1 multipurpos:1 system:1 trunk:2 honda:1 tightli:1 sedan:1 materi:1 compart:1 complain:1 boost:1 cube:1 stack:1 small:1 room:1 lumbar:1 other:1 numb:1 oddli:1 nonadjust:1 excess:1 line:1 navig:1 overli:1 sophist:1 passeng:1 ident:1 layout:1 command:1 friendli:2 trip:1 top:1 look:2 polar:1 firm:1 rear:1 suppli:1 us:1 offer:1 accord:3 past:1 voic:1 impos:1 mount:1 shoulder:1 featur:1 plenti:1 construct:1 user:2 respect:1	||	The 2009 Honda Accord features a tightly constructed interior with generally high-quality materials, though it's no longer head and shoulders above the competition in this regard. The center stack looks sophisticated, but it's overly cluttered with identical-looking buttons, in contrast to the user-friendly layouts in past Accords. The optional navigation system boosts the button tally further, but its voice commands, high-mounted screen and multipurpose knob are at least user-friendly. The top-of-the-line leather seats are polarizing -- some of us love their bold contours and firm support, while others have complained of numbness after long trips and excessive nonadjustable lumbar. This is by far the largest Accord ever, so expect a plentiful supply of passenger room, particularly in the sedan's rear compartment. However, the 14-cubic-foot trunk in the sedan is oddly small given the car's imposing overall size. The coupe's trunk offers a respectable 11.9 cubes.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda Accord; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Honda Accord; interior; materials; head; shoulders; competition; regard; center; buttons; contrast; layouts; Accords; navigation system; button tally; voice commands; screen; knob; leather seats; contours; support; others; numbness; trips; lumbar; Accord; supply; passenger room; sedan; compartment; trunk; sedan; car; size; coupe; trunk; cubes; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

290470753 6 1----Others----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	belong:1 segment:1 infin:1 seriou:1 door:1 half:1 perform:1 entertain:1 enough:1 jampack:1 upgrad:1 level:2 power:1 luxuri:2 head:1 limit:1 contend:1 famili:1 class:2 livabl:1 figur:1 sale:1 flagship:1 sedan:2 bmw:1 everydai:1 car:1 might:1 seri:2 add:1 surpris:1 six:1 sell:1 consider:1 shopper:1 purist:1 choos:1 suspect:1 driver:1 end:1 want:1 find:1 talk:1 look:1 entri:1 redesign:1 merced:1 sport:1 choic:1 excel:1 merit:1 showroom:1 nearli:2 engag:1 raft:1	||	For every S-Class that Mercedes sells, nearly four C-Class sedans head out the showroom door. Nearly half of BMW sales belong to the 3 Series. Talk all you want about six-figure flagships, but most luxury shoppers end up choosing entry-level sport sedans, so it's no surprise the segment is jampacked with excellent choices. Audi's contender is the A4, redesigned for 2009 with a raft of power and luxury upgrades. Performance purists might look the other way even at its limits the A4 isn't as entertaining as a 3 Series or Infiniti G35 but I suspect most drivers will find it engaging enough. Add in a family-car level of everyday livability, and the new A4 merits serious consideration.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mercedes; BMW; Audi; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: S-Class; Mercedes; C-Class sedans; showroom door; half; BMW sales; Series; Talk; flagships; luxury shoppers; sport sedans; surprise; segment; choices; Audi; contender; A4; raft; power; luxury upgrades; Performance purists; way; limits; A4; Series; Infiniti G35; drivers; level; livability; A4 merits; consideration; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

290470753 6 13----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	cursor:1 infin:1 zoom:1 dial:1 bring:1 kei:1 emploi:1 help:1 requir:1 button:2 midpack:1 move:1 knob:2 follow:1 coordin:1 screen:2 intuit:1 scroll:1 easier:1 menu:1 labyrinth:1 mark:1 lack:1 like:1 arrai:1 system:1 touch:1 yearn:1 make:1 crank:1 west:1 sort:1 axi:1 allow:1 wheel:1 quick:2 north:1 lexu:1 submenu:1 navig:1 someth:1 shortcut:1 version:1 easi:1 setup:2 map:2 spin:1 east:1 idriv:2 major:1 feverishli:1 direct:1 merced:1 return:1 us:1 access:1 mmi:1 base:1 alon:1 south:1 comand:1 previou:1	||	As knob-based setups go, MMI is midpack. It's easier to use than BMW's iDrive, but not as intuitive as Mercedes' Comand. The A4's system follows the likes of Audi's A5, A6 and A8. An array of shortcut buttons allow quick access to the major menus, and four directional keys help sort through the labyrinth of submenus. A well-marked "return" button something most versions of iDrive still lack brings you back to the previous screen, and zooming in or out on the navigation map requires just a quick crank of the knob. Not so easy is map scrolling: You have to dial coordinates on an X- or Y-axis, then spin the wheel feverishly to move the cursor east/west or north/south. That alone makes me yearn for the touch-screen setup Lexus and some Infinitis employ.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: MMI; Mercedes; Audi; 	NOUN: setups; MMI; midpack; BMW; iDrive; Mercedes; Comand; A4; system; likes; Audi; A5; A6; A8; array; shortcut buttons; access; menus; keys; sort; labyrinth; submenus; return; button something; versions; iDrive; screen; navigation map; knob; map scrolling; X; wheel; cursor; north\/south; setup Lexus; Infinitis; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Quattro defaults 60 percent of power to the rear wheels, but even with the	##false@@false$$	electronic stability system	##false@@true$$	off it's nearly impossible to kick them wide. Not every all-wheel-drive system trades hang-the-tail-out fun for stability, and in any case the A4 feels nose-heavy not as much as a front-wheel-drive Acura TSX, but certainly less balanced than the segment's best rear-wheel-drive cars.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acura TSX; 	NOUN: A4; rivals; corkscrew turn; wheels; understeer; Quattro defaults; percent; power; wheels; stability system; system; fun; stability; case; A4; Acura TSX; segment; cars; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
290470753 6 28----DriveRide----#text.A.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 sort:1 seri:1 can:1 nice:1 coupl:1 perform:2 grabbi:1 activ:1 notic:1 contrast:1 strike:1 slight:1 drive:2 electron:1 uphil:1 rather:1 mind:1 hard:2 want:1 brake:3 abruptli:1 feel:1 balanc:1 fade:1 linear:1 confid:1 corner:1 respons:2 intrus:1 stronger:1 class:1 come:1 hour:1 seem:1 pedal:1 stabil:1 system:1 throttl:1 upshift:1 program:1 unnecessarili:1 cut:1 daili:1 make:1	||	When active, Audi's Electronic Stability Program can be rather intrusive. Coming hard into an uphill corner, the system abruptly cut my throttle and upshifted not the sort of response I want in a performance-minded car. The brakes, in contrast, strike a nice balance between performance and daily driving. The pedal feels stronger than that of the C-Class; it isn't as confident as the brakes in a 3 Series or G35, but its	##false@@false$$	linear	##false@@true$$	response makes theirs seem unnecessarily grabby. 290470753 6 32----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	skid:1 fashion:1 wheel:1 can:3 maintain:1 activ:3 though:1 disc:2 hand:1 correct:1 unlik:1 noth:1 weather:1 power:1 driver:1 wet:1 dynam:2 option:1 brake:2 similar:1 direct:1 dry:2 standard:1 counterst:1 assist:2 stabil:2 sit:1 system:3 ratio:1 steer:6 featur:1 bmw:1 lend:2 antilock:1 keep:1 vari:1	||	Standard	##false@@false$$	antilock	##false@@true$$	disc	##false@@true$$	brakes sit at all four wheels, and a brake drying feature keeps the discs dry in wet weather. An optional Dynamic Steering system can vary power assist and steering ratio, not unlike BMW's Active Steering. It can also lend a hand to maintain stability: Get into a skid, and the stability system can direct Dynamic Steering to actively countersteer. Active Steering lends assistance in a similar fashion, though BMW says it won't correctively steer if the driver does nothing. The base engine is a 211-horsepower turbocharged four-cylinder, offered with a manual transmission or a six-speed automatic or, in front-drive versions, a continuously variable transmission (CVT). A V-6 version comes only with the sweet-shifting six-speed automatic. Quattro all-wheel drive is offered on the four-cylinder sedan and is standard on the six-cylinder car. The A4 Avant wagon comes only as a turbocharged four, with quattro and the six-speed automatic. 290470753 11 2----Others----#text.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 tractabl:1 knew:1 good:1 drivetrain:1 boi:1 flow:1 almost:2 rework:1 hit:1 metal:1 funni:1 drive:2 deem:1 combin:1 effici:1 diem:1 happen:1 live:2 follow:1 underneath:1 turn:1 prove:1 avail:1 overhaul:1 prepar:1 peopl:1 system:1 market:1 duo:1 near:2 benchmark:1 sedan:2 harmoni:1 volum:1 pitch:1 firewal:1 thing:2 deliber:1 audi:3 model:1 wheel:1 philli:1 rival:1 bore:1 engin:1 tusk:1 becam:1 juri:1 closer:1 walru:1 credibl:1 grew:1 best:1 fuel:1 left:1 trio:1 develop:1 men:1 perfect:2 note:1 sheet:1 top:1 thorough:1 migrat:1 includ:1 technic:1 origin:1 ii:1 sport:2 offer:1 sequest:1 past:1 foibl:1 up:1 prais:1 process:1 fact:1 per:1 evolv:1 enthusiast:1 chart:1 hotel:1 debut:1 week:1	||	But as the praise flowed, Audi's volume model the A4 grew tusks that would rival a walrus. The original A4 (B5) debuted when Boys II Men was near the top of the charts and its duo of follow-ups (the Audi B6 and B7, not the trio from Philly) were more technical reworks than thorough overhauls. But a funny thing happened in the process. As the sheet-metal evolved and the interior became a benchmark, underneath, the A4 turned into a credible sports sedan. With the engine migrating closer to the firewall, the all-wheel drive system nearing perfection and the available drivetrains offering a combination of tractability and fuel efficiency, the A4 could be all things to all people enthusiasts included. So when developing the "all-new" A4, Audi knew it had to hit every note in pitch-perfect harmony. Our	##false@@false$$	First Drive	##false@@true$$	proved that many of the A4's foibles had been left in the past, but until we lived with one for a week, the jury was still sequestered in a hotel, living off an 11 per diem. Now, deliberations are over and we're prepared to deem the 2009 Audi A4 one of the best sports sedans on the market. In fact, the A4 is so good, it's almost boring. Almost...	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Audi; Audi; Audi; Audi; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Philly; 	NOUN: praise; Audi; volume model; A4; tusks; walrus; A4; B5; Boys; Men; top; charts; duo; follow-ups; Audi B6; B7; trio; Philly; reworks; overhauls; thing; process; benchmark; A4; sports sedan; engine; firewall; drive system; perfection; drivetrains; combination; tractability; fuel efficiency; A4; things; people enthusiasts; A4; Audi; note; harmony; Drive; A4; foibles; past; week; jury; hotel; diem; deliberations; Audi A4; sports sedans; market; fact; A4; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

290470753 11 5----Exterior----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	otherwis:1 need:1 headlamp:1 particularli:1 audi:1 grill:1 vehicl:1 angular:1 seamlessli:1 unsalt:1 diffus:1 subtl:1 emploi:1 modern:1 rump:1 rare:1 rang:1 protrus:1 pleasant:1 dead:1 profil:1 look:1 element:1 gape:1 massiv:1 maw:1 aggress:1 sinist:1 rear:1 affix:1 front:1 taut:1 wide:1 absolut:1 singular:1 fascia:1 impos:1 eyelin:1 led:1 effect:1 butter:1 eleg:1 contradict:1 frumpi:1 view:1 bland:1 match:1 design:2	||	Say what you will about the massive grille affixed to modern Audis, its rare that a singular design element has been employed so seamlessly and effectively on such a wide range of vehicles. The gaping maw looks pleasant on the A3, imposing on the Q7 and absolutely sinister on the R8. Matched with the new angular headlamps, LED eyeliner and the subtle protrusion of the front diffuser, the new A4's fascia is both aggressive and elegant. And it needs to be. The profile is as bland as unsalted butter and the rear, particularly when viewed dead-on, is a frumpy rump that contradicts an otherwise taut design.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: grille; Audis; design element; range; vehicles; maw; A3; Q7; R8; headlamps; eyeliner; protrusion; diffuser; A4; fascia; profile; bland; butter; rear; rump; design; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Regardless, the V6 is a competent performer on par with the BMW 328i, and with 265-hp on tap at 6,500 rpm and 243 lb-ft of torque at 3,000 rpm, it's more than adequate for daily-duty. But given the choice, we'd take the 2.0-liter turbo nine-times-out-of-ten. 290470753 10 1----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 raw:1 interior:1 model:1 gallon:1 mpg:1 wheel:1 can:1 rival:1 engin:2 convert:1 highwai:1 version:1 six:1 cylind:2 compact:1 alwai:1 drive:1 appeal:1 mile:1 power:1 fuel:1 luxuri:1 get:1 station:1 speed:1 wagon:1 pai:1 excel:1 offer:1 handl:1 pep:1 better:1 owner:1 base:1 classi:1 economi:1 plenti:1 match:1 citi:1	||	What's the A4's appeal? It can't match the raw speed of most of its rivals, but it has a classy interior, excellent handling, and plenty of pep for most owners. It also has better fuel economy (the base model gets 30 miles to the gallon on the highway and 23 mpg in the city) because it's one of the few compact luxury cars offered with a four-cylinder engine. And you can always pay more and get the A4 with all-wheel drive and a powerful six-cylinder engine, as well as in station wagon and convertible versions.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: A4; appeal; speed; rivals; interior; handling; plenty; pep; owners; fuel economy; base model; miles; gallon; highway; mpg; city; luxury cars; engine; A4; drive; engine; station wagon; versions; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Both of the A4's available power plants have been bumped up in power for '09. The base engine is a turbocharged 2.0-liter, 211-horsepower, inline four-banger (up from 200 hp in the previous A4), while the 3.2-liter V6 is now rated at 265 horsepower (up from 255 hp before).	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: A4 sedan; version; inches; inches; tad; A4; power plants; power; base engine; 2.0-liter; four-banger; hp; A4; 3.2-liter V6; horsepower; hp; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The front-wheel-drive entry-level model, the 2.0T, comes with a continuously variable automatic transmission, while all-wheel-drive versions of the 2.0T come with either a stick shift or a six-speed Tiptronic automatic transmission. The V6-powered A4 sedan comes only with the Tiptronic transmission and all-wheel drive. The wagon comes only with the smaller engine and all-wheel drive. The A4 convertible is still based on the previous generation A4.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: versions; A4; model; T; transmission; versions; T; stick shift; Tiptronic; transmission; A4 sedan; Tiptronic transmission; drive; wagon; engine; drive; A4 convertible; generation A4; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Top speed is governed at 130 mph, and in my test car the turbocharger kicked in with no discernible lag when I punched the gas. -791133735 12 4----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.SECTION.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.SECTION.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mpg:4 singl:1 gmc:1 beef:1 intellig:1 highwai:2 epa:1 torqu:3 estim:2 oper:1 drive:1 rpm:2 power:2 year:1 ft:1 control:2 vvt:1 liter:1 awd:2 get:1 select:1 avail:1 tune:1 system:1 better:1 economi:2 lb:1 citi:2 tap:2 increas:2 model:1 hp:2 engin:3 acadia:2 automat:1 transmiss:2 electron:1 clutch:2 fuel:2 driver:1 bia:1 direct:1 condit:1 standard:1 speed:1 inject:1 rear:1 fwd:2 technolog:1 revis:1 deliv:1 featur:1 certain:1 mate:1 shift:2	||	A single engine powers the 2009 GMC Acadia, but it has been beefed up this year for more power and better fuel economy. The 3.6-liter V-6 engine with VVT and new direct-injection technology delivers a 5-hp increase to 288 hp at 6300 rpm and a torque increase to 270 lb.-ft. of torque at 3400 rpm. The engine is mated to an electronically controlled 6-speed automatic transmission with clutch-to-clutch operation. The transmission has driver shift control for tap-up/tap-down selectable shifting. While FWD is standard, an intelligent AWD system is available, featuring revised tuning for more rear torque bias during certain driving conditions. EPA fuel-economy estimates for the FWD Acadia are 17 mpg city/24 mpg highway, while the AWD model gets an estimated 16 mpg city/23 mpg highway.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: GMC Acadia; VVT; EPA; Acadia; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: engine powers; GMC Acadia; year; power; fuel economy; V-6 engine; VVT; technology; increase; hp; rpm; torque increase; lb.-ft; torque; rpm; engine; transmission; operation; transmission; driver shift control; FWD; AWD system; tuning; torque bias; conditions; EPA fuel-economy; FWD Acadia; mpg city\/24 mpg highway; AWD model; mpg city\/23 mpg highway; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-791133735 6 7----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	compet:1 can:1 wheel:1 vehicl:1 yukon:2 gener:1 xl:1 buick:1 acadia:4 saturn:1 cue:1 toyota:1 eight:1 highland:1 share:1 seat:1 full:1 mazda:1 drive:1 motor:1 pilot:1 ie:1 suv:1 kin:1 chevi:1 enclav:1 travers:1 famili:1 outlook:1 cx:1 front:1 avail:1 crossov:2 like:1 size:1 honda:1 seven:1 larg:1 grow:1 distinguish:1 part:1 design:1	||	The Acadia is GMC's first crossover and is part of a growing family of large crossover vehicles at General Motors. To distinguish itself from its kin (i.e. Buick Enclave/Chevy Traverse/Saturn Outlook), the Acadia shares design cues with GMC's full-size SUVs, the Yukon and Yukon XL. Available with front- or all-wheel drive, the Acadia can seat seven or eight. -791133735 3 10----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 equip:1 mpg:1 variabl:1 torqu:1 powerpl:1 time:1 rang:1 drive:2 power:2 along:1 ft:1 effici:1 mileag:1 emiss:1 properli:1 liter:1 consist:1 number:1 aim:1 boost:1 lb:1 pound:1 hp:1 wheel:2 can:1 give:1 pair:1 acadia:1 across:1 automat:1 six:1 tow:1 suv:1 fuel:1 valv:2 trim:1 fairli:1 direct:2 speed:1 inject:2 averag:1 front:1 technolog:1 wider:1 remain:1 dohc:1 deliv:1 improv:1 reduc:1	||	A new direct-injection, 24-valve, 3.6-liter DOHC V8 gives the '09 Acadia a needed power boost. It now delivers 288 hp and 270 lb-ft of torque across a wider power range. The direct injection technology, along with variable valve timing, aims to improve fuel efficiency and reduce emissions, but mileage numbers remain fairly consistent with the 2008 Acadia's. Paired with a six-speed automatic, the powerplant averages 17/24 mpg in front-wheel drive trims and 16/23 in all-wheel drives. Properly equipped, the SUV can tow up to 4,500 pounds.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acadia; Acadia 's; 	DATE: 2008; 	NOUN: direct-injection; DOHC V8; Acadia; power boost; hp; lb-ft; torque; power range; injection technology; valve timing; fuel efficiency; emissions; mileage numbers; Acadia; powerplant averages; mpg; drive trims; drives; SUV; pounds; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Nearly as big as the Yukon, it combines the passenger capacity of a minivan with the cargo utility of an SUV. The base SLE seats up to eight passengers in three rows, while the SLT trims replace the second-row bench with captain's chairs, reducing capacity to seven (the bench is available as an option). Both rear rows fold flat, even with the captain's chairs, and the second row splits 60/40. Critics and owners find the slide-and-fold function very easy to operate. Though GMC has built its image around tough trucks, the AWD version of the Acadia is geared more for foul-weather driving than boulder-bashing. Thanks to its space-efficient design, the GMC Acadia provides large-sedan-like comfort for all passengers. A third-row seat is standard, and one may choose between seven- and eight-passenger configurations. The 60/40-split second-row bench allows eight to ride, while opting for the captain's chairs reduces capacity to seven. Additionally, access to that third row is eased by wide rear doors and a sliding second-row seat. Although taller folks in the way back may wish for more thigh support, the accommodations back there are much better than those of most crossovers or traditional SUVs.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: GMC Acadia; 	NOUN: cabin; controls; materials; quality; plastic pieces; Thanks; design; GMC Acadia; comfort; passengers; seat; configurations; second-row bench; captain; chairs; capacity; access; row; doors; seat; folks; way; thigh support; accommodations; crossovers; SUVs; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-791133735 8 28----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	good:1 ultrason:1 help:1 requir:1 seat:1 care:1 chicago:1 dirt:1 right:1 opt:1 screen:2 get:1 easier:1 assist:1 wide:1 imag:4 project:1 speckl:1 winter:1 view:1 small:1 make:2 salt:1 messi:1 wheel:1 can:1 visibl:1 line:2 becam:1 road:1 object:1 navig:2 recommend:2 smaller:1 short:1 mirror:3 sight:2 easi:1 suv:1 driver:2 hard:1 tall:1 look:1 detect:1 rearview:4 park:1 tilt:1 larger:1 camera:2 rear:2 back:1 front:1 len:1 sit:1 great:1 comfort:2 steer:1 telescop:1	||	The front seats are wide and comfortable. The steering wheel tilts and telescopes, making it easy for drivers tall and short to get comfortable. As with any SUV, the driver sits high, with a good view down the road. But visibility to the rear isn't great, requiring care when backing up. We recommend opting for ultrasonic rear park assist, which can detect objects out of the driver's line of sight. We further recommend getting the rearview camera, which now projects its image on the navigation screen or the rearview mirror. The smaller image on the rearview mirror is right in your line of sight when looking at the rearview mirror to back up. However, in a messy Chicago winter, the camera lens became speckled with dirt and salt, making the small image hard to see. A larger image on the navigation screen would have been easier to see and more helpful.	##false@@false$$		||	LOCATION: Chicago; 	NOUN: seats; wheel; drivers; SUV; driver; view; road; visibility; rear; care; park; objects; driver; line; sight; rearview camera; image; navigation screen; rearview mirror; image; rearview mirror; line; sight; rearview mirror; Chicago winter; camera lens; dirt; salt; image; image; navigation screen; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

But here is the fine print when GMC says the Acadia is a seven- or eight-passenger vehicle: GM assumes three people are sitting in the third row, which has about nine inches less hip room than the second row. Putting three children back there will be possible, but three adults probably won't fit. Two adults will fit, though, with good head room and adequate leg room. Just don't plan to keep them back there on long trips because the low seat bottoms lack thigh support.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acadia; GMC; Acadia; GM; 	NOUN: vehicles; Acadia; row; children; print; GMC; Acadia; vehicle; GM; people; row; inches; hip room; row; children; adults; adults; head room; leg room; trips; seat bottoms; thigh support; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-791133735 8 33----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	messi:1 plastic:1 explor:1 line:1 acadia:1 block:1 carri:1 space:3 someth:1 cargo:3 triumph:1 passeng:1 automak:1 pilot:1 perfect:1 cubic:3 calcul:1 fill:1 behind:1 feet:3 third:1 row:1 size:1 roof:1 trunk:2 seven:1 stuff:1 floor:1 sedan:2 often:1 compart:1 rearward:1 bin:1 view:1 mid:1 capac:1 small:1 compar:1	||	Acadia triumphs in cargo capacity. It has 24.1 cubic feet of cargo space behind the third row; that's more than the trunk space of a mid-size sedan and compares to less than 16 cubic feet for the Pilot and less than 14 cubic feet for a seven-passenger Explorer. (However, automakers often make these calculations filling the space to the roof, blocking the rearward view, something you can't do in a sedan trunk.) A small plastic-lined bin below the floor of the Acadia's cargo compartment is perfect for carrying messy stuff.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acadia; Acadia; 	NOUN: Acadia triumphs; cargo capacity; feet; cargo space; row; trunk space; sedan; feet; Pilot; feet; Explorer; automakers; calculations; space; roof; rearward view; something; sedan trunk; bin; floor; Acadia; cargo compartment; stuff; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-791133735 8 34----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	strap:1 reveal:1 lower:1 pull:1 explor:2 acadia:1 nice:1 carri:1 space:1 cargo:4 almost:2 upper:1 area:1 requir:2 seat:1 pilot:2 restraint:1 easili:1 head:1 cavern:1 flat:1 advantag:1 cubic:6 remov:1 effort:1 feet:6 us:1 fold:4 third:4 row:4 continu:1 bodi:1 featur:1 nearli:1 volum:1 capac:1 compar:2 workout:1	||	More cargo capacity is revealed by folding down the back seats. The third row folds down easily, and a strap is used to pull it back up. It is not an upper-body workout but does require effort. With the third row folded down the Acadia's cargo-carrying advantage continues with nearly 69 cubic feet of space; that compares to about 44 cubic feet for the Explorer and almost 48 cubic feet for the Pilot. One nice feature is that lowering the second or third rows on the Acadia does not require removing the head restraints. When the second and third rows are folded the cargo area is almost flat, and there is a cavernous 115.9 cubic feet of cargo volume. That compares to 87.6 cubic feet in the Pilot and 85.8 cubic feet in the Explorer.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acadia; Acadia; 	NOUN: cargo capacity; seats; row; strap; workout; effort; row; Acadia; advantage; feet; space; feet; Explorer; feet; Pilot; feature; rows; Acadia; head restraints; rows; cargo area; feet; cargo volume; feet; Pilot; feet; Explorer; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

It quickly gives the driver a feeling of confidence about where the vehicle is heading and how it will respond. An Acadia AWD SLT weighs nearly 5,000 pounds. -791133735 8 38----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	distantli:1 quiver:1 nice:1 round:1 shave:1 independ:1 jar:1 drive:1 blend:1 motion:1 modul:1 bam:1 control:1 unwant:1 rigid:1 strip:1 without:1 provid:1 tradit:1 much:1 bit:1 bodi:1 traffic:1 strong:1 lot:1 tar:1 make:1 littl:1 car:1 ride:1 smooth:1 truck:1 pothol:1 acadia:3 sloppi:1 bump:2 modern:1 life:1 easi:1 suv:2 heavi:1 brake:2 feel:3 speed:1 firm:1 rear:1 us:2 front:1 refin:1 handl:1 suspens:1 felt:1 base:1 part:1 slam:1	||	The Acadia uses an independent suspension in the front and rear, just like most modern cars; and this provides a well-rounded blend of ride and handling. Bumps, tar strips and potholes are felt but only distantly, without the slam-bam jarring that is part of life in a truck-based SUV. If you're used to driving a traditional SUV, the Acadia will be much more smooth and refined. The Acadia feels strong and rigid and it doesn't quiver on bumps. Unwanted body motions are nicely controlled, so there isn't a sloppy feeling. The brake feel is firm, and that makes it easy to modulate the brakes in heavy traffic, shaving off a lot of speed or just a little bit.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acadia; Acadia; Acadia; 	NOUN: Acadia; suspension; front; rear; cars; ride; handling; Bumps; tar strips; potholes; part; life; SUV; SUV; Acadia; Acadia; bumps; body motions; feeling; brake feel; brakes; traffic; lot; speed; bit; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-791133735 8 39----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	skid:1 wheel:2 can:1 vehicl:1 maintain:1 acadia:1 possibl:1 sensor:1 help:1 latter:1 correct:1 stabilitrak:1 drive:2 electron:1 weather:1 driver:1 tell:1 slide:1 foul:1 react:1 control:2 detect:1 standard:1 rear:1 come:1 avail:1 us:1 front:2 prevent:1 aw:1 stabil:2 system:3 rollov:1 ad:1	||	StabiliTrak, GM's electronic stability control system, comes standard and can help the driver maintain control. The system uses sensors to tell if the front or rear of the vehicle is sliding and corrects for the skid. If the system detects a possible rollover, it reacts to prevent that aw well. The Acadia is available with front-wheel drive or all-wheel drive, the latter adding stability in foul weather.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: GM; Acadia; 	NOUN: StabiliTrak; GM; stability control system; standard; driver; control; system; sensors; front; rear; vehicle; skid; system; rollover; Acadia; front-wheel drive; drive; stability; weather; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-791133735 8 40----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	anyth:1 call:1 send:1 vehicl:1 can:2 wheel:1 tool:1 distribut:1 intellig:1 good:1 road:1 torqu:1 requir:1 stabilitrak:2 drive:2 essenti:1 power:1 mean:1 driver:1 awd:1 rear:1 us:1 front:1 arrai:1 gm:1 system:2 comput:1 engag:1 commun:1 ad:1 keep:1 perman:1	||	The all-wheel drive system is permanently engaged and does not require the driver to do anything but drive. -791133735 8 41----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	increas:1 valid:1 hp:5 vehicl:1 variabl:1 concern:1 engin:2 enough:1 add:1 torqu:1 time:1 rate:2 tow:1 consider:1 wonder:1 rpm:2 power:2 fuel:1 valv:1 effici:1 direct:1 inject:1 feet:2 flexibl:1 handl:1 approach:1 economi:1 boost:1 capac:1 rel:1 big:1 design:1 pound:3	||	Those who wonder whether a V6 is enough engine to handle such a big vehicle have a valid concern, but the Acadia's V6 is a relatively new engine with variable-valve timing designed to make it more powerful, efficient and flexible. For 2009, it also adds direct injection, which boosts both power and fuel economy. The V6 is now rated at 288 hp at 6300 rpm and 270 pound-feet of torque at 3400 rpm (up from 275 hp and 251 pound-feet). That's considerably more than the Pilot's 244 hp and approaches the 292 hp of the Explorer's V8, while the Explorer's V6 is rated at 210 hp. Towing capacity is also increased from 4500 to 5200 pounds.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acadia; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: V6; engine; vehicle; concern; Acadia; V6; engine; timing; injection; power; fuel economy; V6; hp; rpm; pound-feet; torque; rpm; hp; pound-feet; Pilot; hp; hp; Explorer; V8; Explorer; V6; hp; Towing capacity; pounds; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1904423921 9 1----Exterior----#text.B.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	squar:1 appear:1 grill:1 suffic:1 tier:1 round:1 center:1 open:1 deal:1 grand:3 black:1 flank:1 symbol:1 width:1 headlight:1 tini:1 attract:1 suvasauru:1 styliz:1 outsid:1 definit:1 impress:1 walk:1 posit:1 wheelbas:1 moment:1 next:1 vitara:3 engin:1 quick:1 explor:1 taho:1 short:1 upper:1 suv:1 rather:1 beneath:1 look:1 park:1 redesign:1 front:2 seem:1 fascia:1 around:1 upscal:1 great:1 suzuki:1 fog:1 featur:2 lamp:1 brand:1 chang:1	||	Suzuki has changed a great deal on the Grand Vitara for 2009. Most impressive are the two brand new engines, which we'll get to in a moment. First, let's take a quick walk-around. Up front, the new Grand Vitara features a redesigned fascia that features a two-tiered, blacked-out grille with the automaker's stylized 'S' symbol front and center. Flanking the upper opening are two squared-off headlights and beneath those are two round fog lamps. It definitely appears upscale and attractive, however, for an SUV the wheelbase seems rather short from the outside, as does the width. Parked next to a Tahoe or even an Explorer, the Grand Vitara looks positively tiny. Suffice it to say, it's no SUVasaurus.	##true@@false$$		||	PERSON: Suzuki; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Grand Vitara; Grand Vitara; 	NOUN: Suzuki; deal; Grand Vitara; brand; engines; moment; walk-around; front; Grand Vitara; fascia; grille; automaker; symbol front; center; opening; headlights; fog lamps; SUV; wheelbase; width; Tahoe; Explorer; Grand Vitara; SUVasaurus; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1904423921 9 2----Verdict----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:2 interior:1 histor:1 vehicl:1 snug:1 cartoon:1 street:1 particular:1 highlight:1 everybodi:1 overs:1 kid:1 spot:1 center:1 compact:1 becom:1 altern:1 hit:1 seat:1 refer:1 power:1 right:2 decad:1 platform:1 think:1 competit:1 piec:1 much:1 continu:1 jurass:1 sweet:1 market:4 machineri:1 dinosaur:1 aim:1 packag:1 materi:1 popular:1 complain:1 util:1 todai:1 thing:1 room:1 littl:1 roam:1 displac:1 engin:1 add:1 smaller:1 hand:1 consum:1 passeng:1 automak:2 suv:2 practic:1 innov:1 massiv:1 domin:1 fifth:1 coin:1 larger:1 rear:1 refin:1 ut:1 offer:2 past:1 dimens:1 section:1 beastli:1 fact:1 suzuki:3 outer:1 term:1 outgrown:1 insid:1 theori:1 clever:1 dog:1	||	Again with the dinosaur reference, what's with that? Suzuki has some very innovative marketing material aimed at its competition and the oversized SUVs that have become so popular in the past decade. One clever cartoon-piece in particular highlights the fact that Suzuki has never outgrown the market as some automakers have, and it's coined the Jurassic term for the beastly, V8-powered 'utes roaming the streets today. On the other hand, Suzuki continues to refine its smaller platforms, offering the consumer just the right package of interior room, engine displacement and outer dimensions. At least, that's the theory. And in practice, there was very little to complain about with four passengers inside. Add a fifth in the center section of the rear seat, and things get snug. Still, we think that the automaker has hit a sweet-spot in the market that has historically been dominated by much larger machinery. Not everybody needs a massive utility vehicle to take their kids or dogs where they need to go, and the compact SUV market offers just the right alternative.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Suzuki; Suzuki; Suzuki; 	NOUN: dinosaur reference; Suzuki; marketing material; competition; SUVs; decade; cartoon-piece; fact; Suzuki; market; automakers; term; utes; streets today; hand; Suzuki; platforms; consumer; package; room; engine displacement; dimensions; theory; practice; passengers; center section; seat; things; automaker; sweet-spot; market; machinery; everybody; utility vehicle; kids; dogs; SUV market; alternative; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1904423921 9 4----DriveRide----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:2 anywher:1 mpg:2 last:1 wish:1 perform:1 outright:1 epa:1 highwai:1 powerpl:1 cylind:4 estim:1 grand:2 rang:1 drive:4 exact:1 mile:1 power:1 effici:1 mileag:1 inlin:1 banger:1 worth:1 hood:1 option:1 extrem:1 hook:1 get:1 flat:2 competit:1 avail:1 much:1 li:1 record:1 agreeabl:1 acceler:1 outsid:1 sound:1 definit:1 favor:1 economi:1 citi:1 make:1 face:1 model:2 hp:1 gallon:1 smooth:1 stick:1 wheel:4 drove:1 can:1 give:1 set:1 vitara:2 engin:5 land:1 combo:1 add:1 automat:5 transmiss:4 six:1 short:1 poni:1 best:1 fuel:2 driver:1 develop:1 speed:5 matter:1 exactli:1 larger:1 rear:2 choic:1 fulli:1 us:2 offer:3 upscal:1 manual:1 unit:2 either:2 suzuki:4 per:1 architectur:1 replac:1 fall:1 featur:1 base:1 manner:1 plenti:1 mate:2 shift:1 found:1	||	Under the short, flat hood lies your choice of either a 2.4L four-cylinder engine or a larger 3.2L V6. The 166 hp four banger can be mated to either a five-speed manual transmission or a four-speed automatic. We drove a four-cylinder model with the automatic and found that while it doesn't exactly fall flat on its face when accelerating, it definitely won't be setting any land speed records. We wish Suzuki used at least five speeds for its four-cylinder's automatic transmission. Still, for drivers who favor fuel economy over outright performance, the four-cylinder option is agreeable and it offers 19 miles per gallon in the city no matter which transmission it's hooked to and as much as 26 mpg with a stick-shift rear-wheel drive model. The least efficient combo with the inline-four adds four-wheel drive to the automatic transmission, but it still gets 23 mpg on the highway. Suzuki has replaced last year's 2.7L V6 engine, which had been the only powerplant available, with a new 3.2L unit that was developed by Suzuki and is based on GM's high feature architecture. This engine isn't used anywhere outside of the Suzuki range and is an extremely smooth and well-mannered unit that gives the Grand Vitara an upscale sound and plenty of power 230 ponies worth to be exact. This engine makes the 2009 Grand Vitara fully equipped to take on the best that its competition has to offer. The six-cylinder engine is mated to a five-speed automatic and offers EPA fuel mileage estimates of 18/24 with rear-wheel drive and 17/23 when equipped with four-wheel drive.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: GM; EPA; 	PERSON: Suzuki; Suzuki; Suzuki; Suzuki; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: hood; choice; L; engine; L V6; hp; banger; manual transmission; model; face; land speed records; Suzuki; speeds; transmission; drivers; fuel economy; performance; option; miles; gallon; city; matter; transmission; mpg; stick-shift rear-wheel drive model; combo; inline-four; drive; transmission; mpg; highway; Suzuki; year; L V6 engine; powerplant; L unit; Suzuki; GM; feature architecture; engine; Suzuki range; unit; Grand Vitara; sound; plenty; power; ponies; engine; Grand Vitara; competition; engine; EPA fuel mileage estimates; rear-wheel drive; drive; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1904423921 9 6----DriveRide----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 equip:2 unibodi:1 singl:1 test:1 pull:1 street:1 normal:1 cours:1 nice:1 good:1 slipperi:2 type:1 mud:1 grand:4 slope:1 drive:2 dirtbik:1 watercraft:1 combin:1 purpos:1 power:1 dirt:1 get:1 numer:1 avail:1 circumst:1 rough:1 provid:1 powertrain:1 bit:1 system:1 market:1 frame:1 tax:1 gv:1 lb:1 low:1 small:1 go:2 trailer:1 negoti:1 allow:1 wheel:4 can:1 subject:1 set:1 occasion:1 quick:1 vitara:5 coupl:1 road:4 real:2 full:1 tow:1 suv:1 vast:1 unlik:1 rather:1 stuck:1 major:1 prodigi:1 credenti:1 rear:1 true:2 us:2 atv:1 problem:1 offer:1 despit:1 know:1 handl:1 manual:1 point:1 suzuki:1 drivewai:1 architectur:1 snowi:1 featur:1 capac:1 competitor:1	||	Unlike most of its competitors, the Grand Vitara is equipped with a full-frame under its unibody architecture. This allows for a rather high 3,000 lb towing capacity with any powertrain combination. Suzuki is quick to point out that the GV would have no problem pulling a trailer with a couple of its ATVs, dirtbikes or small watercraft. The Grand Vitara also features a true four-wheel drive system, which powers the rear wheels under normal circumstances but can be manually put into four-wheel high when the going gets a bit slippery. For true off-roading, the Grand Vitara offers a real four-wheel low setting, which we put to good use on an off-road course that was provided to us for testing purposes. We didn't see a single Vitara get stuck in the mud, despite the numerous slippery slopes we negotiated. The vast majority of Grand Vitaras out on the streets will never be subjected to the type of driving that it is equipped to handle, but it's nice to know that there are still real SUVs available on the market for those that need them. Snowy driveways and the occasional dirt road are not going to tax the GV's prodigious rough road credentials.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Suzuki; 	NOUN: competitors; Grand Vitara; full-frame; architecture; lb towing capacity; powertrain combination; Suzuki; GV; problem; trailer; couple; ATVs; dirtbikes; watercraft; Grand Vitara; drive system; powers; wheels; circumstances; bit; off-roading; Grand Vitara; setting; use; course; testing purposes; Vitara; mud; slopes; majority; Grand Vitaras; streets; type; SUVs; market; driveways; dirt road; GV; road credentials; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1904423921 9 8----Price----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	ride:1 equip:2 liberti:1 model:1 lower:1 wheel:3 vehicl:2 axl:2 set:1 normal:1 vitara:2 nice:1 abl:1 vs:1 road:3 escap:1 independ:2 uniqu:1 jeep:1 grand:2 full:1 tow:1 drive:2 electron:1 live:1 transfer:1 liter:1 credenti:1 flat:1 rear:2 class:1 true:1 front:1 offer:1 neutral:1 cost:1 suspens:1 cr:1 price:1 market:1 suzuki:2 architectur:1 compromis:1 base:1 manner:1 case:1 make:2	||	Suzuki has equipped its Grand Vitara with four-wheel independent suspension, which makes for a nice ride on normal roads. There are literally no other vehicles in the GV's price class that offer true four-wheel drive and an independent rear axle. That makes the Suzuki a very unique vehicle in a market full of CR-Vs, RAV4s and Escapes, which are all based on front-wheel drive architecture. Models like the Jeep Liberty have a live axle at the rear, which compromises road manners for off-road credentials and a lower cost. The Grand Vitara is also able to be flat-towed, as it is equipped with a neutral setting on its electronic transfer case.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Suzuki; Suzuki; 	LOCATION: Grand Vitara; GV; 	NOUN: Suzuki; Grand Vitara; suspension; ride; roads; vehicles; GV; price class; drive; axle; Suzuki; vehicle; market; CR-Vs; RAV4s; front-wheel drive architecture; Models; Jeep Liberty; axle; rear; road manners; credentials; cost; Grand Vitara; setting; transfer case; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1904423921 9 9----Verdict----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:2 total:1 interior:1 vehicl:1 store:1 belong:1 street:1 distribut:1 nice:1 round:1 highwai:1 abil:1 disc:1 sensor:1 time:1 grand:2 seat:2 drive:1 mile:2 expand:1 year:2 along:1 place:1 seatback:1 monitor:1 anti:1 consist:1 cubic:2 behind:1 warranti:2 quiet:1 tire:1 curtain:1 powertrain:1 system:1 program:1 rollov:1 impress:2 split:1 citi:1 util:1 room:1 ride:1 wheel:1 vitara:2 road:1 space:1 consid:1 airbag:3 dual:1 side:2 electron:2 rather:1 bumper:2 coverag:2 forc:1 brake:2 safeti:2 pressur:1 includ:1 standard:1 rear:3 lock:1 feet:2 excel:1 front:3 fold:1 storag:1 stabil:1 spend:1 either:1 seven:1 suzuki:1 mount:2 demeanor:1 nearli:1 featur:1 plenti:1	||	Driving the Grand Vitara, we were rather impressed by its quiet demeanor and ride. Considering its impressive off-road abilities, the Suzuki's interior is a nice place to spend time, either on the highway or on city streets. As a utility vehicle, there is plenty of room (24.4 cubic feet) behind the rear seats to store your belongings, and the 60/40 split rear seatbacks fold down, expanding total storage space to nearly 69 cubic feet. Safety features include an Electronic Stability Program along with four-wheel anti-lock disc brakes with electronic brake-force distribution. Also standard are dual front airbags, front seat-mounted side airbags and side-mounted curtain airbags front and rear. A tire-pressure monitoring system and a rollover sensor also round out safety equipment. Suzuki also equips the Grand Vitara with its excellent warranty coverage, consisting of a seven-year or 100,000 mile powertrain warranty and three-year or 36,000 mile bumper-to-bumper coverage.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Suzuki; Suzuki; 	NOUN: Grand Vitara; demeanor; ride; abilities; Suzuki; interior; place; time; highway; city streets; utility vehicle; plenty; room; feet; seats; belongings; split; seatbacks; storage space; feet; Safety features; Stability Program; disc brakes; brake-force distribution; airbags; side airbags; curtain airbags; monitoring system; rollover sensor; safety equipment; Suzuki; Grand Vitara; warranty coverage; mile powertrain warranty; mile; coverage; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1904423921 10 23----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	model:3 allow:1 can:1 wheel:2 vitara:2 odomet:1 torqu:1 transmiss:1 automat:1 across:1 mode:1 version:1 cylind:1 grand:2 tow:1 rang:1 drive:2 mile:1 horsepow:1 power:1 inlin:1 lineup:1 limit:1 transfer:1 liter:1 standard:2 speed:2 premium:1 flat:1 behind:1 lock:2 rear:1 feet:1 produc:1 offer:1 without:1 manual:1 system:2 suzuki:1 base:1 ad:1 case:1 rv:1 low:1 pound:1	||	Every Suzuki Grand Vitara is powered by a 2.4-liter inline four-cylinder that produces 166 horsepower and 162 pound-feet of torque. A five-speed manual transmission is standard on base models, while all other versions get a four-speed automatic. Rear-wheel drive is standard across the lineup, but Premium models can also be had with a four-wheel-drive system with a low-range transfer case. Limited models are offered with a four-mode 4WD system (4H, 4H Lock, 4L Lock and N) that allows the Grand Vitara to be flat-towed behind an RV without adding miles to the odometer.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Every Suzuki Grand Vitara; 	NOUN: Suzuki Grand Vitara; inline; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; manual transmission; base models; versions; drive; lineup; Premium models; system; transfer case; models; 4WD system; 4H; 4H Lock; 4L Lock; N; Grand Vitara; RV; miles; odometer; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1904423921 10 24----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	attempt:1 unibodi:2 gener:1 structur:1 incorpor:1 vitara:1 road:1 abil:2 compact:2 grand:1 tow:1 suv:2 appeal:1 fuel:1 taken:1 slow:1 pavement:1 ladder:1 safeti:1 standard:1 compani:1 commentari:1 unimpress:1 rigid:1 refin:1 averag:1 list:1 crossov:1 lack:1 attract:1 handl:1 carlik:1 editori:1 bodi:1 acceler:1 price:1 frame:1 suzuki:2 chassi:1 featur:2 economi:1 favor:1 improv:1 earn:1 enhanc:1 review:1 design:1 differenti:1	||	Like most other compact SUVs, the Grand Vitara features a carlike unibody chassis for improved body rigidity, handling and safety. Suzuki has attempted to differentiate it, however, by incorporating a ladder frame design into the unibody structure. The company says this enhances the vehicle's off-road and towing abilities. In editorial reviews, this Suzuki SUV has earned favorable commentary for its long list of standard features, attractive price and above-average abilities when taken off-pavement. Its slow acceleration, unimpressive fuel economy and general lack of refinement, however, make it less appealing than other compact crossovers.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Suzuki; Suzuki; 	NOUN: SUVs; Grand Vitara; chassis; body rigidity; safety; Suzuki; ladder frame design; structure; company; vehicle; abilities; editorial reviews; Suzuki SUV; commentary; list; features; price; abilities; off-pavement; acceleration; fuel economy; lack; refinement; crossovers; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1904423921 10 26----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 grill:1 gener:1 good:1 torqu:1 prior:1 cylind:1 grand:1 unavail:1 power:1 year:2 ft:1 luxuri:1 control:1 liter:2 unfortun:1 avail:1 much:1 xsport:1 present:1 market:1 updat:1 lb:1 model:1 hp:2 idea:1 ultim:1 vitara:1 engin:2 brought:1 minim:1 adventur:1 current:1 comprehens:1 bumper:1 trim:1 find:1 includ:1 redesign:1 edit:1 capabl:1 front:1 us:1 suzuki:1 discontinu:1 midcycl:1 exampl:1 debut:1 chang:2 design:1	||	The present second-generation Suzuki Grand Vitara debuted for the 2006 model year with one engine -- a 2.7-liter V6 that was capable of 185 hp. Changes were minimal until 2009, when a comprehensive midcycle update brought about the current four-cylinder engine and a much more powerful 3.2-liter V6. The V6 was available on XSport and Luxury trims and made 230 hp and 213 lb-ft of torque. Other changes included some redesigned interior controls and a new grille and front bumper design. Unfortunately, the V6 was discontinued after 2010, but finding a used example from its two years on the market would be a good idea. The Ultimate Adventure Edition was unavailable prior to 2012.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Suzuki Grand Vitara; 	DATE: 2006; 2009; 2010; 2012; 	NOUN: Suzuki Grand Vitara; model year; engine; V6; hp; Changes; midcycle; engine; 3.2-liter V6; V6; XSport; Luxury trims; hp; lb-ft; torque; changes; controls; grille; bumper design; V6; example; years; market; idea; Ultimate Adventure Edition; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

It served as a replacement for the Sidekick, Suzuki's previous compact SUV. -1904423921 10 28----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 plush:1 js:1 distinct:1 level:2 gear:1 grand:1 seat:1 drive:3 rang:1 among:1 year:1 luxuri:1 leather:1 plu:1 limit:1 element:1 liter:1 alloi:1 simplifi:1 market:1 known:1 low:1 small:1 antilock:1 upon:1 simpli:1 model:2 hp:2 wheel:4 vitara:1 engin:1 version:1 trucklik:1 releas:2 suv:1 trim:2 brake:1 includ:1 standard:1 us:1 came:1 main:1 jlx:1 gain:1 either:1 suzuki:1 chassi:1 featur:1 design:1	||	In its first year, the Grand Vitara was the only small SUV for the U.S. market equipped with a V6 engine. Upon release, this 2.5-liter V6 made 155 hp. Other distinct design elements included a trucklike chassis and low-range gearing on four-wheel-drive models. The main trim levels were either two-wheel-drive JS or four-wheel-drive JLX. There were also "plus" versions that came standard with antilock brakes and alloy wheels. In 2000, a plush Limited model was released that featured, among other luxuries, leather seating. In 2002 the V6 gained 10 more hp, and in 2003 Suzuki simplified the trim levels to be known simply as 2WD and 4WD.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Limited; 	PERSON: Suzuki; 	DATE: 2000; 2002; 2003; 	LOCATION: U.S.; 	NOUN: year; Grand Vitara; SUV; U.S. market; V6 engine; release; V6; hp; design elements; chassis; models; levels; JS; JLX; versions; brakes; alloy wheels; model; luxuries; leather seating; V6; hp; Suzuki; levels; 2WD; 4WD; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

It's the friend, family member or romantic partner who would be ideal -- except for that one deal-breaking trait. You can prattle off several good qualities about this person (smart, good-looking, funny, etc.), and still at the end of your list, there lies the one "but " caveat. Up until this year, the Suzuki Grand Vitara was a "but" vehicle of sorts. It boasted a nice cabin, able handling, a long list of standard features and a class-leading warranty. But, there was one major shortcoming: the engine, which lacked power and wasn't so great when it came to fuel economy.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: person; friend; family member; partner; trait; qualities; person; end; list; caveat; year; Suzuki Grand Vitara; vehicle; sorts; cabin; handling; list; features; warranty; shortcoming; engine; power; economy; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The FX35 is plenty fast for my SUV needs. I even went so far as to recommend it to a friend, with the caveat that it wasn't the most refined ride in its class. Back when it was introduced, the FX stood alone among the sluggish stalwarts of the SUV set, blending a fair bit of functionality with some manner of sport. But with an interior by Playschool and a suspension made of granite, it didn't quite live up to buyer's expectations. Despite this, the FX still solidified its place as a niche vehicle in a segment that had yet to be defined. The 2009 model aims to do the same, but this time, Infiniti is attempting the same feat on a shoe-string budget with competitors that have gotten hip to the idea that a two-plus-ton beast should actually be engaging.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Truth; generation FX; friend; caveat; ride; class; FX; stalwarts; SUV set; bit; functionality; manner; sport; interior; Playschool; suspension; granite; buyer; expectations; FX; place; niche vehicle; segment; model; time; Infiniti; feat; budget; competitors; hip; idea; beast; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1295221725 12 3----Verdict----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 tasti:1 ts:1 benefit:1 exterior:1 infin:1 fx:2 distribut:1 wait:1 pack:1 torqu:2 ga:1 love:1 fm:1 level:1 variat:1 basic:1 drive:1 longer:1 downright:1 ft:2 option:2 plu:1 wind:1 liter:2 awd:2 get:1 midship:1 aesthet:1 class:1 shape:1 powertrain:1 system:1 price:1 attesa:1 sedan:1 shovel:1 retain:1 gt:1 bin:1 match:1 lb:2 util:1 wheelbas:1 rev:1 model:1 hp:2 weight:1 can:1 wheel:2 caution:1 paper:1 transmiss:1 automat:1 pilfer:1 push:1 mode:1 predecessor:1 throw:1 importantli:1 paddl:1 read:1 best:1 mean:1 asid:1 look:2 potent:1 standard:1 speed:1 entri:1 track:1 rear:1 choic:1 come:3 front:1 know:1 manual:1 wider:1 either:1 seven:1 downshift:1 architectur:1 rwd:1 nissan:1 part:1 excit:1 shifter:1 albeit:1 shift:1 found:1	||	Exterior aesthetics aside, the 2009 FX still retains the basic shape of its predecessor, albeit with a wider track and a longer wheelbase. But more importantly, it utilizes the same FM (front-midship) architecture as the G35 sedan. That means weight distribution is some of the best in its class (FX50 AWD 54/46, FX35 AWD 53/47, FX35 RWD 52/48) and a potent choice of powertrain options that look downright tasty on paper. The entry-level FX35 comes packing the VQ35HR, 3.5-liter V6 that we've come to know and love, shoveling out 303 hp and 262 lb.-ft. of torque to either the rear wheels or all four through a variation of the ATTESA E-TS system. If you throw caution to the wind (read: gas prices) you can option up to the FX50 with the VK50VE, 5.0-liter V8 that's pushing out 390 hp and 369 lb.-ft. of torque, and comes standard with all-wheel-drive. Both models benefit from a new, seven-speed automatic transmission with manual shift modes and downshift rev matching. Plus, Infiniti pilfered the parts bin to equip the FX with what look to be the same paddle shifters found on the Nissan GT-R. We're getting excited, but wait... there's more.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: FX; 	NOUN: Exterior aesthetics; FX; shape; predecessor; track; wheelbase; FM; front-midship; architecture; G35 sedan; weight distribution; class; FX50 AWD; FX35 AWD; FX35 RWD; choice; powertrain options; paper; FX35; VQ35HR; 3.5-liter V6; hp; lb.-ft; torque; wheels; variation; ATTESA E-TS system; caution; wind; read; gas prices; option; FX50; VK50VE; 5.0-liter V8; hp; lb.-ft; torque; standard; models; transmission; shift modes; rev matching; Plus; Infiniti; parts bin; FX; paddle shifters; Nissan GT-R; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Thankfully, it works as advertised. Set the cruise control at any speed between 1 and 90 mph and the FX keeps a safe (three-second) following distance from the car ahead. It's easy, functional and could turn into a necessity for those of us in traffic-choked urban areas. The same goes for the Around View Monitor, which uses four cameras (one in the front grille, another on the hatch and two more mounted underneath the side mirrors) to provide a seamless, bird's-eye view of the vehicle's surroundings. It worked flawlessly during our drive and prevented us from scraping those delicious dubs when trying to fit into a parking space in San Diego's Gas Lamp District. With those two easily understood features out of the way, let's get stuck in.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Intelligent Cruise Control; FX; 	LOCATION: San Diego; 	NOUN: Cruise Control; feature; anything; price tag north; 50k; part; FX; Technology Package; cruise control; speed; mph; FX; distance; car; necessity; areas; View Monitor; cameras; grille; hatch; side; bird; eye view; vehicle; surroundings; drive; parking space; San Diego; Gas Lamp District; features; way; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

A Plasmacluster Filtration system removes mold, fungi and other unwanted particles from the cabin and partners up with the Grape Polyphenol Filter to collect dust, squelch allergens, and, according to Infiniti, the deodorizing principals of both systems can suck up all manner of nasty smells, from farts to French fries.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: climate control system; setup; similarities end; Plasmacluster Filtration system; mold; fungi; particles; cabin; partners; Grape Polyphenol Filter; dust; allergens; Infiniti; principals; systems; manner; farts; fries; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1295221725 12 9----Safety----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	vehicl:2 test:1 pull:1 fx:1 enough:1 necessari:1 subtl:1 impact:1 feedback:1 haptic:1 fail:1 button:1 respond:1 action:1 laser:1 taken:1 happen:1 knee:1 prove:1 form:1 enabl:1 alert:1 random:1 effort:1 prevent:1 absolut:1 provid:1 much:1 size:1 scari:1 degre:1 system:5 appli:2 acceler:1 visual:1 touch:1 sound:1 angl:1 iba:1 evil:1 try:1 util:1 warn:2 thought:1 line:1 signal:1 road:1 disturb:1 push:2 lane:4 risk:1 mirror:1 infuri:1 shut:1 left:2 driver:2 forc:1 brake:2 dca:1 whenev:1 detect:2 tone:1 standard:1 departur:2 camera:1 rear:1 come:1 us:1 front:1 quickli:1 rout:1 begin:2 chime:1 fact:1 caus:1 dash:1 mount:1 steer:1 twist:1 actual:1 approach:1 insid:1 reduc:1	||	Let's begin with the DCA, which uses a laser detection system in front to warn drivers that they're approaching a vehicle too quickly. The system responds to the risk by providing haptic feedback in the form of a subtle push back on the accelerator. Failing that, the IBA system will alert the driver with a tone and a visual signal on the dash. If no action is taken, it begins applying the brakes in an effort to reduce the force of the impact. Too much you say? Try this on for size: The 2009 FX comes standard with a Lane Departure Warning system that utilizes a	##false@@false$$	camera mounted above the inside mirror to detect if the vehicle has left its lane (more than two-degrees of steering angle and it shuts off). While the absolutely infuriating chime that sounded whenever we happened to touch a line on some of the twisting roads that made up our test route was enough to cause random button-pushing above our left knee, even more disturbing is the fact that if you enable the Lane Departure Prevention system, it will actually apply one of the rear brakes to pull you back into the lane. Scary? We thought so too, but it could prove to be a necessary evil.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: DCA; IBA; Lane Departure Warning; Lane Departure Prevention; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: DCA; laser detection system; front; drivers; vehicle; system; risk; feedback; form; push; accelerator; IBA system; driver; tone; signal; dash; action; brakes; effort; force; impact; size; FX; standard; Lane Departure Warning system; camera; mirror; vehicle; lane; two-degrees; angle; chime; line; roads; test route; button-pushing; knee; fact; Lane Departure Prevention system; brakes; lane; evil; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
