While some of its competitors featured jacked-up ride heights and butch aesthetics, the all-wheel-drive Subaru didn't sit that much higher than a typical station wagon -- and it kind of looked like one, too. Despite this quirky model's loyal following among folks in colder climes, Subaru decided it was time to tackle the segment leaders head-on. Enter the fully redesigned 2009 Subaru Forester.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Subaru Forester; Subaru; Subaru; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Subaru Forester; entrant; crossover SUV class; fact; class; competitors; ride heights; butch aesthetics; Subaru; station wagon; model; following; folks; climes; Subaru; time; segment leaders; Subaru Forester; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
959204525 0 2----Exterior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	ride:1 squar:1 rug:1 greater:1 can:1 test:1 give:1 treatment:1 overal:1 ground:1 road:1 compact:1 although:1 style:1 suv:1 combin:1 longer:1 middl:1 look:1 platform:1 taller:1 inch:4 ey:1 redesign:1 competit:1 forest:3 like:1 tradit:1 clearanc:1 owner:1 base:1 impreza:1 chang:1 chop:1 persona:1 unprecedentedli:1 wheelbas:1	||	Although it's still based on the same platform as the compact Impreza, which was itself redesigned for 2008, this new Forester can look the competition square in the eye. The 2009 Forester rides on a 103.0-inch wheelbase, some 3.6 inches greater than before. It's also 3 inches longer overall, about an inch taller and has more ground clearance. Combined with a more traditional SUV styling treatment, these changes give the Forester an unprecedentedly rugged persona, even if few owners are likely to put its middling off-road chops to the test.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2008; 2009; 	NOUN: platform; Impreza; Forester; competition square; eye; Forester rides; wheelbase; inches; inches; inch; ground clearance; SUV styling treatment; changes; Forester; persona; owners; chops; test; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
959204525 0 3----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	gener:1 overal:1 travel:1 expect:1 roll:1 compact:1 free:1 height:1 expand:1 along:1 place:1 happili:1 doubl:1 control:1 wishbon:1 extra:2 hold:1 wagon:1 rigid:1 forest:2 attract:1 legroom:1 outgo:1 clearanc:1 compliant:1 retain:1 lot:1 increas:1 ride:1 trade:1 ground:1 add:1 space:1 cargo:1 thank:1 strut:1 layout:1 setup:1 especi:1 corner:2 dramat:1 rear:3 track:1 sport:2 front:1 handl:1 suspens:3 carlik:1 wider:1 chassi:1 comfort:1 base:1 improv:1 insid:1 construct:1 bounc:1	||	The outgoing model's carlike handling has generally been retained, thanks to improved chassis rigidity, wider front and rear tracks and a new double-wishbone rear suspension in place of the old car's strut-based setup. However, don't expect the new Forester to corner like a sport wagon -- extra height and ground clearance along with increased suspension travel add up to lots of bounce and roll in corners. Happily, the trade-off is a compliant ride, and the compactness of the new suspension frees up extra space inside -- especially in the cargo hold. Rear legroom and overall comfort have also been dramatically expanded, and the new Forester sports a well-constructed and attractive control layout.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: model; handling; thanks; chassis rigidity; front; tracks; suspension; place; car; setup; Forester; sport wagon; height; ground clearance; suspension travel; lots; bounce; roll; corners; trade-off; ride; compactness; suspension; space; cargo hold; legroom; comfort; Forester sports; control layout; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

And although there are no major engine upgrades for 2009, the Forester's performance remains satisfactory. We're not sure why Subaru elected to offer the Forester with a four-speed automatic transmission instead of the company's five-speed unit, as this puts the redesigned crossover at a distinct disadvantage relative to top-selling competitors like the Honda CR-V and Toyota RAV4. On the whole, though, the 2009 Subaru Forester has outgrown its quirky phase and looks like a legitimate contender for the compact crossover SUV crown.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Subaru; Honda; Toyota; Subaru Forester; 	DATE: 2009; 2009; 	NOUN: Forester; people; SUV; drives; car; security; AWD; engine upgrades; Forester; performance; Subaru; Forester; transmission; company; unit; crossover; disadvantage; competitors; Honda CR-V; Toyota RAV4; whole; Subaru Forester; phase; contender; crossover SUV crown; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Forester XT models have a turbocharged version of this engine that churns out 224 hp and 226 lb-ft of torque. The automatic transmission is mandatory on turbocharged models. Every Forester is equipped with AWD. While the six-speed automatic transmission is standard, it does allow easy manual control of the gears helpful when driving enthusiastically or on mountain roads. In Drive, we find the transmission to be nicely responsive; however, upshifts can be somewhat harsh. Crisp handling and impressive grip help take advantage of the turbocharged engine's power, and the 2009 Mazda CX-7 corners quite flat, considering its nearly two-ton weight and tall stance. Ride quality is mostly smooth, but larger bumps can be jarring, and coarse road surfaces make the interior uncommonly noisy. Front-row accommodation in the 2009 Mazda CX-7 is good; the seats allow plenty of space and hold you in place. The story is not so good farther back; there's no third row, and the second row is smaller than most would expect from a mid-size ute especially in legroom and there s barely space to fit three across. Folding the backseats down allows 70 inches of flat floor space for cargo, although it's not particularly roomy or convenient given the sloping roofline, rakish hatch, and tall loading height. The cargo floor can, however, be flipped over to a washable surface for carrying dirty items. Mazda could learn a thing or two in packaging from its Asian rivals as there are few storage spaces for small items.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; Mazda; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: theme; CX-7; interior; cockpit; sports coupe; SUV; dashboard; windshield; Front-row accommodation; Mazda CX-7; seats; plenty; space; place; story; row; row; ute; legroom; space; backseats; inches; floor space; cargo; sloping roofline; hatch; height; cargo floor; surface; items; Mazda; thing; packaging; rivals; storage spaces; items; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-166756491 9 1----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	littl:1 intercool:1 rake:1 variabl:1 engin:1 line:1 transmiss:1 automat:1 torqu:1 mode:1 six:1 cylind:1 suv:1 horsepow:1 fuel:1 cam:1 ft:1 twincam:1 look:1 direct:1 liter:1 turbocharg:1 speed:1 coup:1 inject:1 sport:2 windshield:1 sleek:1 cx:1 manual:1 loudli:1 specif:1 inspir:1 match:1 lb:1 underhood:1 phase:1 shift:1 rx:1 cross:1	||	With its sleek, RX-8-inspired lines and well-raked windshield, the CX-7 looks like a cross(over) between a sports coupe and an SUV. -166756491 9 2----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 interior:2 reconfigur:1 higher:1 good:1 contradictori:1 necessari:1 function:2 center:2 amount:1 independ:1 requir:1 level:1 height:2 damp:1 correct:1 deal:1 drive:3 purpos:1 light:1 final:1 control:1 ignor:1 famili:2 coup:2 extra:1 wagon:2 class:1 far:1 describ:1 qualiti:1 cx:2 meet:1 commonli:1 tune:2 aspect:1 sedan:3 eas:1 better:1 materi:1 compromis:1 leav:1 match:1 low:1 util:1 car:1 ride:1 utilitarian:2 weight:2 graviti:2 road:2 space:2 closer:1 spring:1 cargo:1 ensur:1 passeng:1 rate:1 mazda:1 suv:1 practic:2 mean:1 usual:1 emphasi:1 manag:1 paramount:2 sport:5 averag:1 fulli:1 offer:1 crossov:2 access:1 seem:1 suspens:2 compon:1 chassi:1 experi:3 comfort:1 correctli:1 larg:1 manner:2 competitor:1 excit:1 firmli:1 yet:1	||	Which leaves the chassis to finalize the deal. Here, requirements for a sports coupe (or sedan) and an SUV would seem contradictory. For a sports level of control and road manners, a correctly-tuned suspension, low center of gravity, and light weight are paramount. For utilitarian purposes, a large amount of interior space, reconfigurability of that interior space, and ease of access for passengers and/or cargo are paramount. This means height and, because of the extra material needed for that height, more weight and a higher center of gravity than a sedan or coupe. Mazda has managed the necessary compromises very well. The fully-independent suspension is tuned more firmly than usual for a crossover, but correct matching of spring and damping rates and quality components ensures good ride comfort. Road manners and the driving experience are closer to sports sedan than sport-utility, yet the CX-7s utilitarian aspects are not ignored. The crossover driving experience is most commonly describable as "family wagon", with the emphasis on functionality and practicality, not excitement. While the CX-7 is as functional and practical as any of its competitors, it also offers a driving experience far better than the class average. Family wagon meets sports car.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; 	NOUN: chassis; deal; requirements; sports coupe; sedan; SUV; sports level; control; road manners; suspension; center; gravity; weight; purposes; amount; space; reconfigurability; space; ease; access; passengers; cargo; height; material; height; weight; center; gravity; sedan; coupe; Mazda; compromises; suspension; crossover; matching; spring; rates; quality components; ride comfort; Road manners; experience; sports sedan; CX-7s; aspects; crossover; experience; family wagon; emphasis; functionality; practicality; excitement; CX-7; competitors; experience; class average; Family wagon; sports car; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-166756491 9 5----Exterior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	sporti:1 kick:1 lower:2 appear:1 arch:1 rake:1 proport:1 promin:1 higher:1 height:1 slope:1 interest:1 combin:1 element:1 coup:1 headlight:1 cx:2 eyepoint:1 suggest:1 tradit:1 non:1 degre:1 bodi:1 window:1 sedan:1 definit:2 rx:1 entranc:1 utilitarian:1 car:2 defin:1 cabin:1 wheel:2 edg:1 truck:1 successfulli:1 passeng:1 style:2 mazda:1 suv:3 look:1 rooflin:1 exactli:1 rear:1 sport:2 windshield:1 front:1 intent:1 fascia:1 neither:1 influenc:1 box:1	||	APPEARANCE:	##true@@false$$	If not exactly sports coupe (or even sedan) in looks, neither is the CX-7 a utilitarian box. The 66-degree windshield rake is its defining styling element. The sloping roofline and kick-up of the lower edge of the windows above the rear wheel further suggest a sports intent. The passenger cabin is car, not SUV, in entrance height. The lower body is higher than a car's, for interesting and definitely non-car proportions. With RX-8 influence in its front fascia, headlights, and prominent wheel arches, the CX-7 is also definitely not a traditional truck of an SUV. But it does successfully combine the high eyepoint of an SUV with sporty Mazda styling.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; 	NOUN: APPEARANCE; sports coupe; sedan; looks; CX-7; box; windshield rake; styling element; sloping roofline; kick-up; edge; windows; wheel; sports intent; passenger cabin; car; SUV; entrance height; body; car; proportions; RX-8 influence; fascia; headlights; wheel arches; CX-7; truck; SUV; eyepoint; SUV; Mazda styling; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-166756491 9 6----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	anyth:1 person:1 plastic:1 reason:1 higher:1 spot:1 seat:5 aluminum:1 year:1 place:1 knob:1 screen:1 anti:1 cushion:1 upright:1 peopl:1 system:3 surfac:1 touch:1 floor:1 packag:1 distanc:1 split:1 load:1 small:1 posit:1 littl:1 visibl:1 aid:1 road:1 space:1 cargo:1 overli:1 six:1 short:1 extern:1 bose:1 contemporari:1 mini:1 look:1 fifth:1 front:1 us:1 access:1 technolog:1 sit:1 comfort:3 larg:1 interfac:2 base:1 debut:1 mid:1 tour:1 ago:1 consol:1 player:1 foot:1 seriou:1 hip:1 lcd:1 possibl:1 good:1 function:1 uniqu:1 height:1 level:2 equival:1 grand:1 basic:1 metal:1 hood:2 seatback:1 leather:1 doubl:1 control:1 intuit:1 coup:1 easier:1 class:1 cx:2 size:1 roof:2 trunk:1 window:1 near:2 sedan:4 sound:1 sacrific:1 quarter:1 room:1 panel:1 call:1 jack:1 allow:2 appoint:1 navig:1 twin:1 passeng:1 fit:1 upper:1 area:1 style:2 mazda:1 mean:1 driver:1 middl:1 trim:1 music:1 audio:2 matter:1 vision:1 glare:1 rear:3 windshield:1 liftov:1 sport:1 instrument:2 pretens:1 adult:1 fold:2 climat:1 great:1 nearli:1 ad:1 cluster:1 occup:1 blind:1	||	COMFORT:	##true@@false$$	With no pretensions to off-road use, the CX-7 sits little higher than a sedan. Access is, if anything, easier than a sedan or coupe, as the seat cushion height will be near hip level for most people. This also allows a comfortably upright seating position for all occupants. Driver visibility is good, aided by the small front quarter windows that allow vision into what could be serious blind spots. The "double-roof" instrument panel, so-called by Mazda because of the anti-glare hood ("roof") over the instrument cluster and the second "hood" near the base of windshield, is unique, but does not sacrifice function to style. Passenger space is equivalent to a large mid-size sedan, meaning that four adults fit in comfort, with a fifth person possible in the rear for short distances. The seatback folds with a 60/40 split, and liftover to the cargo area is not overly high. With the rear seat in place, there is more room than in a sedan trunk. With the rear seat folded, there is a nearly six-foot long load floor. At the Grand Touring level, the CX-7 is sport-contemporary in style and upper-middle class in basic appointment. Seating surfaces are leather, but trim is metal-look plastic, not aluminum, if that matters. (It doesn't.) The climate system is controlled through twin knobs, but with the Technology Package, the audio and navigation system are interfaced through the LCD touch screen. The interface is reasonably intuitive, and the Bose audio system has a great sound. A mini-jack in the console for an external music player has been added since the car's debut two years ago.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; Technology Package; LCD; 	NOUN: COMFORT; pretensions; use; CX-7; sedan; Access; anything; sedan; coupe; seat cushion height; hip level; people; position; occupants; Driver visibility; quarter windows; vision; spots; instrument panel; Mazda; hood; roof; instrument cluster; hood; base; windshield; function; style; Passenger space; sedan; adults; comfort; person; rear; distances; seatback; split; liftover; cargo area; seat; place; room; sedan trunk; seat; load floor; Grand Touring level; CX-7; style; class; appointment; surfaces; leather; plastic; aluminum; matters; climate system; twin knobs; Technology Package; audio; navigation system; LCD; screen; interface; Bose audio system; sound; mini-jack; console; music player; car; debut; years; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-166756491 9 7----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	energi:1 structur:1 distribut:1 protect:1 highwai:1 surround:1 impact:3 six:1 dual:1 airbag:1 minim:1 help:1 absorpt:1 rate:1 frontal:1 side:2 fuel:1 administr:1 head:1 leakag:1 tank:1 major:1 crashworthi:1 safeti:3 standard:1 rear:1 star:2 front:2 receiv:1 cx:1 maida:1 nation:1 curtain:1 system:1 traffic:1 compon:1 advanc:1 rollov:1 chanc:1	||	SAFETY:	##true@@false$$	Mazda's Advanced Impact energy Distribution and Absorption System (MAIDAS) helps the CX-7 to receive a five-star safety rating for frontal and side-impact crashworthiness, and four stars for rollover protection from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The fuel tank is surrounded by major structural components, to minimize the chance of leakage in a rear impact. Six airbags, dual front, front side, and head curtain, are standard.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; Advanced Impact; National Highway Traffic Safety Administration; 	NOUN: SAFETY; Mazda; Advanced Impact energy Distribution; Absorption System; MAIDAS; CX-7; safety rating; crashworthiness; stars; rollover protection; National Highway Traffic Safety Administration; fuel tank; components; chance; leakage; impact; airbags; front; side; head curtain; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-166756491 9 8----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	unibodi:1 sporti:1 percent:1 singl:1 calip:1 slipperi:1 macpherson:1 notic:1 torqu:4 disc:1 help:4 drive:1 dynam:1 profil:1 control:2 rigid:1 multilink:1 cx:2 tune:1 provid:1 tire:1 solid:1 system:2 strong:1 divert:1 definit:1 split:1 stiff:1 output:1 antilock:1 decidedli:1 ride:3 characterist:1 stop:1 weight:1 convent:1 moder:1 seri:1 wheel:3 can:1 quick:1 activ:1 spring:1 ensur:1 twin:1 stabl:1 strut:1 offset:1 brake:1 condit:1 direct:1 standard:1 ventil:1 inch:1 firm:1 traction:1 rear:3 sport:1 front:2 despit:1 stabil:1 shock:1 around:1 handl:2 suspens:1 mount:1 larg:1 comfort:1 appropri:1 steer:2 piston:2 rel:1 keep:1	||	RIDE AND HANDLING:	##true@@false$$	The CX-7's rigid unibody also helps its decidedly sporty ride and handling characteristics by providing a solid mount for its sport-tuned MacPherson strut front, multilink rear suspension. It has a firm but comfortable ride, with moderately stiff springs and shocks offset by relatively high-profile 60-series tires on 18-inch wheels. Steering is direct and appropriately weighted, and there is no noticeable torque steer despite the engine's strong torque output. The Active Torque Split all-wheel drive system, which can divert up to 50 percent of the engine's torque to the rear wheels, definitely helps there. It also helps in slippery conditions. Large antilock ventilated disc brakes all around, with twin-piston front and conventional single-piston rear calipers, ensure quick stops. Standard traction control and dynamic stability control systems help keep the CX-7 stable.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: MacPherson; 	NOUN: CX-7; unibody; ride; characteristics; MacPherson strut front; suspension; firm; ride; springs; shocks; 60-series tires; wheels; torque; engine; torque output; Torque Split; drive system; percent; engine; torque; wheels; conditions; antilock; disc brakes; twin-piston front; calipers; stops; Standard traction control; stability control systems; CX-7 stable; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-166756491 9 9----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 lower:2 greater:1 intercool:1 higher:1 torqu:2 interest:1 rpm:2 ft:1 move:1 hill:1 form:1 respons:1 hold:1 wide:1 rod:1 traffic:1 ratio:2 low:1 rev:2 smooth:1 optimum:1 engin:2 road:1 transmiss:1 ensur:1 version:1 six:1 consumpt:1 forg:1 noth:2 turbo:1 similar:1 direct:2 surprisingli:1 turbocharg:2 us:2 enjoy:1 despit:1 quickli:1 differ:1 befit:1 downshift:1 rotari:1 modif:1 crankshaft:1 keep:1 player:1 normal:1 perfectli:1 perform:3 kei:1 cylind:1 gear:2 power:2 twincam:1 longev:1 hood:1 emiss:1 work:2 control:1 liter:1 cx:3 logic:1 compress:1 input:1 throttl:1 strong:1 maximum:1 definit:1 late:1 lb:1 fast:1 rx:1 countri:1 weight:1 connect:1 allow:1 can:2 quick:1 recent:1 automat:1 minim:1 lag:1 horsepow:2 mean:1 fuel:2 develop:1 valv:1 speed:1 inject:2 manual:1 mission:1 featur:1 descend:1 spread:1 shift:2	||	PERFORMANCE:	##true@@false$$	"CX-7" has nothing to do with the late rotary-powered RX-7. Which doesn't mean that there is nothing interesting under the hood. There most definitely is, in the form of a direct fuel-injection, turbocharged and intercooled version of Mazda's 2.3-liter twincam, 16-valve four-cylinder engine. Direct injection allows a higher compression ratio, for greater power, lower emissions and fuel consumption, and minimal turbo lag. Forged connecting rods and crankshaft ensure longevity. The engine is similar to that used in the recent Mazdaspeed6 and Mazdaspeed3, but features a different turbocharger and other modifications to develop horsepower and torque at lower revs, as befits the CX-7's mission. With a maximum of 244 horsepower at 5000 rpm and 258 lb-ft of torque at a low 2500 rpm, response to throttle input is fast and strong. There is no need to keep the revs up. Despite its weight, the CX-7 can get up and move quickly. The six-speed automatic is a key player in its performance, with smooth, quick shifts and a wide gear ratio spread. For most normal use it works perfectly well in D, but it can be manually shifted for optimum performance and enjoyment on country roads or in traffic. Even then D works surprisingly well, as the transmission control logic holds gears and even downshifts descending hills.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; 	NOUN: PERFORMANCE; CX-7; nothing; RX-7; nothing; hood; form; fuel-injection; version; Mazda; twincam; engine; injection; compression ratio; power; emissions; fuel consumption; turbo lag; rods; crankshaft; longevity; engine; Mazdaspeed6; Mazdaspeed3; turbocharger; modifications; horsepower; torque; revs; befits; CX-7; mission; maximum; horsepower; rpm; lb-ft; torque; rpm; response; input; need; revs; weight; CX-7; player; performance; shifts; gear ratio spread; use; D; performance; enjoyment; country roads; traffic; D; transmission control logic; gears; hills; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-166756491 10 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	vehicl:2 arch:1 zoom:2 door:1 murano:1 seat:1 drive:1 rang:1 curv:1 sleek:1 avail:1 suggest:1 curtain:1 degre:1 system:1 upholsteri:1 honda:1 rollov:1 low:1 wheel:2 rival:1 engin:1 deploy:1 transmiss:1 six:1 highland:1 latter:1 side:2 promot:1 rearview:1 turbocharg:1 messag:1 us:1 front:3 mx:1 either:1 fact:1 mount:1 debut:1 nissan:1 tour:4 sporti:2 detail:1 manipul:1 promin:1 midsiz:1 natur:1 type:1 heat:1 vue:1 cylind:1 mazdaspe:1 antiskid:1 gear:1 grand:2 fender:1 leather:1 lever:1 control:1 wagon:1 cx:6 lack:1 continu:1 gate:1 sedan:1 angl:1 gearshift:1 util:1 antilock:1 car:2 call:1 model:1 connect:1 saturn:1 navig:1 automat:1 toyota:1 airbag:2 passeng:1 style:1 mazda:2 pilot:1 suv:1 horsepow:1 driver:1 drawn:1 brake:1 includ:2 rooflin:1 standard:1 speed:1 camera:1 steep:1 traction:1 edit:1 sport:4 windshield:1 came:3 crossov:2 handl:1 manual:1 steer:1 ad:1 shift:1	||	Mazda's CX-7 debuted for 2007 as the company's first car-type, midsize sport-utility vehicle. This five-passenger four-door crossover wagon came in Sport, Touring, and Grand Touring models with either front- or all-wheel drive, the latter lacking low-range gearing. All CX-7s had a 244-horsepower turbocharged four-cylinder engine, drawn from the sporty MazdaSpeed 6 sedan, and a six-speed automatic transmission with a manual shift gate. When promoting the CX-7, Mazda continued the "zoom-zoom" message that it's used in connection with other vehicles, to suggest their sporty-handling nature. In fact, Mazda called the CX-7 its "sports crossover SUV." Sleek styling details included a steep (66-degree) windshield angle, prominent fender arches, and a curved roofline. Every CX-7 came with antilock braking and traction/antiskid control. Also standard were front side airbags and curtain side airbags with rollover deployment. Touring and Grand Touring editions added leather upholstery and heated front seats. Available for all was a navigation system with rearview camera. The steering wheel came from Mazda's MX-5 sports car, as did the driver manipulated a high-mounted gearshift lever. CX-7's rivals included the Honda Pilot, Nissan Murano, Saturn Vue, and Toyota Highlander.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; Mazda; Mazda; Mazda; Honda; Nissan Murano; Saturn; Toyota; 	DATE: 2007; 	NOUN: Mazda; CX-7; company; vehicle; crossover wagon; Sport; Touring; Grand Touring models; front; drive; CX-7s; engine; MazdaSpeed; sedan; transmission; shift gate; CX-7; Mazda; zoom-zoom; message; connection; vehicles; nature; fact; Mazda; CX-7; sports; SUV; details; windshield angle; fender arches; roofline; CX-7; traction\/antiskid control; side airbags; curtain side airbags; rollover deployment; Grand Touring editions; leather upholstery; seats; navigation system; rearview camera; wheel; Mazda; MX-5 sports car; driver; gearshift lever; CX-7; rivals; Honda Pilot; Nissan Murano; Saturn Vue; Toyota Highlander; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

It's pretty much the same engine that Mazda uses in its Mazdaspeed 3 sport hatchback, and in this application, it's good for a potent 244 horsepower. Acceleration, as you might expect, is brisk, with a 0-60 time better than just about any rival. But all that power has its price. The CX-7 is something of a gas guzzler, particularly on the highway. Some may also find the engine's power delivery to be less smooth than that of a V6.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: crossovers; offerings; CX-7; engine choice; engine; Mazda; Mazdaspeed; sport hatchback; application; horsepower; Acceleration; time; rival; power; price; CX-7; something; gas guzzler; highway; engine; power delivery; V6; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-166756491 0 9----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	hp:1 percent:2 loss:1 wheel:4 pair:1 normal:1 engin:1 good:1 road:1 torqu:1 automat:2 transmiss:1 situat:1 six:1 cylind:1 gear:1 rang:1 mazda:1 drive:3 power:2 sole:1 direct:1 liter:1 awd:1 turbocharg:1 speed:1 rear:1 traction:1 inject:1 feet:1 cx:2 avail:1 front:2 capabl:1 quickli:1 rout:1 manual:1 powertrain:1 appli:1 system:1 either:1 low:1 design:1 shift:1 pound:1	||	Either front-wheel drive or all-wheel drive is available on the 2009 Mazda CX-7. A turbocharged direct-injection 2.3-liter four-cylinder is paired with a six-speed automatic transmission with manual shift capability. This sole powertrain is good for 244 hp and 258 pound-feet of torque. Since the CX-7 isn't designed to go off road, there is no low-range gearing. In normal driving situations, the AWD system routes 100 percent of the engine's power to the front wheels. If there is a loss of traction, up to 50 percent of engine power is automatically and quickly applied to the rear wheels.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mazda; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: drive; drive; Mazda CX-7; direct-injection; transmission; shift capability; powertrain; hp; pound-feet; torque; CX-7; road; situations; AWD system; percent; engine; power; wheels; loss; traction; percent; engine power; wheels; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Braking performance is impressive, with fade-free stops from 60 mph in just 113 feet. Fuel economy estimates from the EPA rate the 2009 CX-7 AWD at 16 mpg city/22 mpg highway (or 18 mpg combined), while the two-wheel-drive version gets 17 mpg city/23 mpg highway (20 mpg combined). It s perky around town but not as energetic in high-speed passing, and it can be coarse-sounding when accelerating. The V-6 is another story; it s one of GM s smoothest V-6 engines and brings a responsive feel throughout the rev band. Handling is quite good in the Aura, reflecting the direct influence of GM s German operation, Opel. Seating is comfortable and supportive in the 2009 Saturn Aura. There's plenty of room in the rear, the spaciousness enhanced by extra knee room carved into the front seatbacks. Some testers feel the rear-seat cushion is too low and flat, while others gripe about the panel that covers the back of the front seats; its quality isn't up to the rest of the interior. Also, the "wood" on the dashboard and doors is a little too unconvincing. At 80 mph, the Aura's cabin remains surprisingly quiet.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: cabin; cloth interior; Seating; Saturn Aura; plenty; room; rear; spaciousness; knee room; seatbacks; testers; rear-seat cushion; others; panel; back; seats; quality; rest; interior; wood; dashboard; doors; mph; Aura; cabin; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1170183489 6 11----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	gener:1 xr:3 midsiz:2 electr:2 cylind:1 gasolin:1 antiskid:1 uplevel:1 drive:1 unavail:1 malibu:1 power:2 year:1 slow:1 leather:1 option:1 xe:3 batteri:1 control:2 consist:1 assist:1 pedal:1 curtain:1 powertrain:1 system:1 honda:1 upholsteri:1 price:1 chevrolet:1 sedan:4 onstar:1 hybrid:1 got:1 wheelbas:1 antilock:1 panel:1 car:1 model:4 hp:1 compet:1 wheel:2 seri:1 camri:1 engin:2 line:1 saturn:3 automat:3 transmiss:1 toyota:1 introduc:1 six:1 airbag:2 share:1 style:1 side:2 sell:1 motor:2 paddl:1 sunroof:2 adjust:1 horsepow:1 slide:1 major:1 brake:1 hatchback:1 panoram:1 includ:3 standard:2 maxx:1 tilt:1 speed:2 green:1 rear:1 traction:1 front:3 accord:1 came:1 section:1 climat:1 manual:1 differ:1 architectur:1 steer:1 aura:3 demis:1 altima:1 bow:1 nissan:1 pontiac:1 shift:1 divis:1	||	Aura bowed for 2007 as the first midsize car at General Motors' Saturn division since the demise of the slow-selling 2000-2004 L-Series. This V6 sedan shared a wheelbase and front-wheel-drive architecture with the Chevrolet Malibu Maxx hatchback and Pontiac G6 models, but differed in styling and price. Aura came in XE and uplevel XR models. The XE had a 224-horsepower V6 engine and a four-speed automatic transmission. Saturn's XR got a 252-hp V6 with a six-speed automatic, with steering-wheel paddles for manual shifting. Both models included antilock braking and traction control. An antiskid system was standard on XR, but unavailable for the XE sedan. Front side airbags and curtain side airbags were standard. So were automatic climate control and OnStar assistance. Options included leather upholstery, power-adjustable pedals, a sunroof, and a "panoramic" sunroof with a tilt-up front section and three rear-sliding panels. With the Aura, Saturn competed against major midsize sedans, including the Honda Accord, Nissan Altima, and Toyota Camry. During the 2007 model year, Saturn introduced a Green Line sedan with a hybrid (gasoline/electric) powertrain, consisting of a four-cylinder engine and battery-powered electric motor.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: General Motors; Saturn; Chevrolet Malibu Maxx; Saturn; Saturn; Honda Accord; Nissan Altima; Toyota Camry; Saturn; Green Line; 	DATE: 2007; 2007; 	LOCATION: Pontiac; 	NOUN: Aura; car; General Motors; Saturn division; demise; L-Series; V6 sedan; wheelbase; architecture; Chevrolet Malibu Maxx hatchback; Pontiac G6 models; styling; price; Aura; XE; uplevel XR models; XE; V6 engine; transmission; Saturn; XR; V6; paddles; models; traction control; system; XR; XE sedan; Front side airbags; curtain side airbags; climate control; OnStar assistance; Options; leather upholstery; pedals; sunroof; sunroof; front section; rear-sliding panels; Aura; Saturn; sedans; Honda Accord; Nissan Altima; Toyota Camry; model year; Saturn; Green Line sedan; hybrid; powertrain; engine; motor; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The six-speed automatic's gearing is well-matched to the four-cylinder, but under light acceleration the transmission didn't make the crispest shifts. This combination earns an EPA-rated 22/33 mpg, which Saturn says is the best mileage you can get in a mid-size car without buying a hybrid. Controls for the standard, six-speaker, AM/FM/CD/MP3/XM stereo, as well as the optional, 240-watt eight-speaker sound system include presets that are not band-specific; in other words, AM, FM and XM stations can exist in the same bank of buttons; no need to change bands. This makes a big difference when jumping around to your favorite stations in everyday use. For example, it takes just one press of a button to jump from your favorite AM talk radio station to your favorite FM music station or to your favorite XM news station. The XM display itself has been upgraded for 2009, so it can now display the artist name and song title simultaneously. The premium audio system has separate controls for rear-seat passengers and a pair of wireless headphones. Auxiliary input jacks are provided for iPods and other MP3 players.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: XM; XM; XM; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: controls; buttons; knobs; operation; Controls; standard; six-speaker; AM\/FM\/CD; MP3\/XM stereo; eight-speaker sound system; presets; words; AM; FM; XM stations; bank; buttons; need; bands; difference; stations; use; example; press; button; AM talk radio station; FM music station; XM news station; XM display; artist name; song title; premium audio system; controls; rear-seat passengers; pair; headphones; input jacks; iPods; MP3 players; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1170183489 5 27----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	phone:1 vehicl:1 benefit:1 servic:1 though:1 close:1 advis:2 free:1 danger:1 requir:1 oper:1 rare:1 button:1 rang:1 downsid:1 motion:1 turn:2 screen:1 troubl:1 onlin:1 advantag:1 cell:1 assist:1 avail:1 lack:1 guidanc:1 cost:1 inform:1 input:2 system:5 price:1 visual:1 touch:1 often:1 onstar:7 reduct:1 gp:1 car:1 complex:1 press:1 convent:1 can:1 facepl:1 navig:3 hang:1 upload:1 version:2 hand:1 reach:1 written:1 command:1 map:3 driver:1 displai:2 conveni:1 find:1 talk:1 direct:3 addit:1 safeti:1 includ:2 standard:1 come:2 voic:2 rout:1 unit:1 compon:1 take:1 instead:1 base:2 aura:2 featur:1 deliv:1 radio:1 latest:1 destin:3	||	A GPS navigation system is not available for the Aura, but the latest version of OnStar (version 7.0) includes turn-by-turn directions. This navigational feature delivers the guidance benefits of a conventional, map-based navigation system with voice commands. But instead of having to input destination information on a touch screen, which can be dangerous while in motion, the driver presses the OnStar button, and an OnStar adviser comes online to assist in finding the destination. After talking to you, the OnStar adviser uploads the route back to the OnStar unit in the car, hangs up and the system takes over. In addition to voice directions, the system displays written directions on the radio faceplate display. Downsides are the lack of a visual map, and the requirement that the vehicle be in range of cell phone service to input destinations, though we've rarely had trouble reaching OnStar. Advantages include the reduction in component complexity, the convenience and safety of hands-free operation, and cost: Map-based systems are often priced close to 2,000. OnStar comes standard on the Aura.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: GPS navigation system; Aura; version; OnStar; version; directions; feature; guidance benefits; navigation system; voice commands; input destination information; touch screen; motion; driver presses; OnStar button; OnStar adviser; online; destination; OnStar adviser; route; OnStar unit; car; system; addition; voice directions; system; directions; radio faceplate display; Downsides; lack; map; requirement; vehicle; range; cell phone service; input destinations; trouble; OnStar; Advantages; reduction; component complexity; convenience; safety; operation; cost; systems; OnStar; standard; Aura; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The Aura Hybrid's electric motor also develops significantly less torque for low-speed acceleration (44 pound-feet, against 76 for the Civic and a whopping 295 for the Prius). This suggests that the Aura Hybrid will depend more on its gasoline engine and less on its electric motor than the hybrid imports. That said, with 159 pound-feet of torque available from its gas engine alone, the Green Line should be able it uphold its honor in any traffic situation.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aura Hybrid; Green Line; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Aura Hybrid; gasoline engine; proportion; motor; Toyota Prius; horsepower gasoline; horsepower; Honda Civic Hybrid; horsepower gas; horsepower; Aura Hybrid; motor; torque; acceleration; pound-feet; Civic; Prius; Aura Hybrid; gasoline engine; motor; hybrid imports; pound-feet; torque; gas engine; Green Line; honor; traffic situation; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The base-model XE comes standard with 17-inch steel wheels with plastic covers, air-conditioning, full power accessories, cruise control, a trip computer, OnStar and a six-speaker CD/MP3 audio system with an auxiliary audio jack and satellite radio. Going with the four-cylinder XR gets you 17-inch alloy wheels, remote vehicle start, foglamps, leather seating, a power driver seat, heated front seats, Bluetooth and a leather-wrapped steering wheel with audio controls. The XR V6 is very similar but has 18-inch alloys, automatic climate control and an auto-dimming rearview mirror with a compass. Most of these features are available for the XE model as part of options packages. On the XR only, you can also get an eight-speaker audio system with redundant rear-seat audio controls (and two sets of wireless headphones), a six-CD changer and a power passenger seat. The more capable 3.6-liter V6 has an output of 252 hp and 251 lb-ft of torque; it's offered only for the XR trim. -1170183489 0 10----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	garner:1 test:1 highest:1 good:1 deploy:1 highwai:2 saturn:1 impact:1 disc:1 airbag:3 sensor:1 passeng:1 help:1 insur:1 frontal:1 seat:1 side:3 full:1 length:1 grade:1 administr:1 perfect:1 institut:1 brake:1 control:2 safeti:3 includ:1 standard:1 star:1 traction:1 doubt:1 mark:1 front:2 stabil:1 nation:1 curtain:1 traffic:1 aura:2 featur:2 improv:1 antilock:1	||	Standard safety features on the Saturn Aura include antilock disc brakes, traction control, stability control, front-seat side airbags and full-length side curtain airbags. Passenger sensors, new for 2009, improve front airbag deployment. For those seeking a balance of performance and fuel economy, there s a fuel-efficient 2.4-liter four-cylinder that makes 169 hp and returns 22 mpg in the city and 33 mpg on the highway. For those more interested in fuel economy, a mild-hybrid version (formerly known as the Aura Green Line) of the four-cylinder engine boosts fuel economy to an EPA-rated 26 city and 34 highway. The hybrid system is not as sophisticated as those found on the competition, but it does offer a small fuel-economy bump for a relatively small amount of cash. If acceleration is a concern, Saturn offers a 252-hp, 3.6-liter V-6 that returns 17 mpg in the city and 26 mpg on the highway. The V-6 is pretty quick and can accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in 6.2 seconds. Six-speed automatics are standard on all Auras except the hybrid, which comes with a four-speed auto.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Saturn; Saturn; 	NOUN: Saturn; Aura customers; powertrain options; balance; performance; fuel economy; hp; returns; mpg; city; mpg; highway; fuel economy; version; Aura Green Line; engine; fuel economy; city; highway; hybrid system; competition; fuel-economy bump; amount; cash; acceleration; concern; Saturn; V-6; mpg; city; mpg; highway; V-6; mph; seconds; automatics; Auras; hybrid; auto; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The four-cylinder model removes the CC from the stratosphere of	##false@@false$$	BMW	##false@@true$$	and	##false@@false$$	Audi	##false@@true$$	, back to the place where the	##false@@false$$	Accord	##false@@true$$	, the	##false@@false$$	Camry	##false@@true$$	, and the	##false@@false$$	Malibu	##false@@true$$	play. Set against a family-sedan backdrop, the CC s beautiful bod makes it a standout in a segment stacked with forgettable styling. And in pricing the four-cylinder CC, VW seems to have ignored the step that requires charging more for style, as the CC 2.0T actually costs 410 less than a comparably equipped Passat. So unless you need that fifth seat, you can now take the Passat off your shopping list. And in regard to the CC 3.6-liter s disturbingly high price, we predict low sales. On the other hand, the CC 2.0T may well strike a chord with buyers as it is the base model that is truly the people s CLS.	##false@@false$$	View Photo Gallery	##false@@true$$	PHOTOS (39)	##false@@true$$		||	ORGANIZATION: CLS; BMW; Audi; CC; VW; CLS; 	LOCATION: Malibu; 	NOUN: problem; CC; 4MOTION; existence; CC; T; manual; deficit; 2.0-liter; version; look; version; course; resemblance; CLS; model; CC; stratosphere; BMW; Audi; place; Accord; Camry; Malibu play; Set; backdrop; CC; bod; standout; segment; styling; CC; VW; step; style; CC; T; Passat; seat; Passat; shopping list; regard; CC 3.6-liter; price; sales; hand; CC; T; chord; buyers; base model; people; CLS; View Photo Gallery PHOTOS; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-469121700 1 4----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mpg:1 gener:1 relax:1 higher:1 natur:1 uncoop:1 outright:1 highwai:1 torqu:4 volkswagen:1 fussi:1 cylind:2 requir:1 uplevel:1 gruff:1 power:1 copiou:1 ft:1 curv:1 surg:1 option:2 ring:1 liter:1 respons:1 avail:1 like:1 sluggish:1 tradit:1 vw:2 acceler:1 owner:1 impress:1 due:1 angl:1 lb:1 match:1 odd:1 make:1 cc:1 pound:1 shame:1 hp:1 audi:1 pair:1 engin:2 recommend:1 variant:1 transmiss:3 automat:5 six:4 twin:1 consumpt:1 possess:1 clutch:1 fuel:1 horsepow:1 choos:1 thrust:1 direct:1 vocal:1 turbocharg:1 standard:1 speed:3 inject:1 come:1 sport:1 feet:1 suffer:1 excel:2 access:2 manual:1 dedic:1 dsg:1 narrow:1 demeanor:1 passat:1 base:2 nearli:1 somewhat:1 act:1	||	The excellent VW/Audi 2.0T four-cylinder engine, making 200 horsepower and 207 pound-feet of torque, is the base for the 2009 Volkswagen Passat CC. The base Sport comes standard with a six-speed manual; a six-speed automatic transmission is optional. The direct-injected, turbocharged four-cylinder acts like a six, with copious torque and a generally relaxed demeanor, nearly matching the uplevel V-6's acceleration and ringing in at 31 mpg on the highway. It's a shame VW chooses not to pair this engine with its excellent DSG twin-clutch automatic, as the traditional automatic transmission suffers from sluggish responses and odd surging. The 3.6-liter variant of VW's narrow-angle V-6 (VR6) is optional, but we recommend against it due to its somewhat gruff and vocal nature, less accessible torque curve, and higher fuel consumption. As well, it is available only with the fussy six-speed automatic. Outright power (280 hp, 265 lb-ft torque) in the V-6 is impressive, but accessing that thrust through the uncooperative automatic transmission requires dedication that few owners will likely possess.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Volkswagen Passat CC; Sport; VW; VW; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: VW\/Audi; T; engine; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; base; Volkswagen Passat CC; base Sport; standard; manual; transmission; acts; torque; demeanor; uplevel V-6; acceleration; ringing; mpg; highway; shame VW; engine; DSG twin-clutch; transmission; responses; variant; VW; V-6; VR6; nature; torque curve; fuel consumption; six-speed; power; hp; torque; V-6; transmission; dedication; owners; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

To be sure, the CC is about style, not so much function, and as such the middle rear seat is eschewed for a comfy armrest and built-in cup holders. We find this touch perfectly appropriate for its target market. But the low seating position and poor view out the rear might trouble some drivers. Visibility is nearly as poor as that of some low-slung sportscars; the steeply raked windshield and backlight provide a rather narrow slit through which to view the world. They re	##false@@false$$	beautiful	##true@@false$$	The unbroken, curved sections that frame the bottom cushions are particularly daring compared with regular car seats, and the seats as a whole serve as a great example of how interesting design doesn t have to impinge on functionality or comfort; they strike just the right balance between sporty grippiness and long-haul cushiness. Styling permeates everything else, too. Even the trench that hides the windshield vents was clearly carefully considered, adding a bit of drama to the forward view. -469121700 12 16----DriveRide----#text.P.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 littl:2 model:1 ll:1 test:1 drop:1 run:1 difficult:1 automat:1 mode:2 six:1 dual:1 reach:1 drive:1 languid:1 clutch:1 year:1 driver:1 stuck:1 right:1 lever:1 hook:1 respons:2 speed:1 sport:2 eager:1 sauci:2 like:1 rapid:1 fire:1 gate:1 manual:1 dsg:1 bit:2 throttl:1 felt:1 upshift:1 better:1 gti:1 spirit:1 tiptron:2 make:1 shift:1 found:1	||	In our 2009 test car, the 2.0T was hooked to a six-speed Tiptronic automatic. There s a manual mode, but the gate is to the right, making it a difficult reach for the driver during spirited driving. We stuck with dropping the shift lever in S (sport) when we felt a little bit saucy. But a little bit saucy is all you ll get, as throttle response is too languid for all-out runs and the Tiptronic is too eager to upshift even in sport mode. The 2010-model-year 2.0T has the rapid-fire dual-clutch DSG also found in the GTI, so responses are likely to be better.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: GTI; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: test car; T; Tiptronic; mode; gate; right; reach; driver; driving; shift lever; S; sport; bit saucy; bit saucy; throttle response; runs; Tiptronic; sport mode; T; dual-clutch DSG; GTI; responses; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The sticker after destination was 28,225. It comes pretty well-equipped at that price, but it did have a six-speed manual transmission, which most buyers aren't looking for. Heated, power, imitation-leather seats; a six-CD stereo; steering-wheel audio controls; a trip computer; and 17-inch wheels are all standard at that price. The leatherette seating was acceptable; like a famous scene in "Pulp Fiction," in which hitmen tried to disguise a bloody car interior, it's good enough to look fine at a passing glance. Get stopped by car connoisseurs, however, and they'll spot the faux leather instantly. Its texture is a bit rubbery, and on hot days it may remind those old enough to remember of vinyl seats. It was similar to what I've experienced when driving at high speeds with the sunroof or a single rear window open -- except the CC did it with all the windows and the sunroof closed. I've never encountered anything quite like it, and I don't know if it's a characteristic of the CC or just a strange flaw unique to my test car, but it sure did make for a lot of unpleasant hours on the highway.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: CC; Volkswagen; CC; 	LOCATION: reproach; 	NOUN: CC; Volkswagen; handling; reproach; bit; ride; cabin; types; highways; low-frequency vibration; backside; eardrums; speeds; sunroof; rear window; CC; windows; sunroof; anything; characteristic; CC; flaw; test car; lot; hours; highway; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Turns out that VW has that covered: For 2009, they've chopped the Passat down to a single model, the ridiculously overpriced 2.0T Komfort (29k with vinyl seats and a 4-cylinder engine). Features like a manual transmission, V6 engine, dual-zone climate control, leather seats, and all-wheel-drive have been stricken from the Passat's option list. -469121700 3 2----Verdict----#text.P.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	lower:1 percent:1 rake:1 door:2 besid:1 volkswagen:1 uniqu:2 unashamedli:1 seat:1 longer:1 famili:1 coup:2 told:1 class:2 describ:1 borrow:1 vw:1 bodi:1 sedan:2 sound:1 cl:2 underpin:1 everydai:1 cc:5 wheelbas:1 call:1 idea:1 version:1 share:1 style:1 tell:1 look:1 sheetmet:1 standard:1 rooflin:1 inch:3 exactli:1 merced:1 origin:1 windshield:1 us:1 instrument:1 familiar:1 steepli:1 wider:1 take:1 passat:5 instead:1 benz:1 part:1	||	Volkswagen calls the Passat CC a four-door coupe. If that sounds familiar, it's because that is exactly how Mercedes-Benz describes its	##false@@false$$	CLS-class	##false@@true$$	. The Passat CC unashamedly borrows from that idea, taking most of its underpinnings from the standard Passat, as does the CLS from the E-class. But instead of everyday-family-sedan styling, the Passat CC looks, well, more like a coupe. The windshield and the roofline are more steeply raked, and the body is longer (by 0.7 inch), lower (by 2.2 inches), and wider (by 1.3 inches); the wheelbase is the same. Besides the unique sheetmetal, the Passat CC has unique doors, seats, and instruments. All told, VW tells us the CC version shares about 50 percent of its parts with the original sedan.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Volkswagen; Passat CC; Mercedes-Benz; Passat CC; CLS; Passat CC; Passat CC; VW; CC; 	NOUN: Volkswagen; Passat CC; coupe; Mercedes-Benz; CLS-class; Passat CC; idea; underpinnings; Passat; CLS; E-class; styling; Passat CC; coupe; windshield; roofline; body; inch; inches; inches; wheelbase; sheetmetal; Passat CC; doors; seats; instruments; VW; CC version shares; percent; parts; sedan; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Unlike in a coupe, there s actually plenty of legroom. Headroom isn t as much of a compromise as the roofline would suggest and is far better than that of the Mercedes CLS. Passengers over six feet tall will be brushing the headliner, but anyone shorter will find plenty of comfort.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Passat CC; Mercedes CLS; 	NOUN: coupe theme; Passat CC; seats; storage console; armrest; middle; coupe; legroom; Headroom isn t; compromise; roofline; Mercedes CLS; Passengers; feet; brushing; headliner; anyone; plenty; comfort; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The fine, leather seats are well bolstered and firm but accommodate my broad beam just fine. The modern, stylish dash is directly from Passat and features sort of a three-tiered design. The top element forms a smooth brow over the gauges and the surface of the dash with an interesting visual separation near the windshield. Then a narrow strip of aluminum extends fully across the center separating the top from the lower dash. The center stack and controls are mostly simple and uncomplicated, though a bit more complex than then the simple Passat. Fit, finish and quality of materials are excellent. My only complaint is the tilt/adjust release for the steering wheel that is way down the column where I can barely reach it. My pretty blonde couldn t even find it when she took the car. Entering destinations along the freeway was easy using the onscreen keyboard, but when we tried using the map to find waypoints on mountain highways, we ran into trouble. The system also includes traffic reporting, which would have been handy if there were any incidents on the freeways we initially set out on. But we had an unobstructed cruise in light traffic, and the CC offered excellent drive quality. The V-6 engine could barely be held back, putting us well over the speed limits before we realized it. The steering, transmission, and suspension were all silky smooth, while the cabin felt nicely insulated, further leading us to underestimate our speed. In the corners, some typical understeer made itself felt, but the engine was ready to send plenty of power to the front wheels, pulling us through the turns. With the six-speed automatic transmission in sport mode, we found it a little lazy on shifting, maintaining too high a gear when we got on the brakes before a corner, but once it downshifted, it held the lower gear long enough to build up speed on any ensuing straight-aways or keep the engine speed up enough for the next turn. In manual mode, paddles on the shifter let us choose the gears, with shifts occurring fast enough for our purposes. The suspension isn't particularly sport-tuned, and we felt a little body roll and travel when the car was subjected to fast cornering.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: end; drive; Into; fun portion; tour; navigation system; direction; highway; vigor; corners; understeer; engine; plenty; power; wheels; turns; transmission; sport mode; gear; brakes; corner; gear; speed; straight-aways; engine; turn; mode; paddles; shifter; gears; shifts; purposes; suspension; body roll; travel; car; cornering; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

You want to argue price? Okay the Passat starts at 28,300. The CC? 27,100. And the CC gets better gas mileage, too. So your total costs ought to be less. How's that possible? Probably because of improved aerodynamics, as the Passat is only 44 pounds heavier than the CC we tested. Of course, both cars have identical wheelbases and widths, though the CC is half an inch longer. Our tester had but one 375 option (Sirius) and a 750 destination charge, bringing the total to 28,225 75 less than a Passat. In fact, this is one of our favorite cabins currently on the market. It has the 'no compromise' character found in Piech-mandated VWs like the Phaeton and O.G. Touareg, though the absolute quality of the materials has been taken down a shelf or two. Still, imagine the haptic quality of an Audi without all the fussy, cluttered and oddly placed buttons. That's how VeeDub laid out the CC's controls. Props are given for the two-tone dash layout (in this case black and tan), which is a wonderful change of pace from the usual Germanic black-as-my-soul theme. Special praise is reserved for the two-tone, pleated leather seats all four of them. The quad thrones conspire with the overall roominess to make the cabin an excellent place to spend some time. Yes, if you're tall you'll want to sit up front as the sloping roof cuts into your headroom, though we placed a six-foot, four-inch guy back there and he only complained once.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: O.G. Yes, a couple. Volkswagen has chosen to follow Audi's lead and banish the manual handbrake in place of an electronic parking brake. Like the ever encroaching DSG, this very well may be the shape of things to come, but we don't like it. First of all, what's wrong with a handbrake? Second, the button to turn off the parking brake is on the extreme left side of the dashboard, where you'd find the ignition in a Porsche nowhere near the stick. Unlike Audi's method, which is in fact a little toggle switch you can pull up, the button on the CC is exactly that just a button. It s a promised delivered. The engine is always ready to push the CC, even at a modest push on the throttle, but stomp on it and the Volkswagen takes a moment to select a gear from the six available in its automatic transmission, finds it and then takes off. The transmission s intelligence also downshifts the transmission, actually rather significantly (we noticed at least two gears) with the electronic sensors detect downhill driving (e.g., foot off the gas, braking and still accelerating, ergo probably going down a hill).	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Volkswagen; 	NOUN: spread revs; torque peak; engine; rev range; engine; engine; CC; push; throttle; Volkswagen; moment; gear; transmission; transmission; intelligence; transmission; gears; sensors; foot; gas; ergo; hill; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-469121700 15 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	via:1 door:1 midsiz:1 pop:1 volkswagen:1 cylind:5 antiskid:1 level:1 seat:1 basic:1 oper:1 drive:2 power:2 along:1 luxuri:3 leather:1 option:2 sole:1 control:1 except:2 liter:2 coup:1 sibl:1 german:1 avail:2 team:1 ct:1 tradit:1 curtain:1 system:2 upholsteri:1 floor:1 packag:1 obstacl:1 sedan:3 antilock:1 cc:3 sleeker:1 model:4 wheel:3 pair:1 rival:1 engin:2 navig:1 automat:4 transmiss:2 introduc:1 version:3 six:3 airbag:3 share:1 style:1 side:3 paddl:1 sunroof:1 unlik:1 horsepow:2 volvo:1 trim:1 brake:1 usual:1 detect:1 rearview:1 safeti:1 includ:3 turbocharg:1 rooflin:1 standard:3 cadillac:1 speed:3 premium:1 camera:1 rear:2 traction:1 sport:8 front:3 us:1 came:2 technolog:1 manual:2 maxima:1 steer:1 passat:1 featur:1 instead:1 occup:1 nissan:1 shifter:1 pontiac:1 design:1	||	For 2009, Volkswagen introduced a new premium midsize sedan that shared its basic design with the German automaker's Passat. Unlike that traditional-styled sibling, the four-door CC had a sleeker, coupe-like roofline and seated four occupants instead of the usual five. CC sedans came in four trim levels: Sport, Luxury, VR6 Sport, and VR6 4Motion. Two engines were available. Standard on Sport and Luxury models was a 200-horsepower 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder. In Sport versions, that engine teamed with a six-speed manual or six-speed automatic transmission. Luxury CCs were automatic-only. Powering VR6 Sport and VR6 4Motion versions was a 280-horsepower 3.6-liter V6, paired solely with a six-speed automatic. Volkswagen's automatic transmission could be manually operated using the floor shifter in four-cylinder models, or via steering-wheel paddles in V6 versions. Four-cylinder models and the VR6 Sport came only with front-wheel drive; the VR6 4Motion sedan had all-wheel drive. Standard safety features included antilock brakes, traction control, an antiskid system, curtain side airbags, and front side airbags. Rear side airbags were optional. Leather upholstery, a power pop-up-only sunroof, and front and rear obstacle detection were standard on all models except the four-cylinder Sport. An optional Technology Package, available for all except that four-cylinder Sport, included a navigation system with a rearview camera. Rivals included the Nissan Maxima, Pontiac G8, and Volvo S60, along with the Cadillac CTS.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Volkswagen; Standard on Sport and Luxury; Volkswagen; Nissan Maxima; Volvo; Cadillac CTS; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Sport; Pontiac; 	NOUN: Volkswagen; premium; sedan; design; automaker; Passat; sibling; CC; roofline; occupants; CC sedans; levels; Sport; Luxury; VR6 Sport; VR6 4Motion; engines; Standard; Sport; Luxury models; Sport versions; engine; manual; transmission; Luxury CCs; VR6 Sport; VR6 4Motion versions; 3.6-liter V6; Volkswagen; transmission; floor shifter; models; paddles; V6 versions; models; VR6 Sport; front-wheel drive; VR6 4Motion sedan; drive; Standard safety features; brakes; traction control; system; curtain side airbags; side airbags; side airbags; Leather upholstery; power; sunroof; front; obstacle detection; models; Sport; Technology Package; Sport; navigation system; rearview camera; Rivals; Nissan Maxima; Pontiac G8; Volvo S60; Cadillac CTS; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Instead, the name stands for Comfort Coupe, but it's not a Passat coupe either -- it has four full doors. No, the CC is a sleeker, restyled version of VW's midsize sedan, intended for folks who want something more stylish and different than the typical family four-door. What's in a name, anyway?	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Volkswagen Passat CC; CC; VW; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Volkswagen Passat CC; Passat; name; Comfort Coupe; Passat coupe; doors; CC; version; VW; sedan; folks; something; family; name; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-469121700 0 2----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 sexi:1 lower:1 remark:1 took:1 midsiz:1 looker:1 almost:1 basic:2 slope:1 combin:1 taper:1 creat:2 charact:1 describ:1 class:1 vw:2 roof:2 powertrain:1 sedan:2 overhang:1 better:1 cl:1 stretch:1 case:1 wheelbas:1 cc:2 sleeker:1 upon:1 ravish:1 car:2 humdrum:1 line:3 transform:1 style:2 side:1 practic:1 rather:1 end:2 look:1 inch:2 dramat:1 merced:1 rear:1 front:1 radic:1 architectur:1 take:1 passat:2 base:1 actual:1 ad:1 respect:1 porsch:1	||	Like the Mercedes CLS, the VW CC was created by taking a rather practical sedan with humdrum styling (E-Class and Passat, respectively) and transforming it into a ravishing looker. In the case of the CC, VW took the basic Passat architecture -- same wheelbase, same powertrain, same basic interior -- and stretched out the overhangs by 0.6 inch and lowered the roof line by 2 inches. The front-end styling was made sleeker, a dramatic side character line was added and the rear end was tapered down from the radically sloped roof line in an almost Porsche-like way. It all combines to create a car that is remarkably better-looking than the car upon which it's based, one that could actually be described as sexy. You can't say that about most midsize sedans.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mercedes CLS; VW CC; VW; 	NOUN: Mercedes CLS; VW CC; sedan; styling; E-Class; Passat; looker; case; CC; VW; Passat architecture; wheelbase; powertrain; interior; overhangs; inch; roof line; inches; styling; side character line; end; roof line; way; combines; car; car; sedans; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-469121700 0 3----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	cabin:1 door:1 navig:1 add:1 carri:1 surround:1 mostli:1 though:1 center:1 upgrad:2 level:1 seat:3 vinyl:1 trim:2 leather:1 black:1 complet:1 control:1 tone:1 support:1 flair:1 sharp:1 convinc:1 qualiti:1 avail:1 attract:1 welcom:1 leatherett:1 bit:1 system:1 upholsteri:1 materi:1 featur:1 stitch:1 insid:1 touchscreen:1 design:1 cc:2 tan:1 cross:1	||	Inside, the CC mostly carries over the Passat's cabin, complete with high-quality materials and well-designed controls. The CC adds a bit of flair, though, with sharp two-tone seats available on every trim level -- tan seat centers and door trim surrounded by black. The seats have also been upgraded to be more supportive and feature attractive cross-stitched upholstery (in leather or convincing leatherette vinyl). Volkswagen's new touchscreen navigation system is another welcome upgrade.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: CC; CC; Volkswagen; 	NOUN: CC; Passat; cabin; materials; controls; CC; bit; flair; seats; level; tan seat centers; door; seats; feature; upholstery; leather; convincing leatherette vinyl; Volkswagen; touchscreen navigation system; upgrade; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-469121700 0 4----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:2 person:1 can:1 reason:1 slouch:1 bucket:1 outboard:1 notabl:1 line:1 bump:1 diagon:1 chew:1 though:1 fit:1 passeng:2 drawback:1 nevertheless:1 style:1 lai:1 seat:1 golf:1 middl:1 hair:1 taper:1 extrem:1 taller:1 backseat:1 miser:1 hold:1 headroom:1 rear:1 feet:1 come:1 sleek:1 anywai:1 sit:1 roof:1 bit:1 narrow:1 trunk:1 comfort:1 club:1 capac:1 gel:1 posit:1 shorter:1 influx:1	||	With this influx of style, though, come a few drawbacks. Most notably, the backseat can only hold two passengers in bucket seats, which are nevertheless extremely comfortable. The reason for the four-person capacity is that sleek, tapered roof line, which chews into rear headroom -- any middle passenger sitting on the bump would've been miserable anyway. As it is, those taller than 6 feet will still need to slouch down a bit in the outboard positions (or lay off the hair gel). The trunk is also shorter and narrower -- golf clubs will need to fit diagonally.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: influx; style; drawbacks; backseat; passengers; bucket seats; reason; capacity; roof line; chews; headroom; passenger; bump; feet; slouch; bit; outboard positions; hair gel; trunk; golf clubs; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-469121700 0 5----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:2 midsiz:1 good:1 pop:1 type:1 volkswagen:1 level:1 given:1 appeal:1 power:1 import:1 luxuri:1 throughout:1 advantag:1 like:1 provid:1 monei:1 acceler:1 honda:1 trunk:1 price:1 sedan:2 better:1 impress:1 bmw:1 economi:1 big:1 cc:2 audi:1 engin:1 version:1 neglig:1 drawback:1 passeng:1 style:1 mazda:1 practic:1 fuel:1 horsepow:1 trim:1 turbo:1 top:1 feel:1 turbocharg:1 regular:1 premium:1 ey:1 merced:1 choic:1 sport:2 produc:1 accord:1 mix:1 fact:1 passat:1 base:1 benz:1 altima:1 capac:1 nissan:1 albeit:1	||	So there are practical drawbacks to the 2009 Volkswagen CC. If a big trunk and five-passenger capacity is important, then a regular Passat or well-equipped versions of top midsize sedans like the Honda Accord, Mazda 6 or Nissan Altima will likely be better choices. However, with its high level of style and premium feel throughout, the CC is a very appealing sedan with the base turbocharged engine, which produces a good mix of fuel economy and power. The luxurious VR6 Sport trim is less impressive, however, given its eye-popping price of 38,000 and the fact that its 280 horsepower provides a negligible acceleration advantage over the turbo-4. For that type of money, you could have an Audi A4, BMW 328i or Mercedes-Benz C300 Sport -- albeit with less equipment.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Volkswagen CC; Honda; Mazda; Nissan Altima; Audi; BMW; Mercedes-Benz; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: drawbacks; Volkswagen CC; trunk; capacity; Passat; versions; sedans; Honda Accord; Mazda; Nissan Altima; choices; level; style; premium; CC; sedan; base; engine; mix; fuel economy; power; VR6 Sport; price; fact; horsepower; acceleration advantage; turbo-4; type; money; Audi A4; BMW; Mercedes-Benz C300 Sport; equipment; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The padded one-piece dash was also charcoal, with a handsome strip of brushed aluminum below it, and beneath that everything turned to the beige coloring. The door panels continued that color scheme, making it a striking cabin to enjoy. Add to this a set of sporty heated seats (12-way driver, 8-way passenger), which are some of the best in any car I ve driven in a long time, with the lower seating portion sculpted for excellent lower back support and comfort. Scion s Pure Price philosophy means that there s no haggling on price required, and as part of this streamlined buying experience you can also expect every Scion to have a long list of features to go along with Toyota s usual high build quality. The tC s list of standard features is truly impressive, especially when you consider it s sub 20k sticker price, and includes everything from 17-inch alloy wheels, a full compliment of power accessories including one-touch auto down windows and remote keyless entry, a panoramic moonroof, and one-touch driver s seat position memory. -1218740464 5 4----Price----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 particularli:1 scion:2 mpg:3 amongst:1 lead:2 highwai:4 ga:1 cylind:1 obviou:1 given:1 tc:4 drive:1 contend:1 liter:2 mitsubishi:2 categori:1 coup:2 pump:1 class:2 competit:1 wide:1 fair:1 provid:1 comparison:1 bit:1 price:1 honda:1 chevrolet:1 economi:2 gs:2 citi:4 compar:1 vari:1 littl:1 civic:3 displac:1 sub:1 hp:2 cobalt:3 wheel:1 engin:3 king:1 quit:2 smaller:1 clear:1 rate:1 leader:1 econom:1 fuel:2 especi:1 ex:1 disappoint:1 includ:1 standard:1 come:1 sport:2 front:1 eclips:3 featur:2 design:1 respect:1	||	Obvious contenders to the tC in the sub-20k front-wheel-drive coupe category include the Honda Civic EX, Chevrolet Cobalt Sport and Mitsubishi Eclipse GS. All feature 4-cylinder engines with less than 2.5-liters of displacement, but fuel economy varies quite widely amongst them. The tC does not fair particularly well at the gas pump compared to its competition, with the Civic s smaller 1.8-liter 140-hp engine providing class-leading fuel economy with 26 city and 34 highway mpg. The Cobalt Sport is also quite economical with 22 city and 32 highway mpg ratings, especially given its class-leading 171-hp engine. The tC and Eclipse GS are a bit disappointing by comparison, with 21 city/29 highway mpg for the Scion and 20 city/28 highway for the Mitsubishi. But on price the tC is king, coming in at 1,000 less than the Civic and 2,000 less than the Cobalt and Eclipse. The little Scion coupe is also a clear leader with respect to standard features and interior design.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda Civic EX; Mitsubishi Eclipse GS; Cobalt Sport; Eclipse GS; Mitsubishi; 	NOUN: contenders; tC; coupe category; Honda Civic EX; Chevrolet Cobalt Sport; Mitsubishi Eclipse GS; feature; engines; 2.5-liters; displacement; fuel economy; tC; gas pump; competition; Civic s; 140-hp engine; fuel economy; city; highway mpg; Cobalt Sport; city; highway mpg ratings; engine; tC; Eclipse GS; bit; comparison; city\/29 highway mpg; Scion; city\/28 highway; Mitsubishi; price; tC; king; Civic; Cobalt; Eclipse; Scion coupe; leader; respect; features; design; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The automatic is easier and, because of how it is geared, more efficient. But the economy gearing of the four-speed automatic means it's not the hot setup for drag racing, with a maximum overall ratio of around 10.8:1. The five-speed manual offers quicker acceleration performance, with an overall ratio of nearly 15:1 for much quicker acceleration in first gear. However, the automatic does move out smartly. And it's obviously much easier to live with in the stop-and-go and slow-and-go, eliminating the need to exercise your left leg on the clutch pedal. Unlike most cars, the tC gets slightly better highway mileage with the automatic, again because the manual has a lower 4.235 axle ratio.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: manual; tradeoffs; economy; means; setup; drag racing; maximum; ratio; manual; acceleration performance; ratio; acceleration; gear; slow-and-go; need; leg; clutch pedal; cars; tC; highway mileage; manual; axle ratio; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

1182177930 11 3----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	call:1 wheel:3 convent:1 moment:1 distribut:1 perform:1 acura:1 super:1 basic:1 drive:4 mean:1 power:1 driver:1 balanc:1 feel:1 awd:1 corner:1 rear:1 sh:1 handl:1 system:2 hairbal:1 stand:1 better:2 enhanc:1	||	Acura calls its all-wheel drive system the SH-AWD, which stands for Super Handling All-Wheel Drive. You get "enhanced high-performance cornering" which means it balances and distributes power better than rear or conventional all-wheel drive systems. Basically, you are to feel like a better driver during hairball driving moments. Three premium amenities packages are available: the Technology package adds a navigation system with voice recognition and integrated rearview camera parking assist, upgraded audio, HandsFreeLink (Bluetooth) wireless connectivity and a power tailgate; the Sport package includes the Technology package, as well as a sport suspension with active damper system, exclusive wheels and upgraded interior trim elements; and an Entertainment package boasts Acura's DVD Rear Entertainment system and heated rear seats. Because the MDX is an SUV, getting in is an upward movement. For little legs, that can be tough, and the MDX helps out with a flat step-in area, but running boards would have been better. If performance and handling are bigger priorities than family hauling, the BMW X5, Infiniti FX35 and Porsche Cayenne are worth taking a look at. Competitors on the family-friendly side of things include the Buick Enclave, Ford Flex Limited and Mazda CX-9 Grand Touring. The Sport Package includes all the Technology Package items, plus an active sport suspension, auto-leveling headlights, different 18-inch wheels, perforated leather upholstery and metallic interior trim. A five-speed automatic transmission with manual shift control is standard. The MDX features the same "Super Handling" AWD system (SH-AWD) found in Acura's RL and TL sport sedans, which is capable of transferring different levels of power to individual wheels to maximize traction and grip through turns and in inclement weather. In performance testing, we found that the MDX goes from zero to 60 mph in 8.1 seconds. Fuel economy is an estimated 15 mpg city/20 mpg highway and 17 mpg combined. When properly equipped, the MDX's maximum towing capacity is 5,000 pounds.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: MDX; MDX; MDX; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Acura; 	NOUN: MDX; V6; hp; pound-feet; torque; transmission; shift control; MDX; Super Handling; AWD system; SH-AWD; Acura; RL; TL sport sedans; levels; power; wheels; traction; grip; turns; weather; performance testing; MDX; mph; seconds; Fuel economy; mpg city\/20 mpg highway; mpg; MDX; maximum; capacity; pounds; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 12 9----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	yukon:1 engin:1 show:3 flow:2 pack:1 electr:1 navig:1 transmiss:1 escap:1 ga:1 taho:1 highland:1 center:1 real:1 time:1 indic:1 readout:1 motor:1 among:1 drive:1 power:3 mileag:2 displai:1 batteri:2 histori:1 screen:3 minut:1 recharg:1 monitor:1 standard:1 told:1 voltag:1 far:1 us:1 offer:1 past:1 els:1 much:1 embed:1 inform:2 system:1 charg:1 chart:1 hybrid:2 accordingli:1	||	Accordingly, the standard	##false@@false$$	navigation system	##false@@true$$	has an information screen showing the flow of power among the V-8, the transmission-embedded motors and the high-voltage battery pack. It also monitors the battery's charge. There's a real-time gas mileage readout with an indicator that shows whether you're driving on electric power, recharging the battery or using the engine. All told, the screen is more informative than the center display on the Yukon and Tahoe hybrids, which shows power flow but not much else, but it doesn't go as far as the Escape and Highlander hybrids, which both offer a second screen that charts mileage history over the past 15 to 30 minutes.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: navigation system; information screen; flow; power; V-8; motors; battery pack; battery; charge; gas mileage readout; indicator; power; battery; engine; screen; center display; Yukon; Tahoe hybrids; power flow; Escape; Highlander hybrids; screen; charts mileage history; minutes; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

On electric-only power or when the V-8 is in four-cylinder mode, the display says "Fuel Saver" a helpful indicator to encourage frugal driving habits. It's also eminently easier to reference than the Tahoe Hybrid's similar V8/V4 readout, which sits below its tachometer. (Warning: Automotive writers agree about as often as Congress. Assistant editor Joe Bruzek called the overhead location "horrible.")	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aspen Hybrid; Congress; 	PERSON: Joe Bruzek; 	NOUN: Aspen Hybrid; screen; dash; readout; windshield; gas mileage; power; V-8; mode; display; Fuel Saver; indicator; habits; Tahoe Hybrid; V8\/V4 readout; tachometer; Warning; Automotive writers; Congress; Assistant editor Joe Bruzek; overhead location; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 12 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	yukon:1 convent:1 engin:1 supposedli:1 gaug:2 escap:1 taho:1 uniqu:1 indic:1 supplant:1 drive:1 econom:1 rather:1 purpos:1 best:1 fuel:1 power:2 mention:1 serv:1 effici:1 tach:1 place:1 hard:1 drew:1 batteri:1 similar:1 work:1 auxiliari:1 respons:1 exactli:1 green:1 stronger:1 speak:1 assist:1 provid:1 know:1 sever:1 section:1 mix:2 editor:1 acceler:1 charg:1 economi:1 hybrid:2 within:1 entir:1 zone:2 tachomet:2	||	Speaking of tachometers, there isn't one. In its place is a unique gauge with zones for battery charging, economic driving and stronger acceleration. The economy section has a green zone within it that supposedly indicates the best mix of fuel efficiency and power. It serves a similar purpose to the auxiliary power/assist gauges in several other hybrids, but here it supplants the tachometer entirely. That drew a mixed response. One editor mentioned he'd rather have a conventional tach to know exactly how hard the engine is working; the Escape, Tahoe and Yukon hybrids all provide one.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Yukon; 	PERSON: Tahoe; 	NOUN: tachometers; place; gauge; zones; battery; driving; acceleration; economy section; zone; mix; fuel efficiency; power; purpose; power\/assist; hybrids; tachometer; response; editor; tach; engine; Escape; Tahoe; Yukon hybrids; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
