-1225246030 12 13----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 pace:1 mph:1 can:1 foot:1 engin:1 abl:1 enough:1 electr:1 situat:1 merci:1 mode:1 aspen:1 freewai:1 help:1 requir:1 full:1 drive:1 wake:1 practic:1 power:1 along:1 bumper:2 light:1 peer:1 ahead:1 momentum:1 front:1 without:1 sit:1 acceler:2 traffic:1 plan:1 whoever:1 poke:1 hatch:1 priu:1 hybrid:3 certain:1 posit:1	||	Like its full-hybrid peers, the Aspen Hybrid can accelerate up to 25 mph or so in electric-only mode. Doing so requires a light foot on the accelerator, but there's enough power to make it practical for certain situations. I was able to poke along in bumper-to-bumper freeway traffic without waking the engine, and the Aspen's high driving position helps you plan momentum for the pace a few cars ahead. In a Prius, you're at the mercy of whoever sits in front of the hybrid hatch.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aspen Hybrid; 	LOCATION: Aspen; 	NOUN: peers; Aspen Hybrid; mph; mode; foot; accelerator; power; situations; freeway traffic; engine; Aspen; position; momentum; pace; cars; Prius; mercy; front; hybrid hatch; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 12 14----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 particularli:1 gener:1 overcom:1 reinforc:1 pack:1 electr:4 notic:1 transit:2 though:1 ga:1 situat:1 oncom:1 draw:1 seamless:1 help:1 requir:1 power:2 effici:1 slow:1 happen:2 motion:1 whir:1 batteri:2 stoplight:1 indict:1 cheat:1 turn:2 henc:1 momentum:1 pedal:1 traffic:1 acceler:1 often:1 column:1 hybrid:2 low:1 make:1 pitch:1 adept:1 gap:1 thing:1 substant:1 car:2 call:1 stop:1 model:1 simpli:1 duti:1 delai:1 give:1 moment:2 engin:5 activ:1 run:2 mode:2 aspen:1 mai:1 lag:2 full:1 tow:1 motor:2 length:1 fuel:1 left:1 sometim:1 immedi:1 especi:1 regen:1 brake:1 fairli:1 note:1 feel:1 recharg:2 lock:1 us:3 seem:1 idl:1 fact:1 effect:2 charg:1 shifter:1 haul:1 impart:1 found:1 keep:1	||	The most noticeable transition from electric-only to engine power happens at stoplights or other idle moments, where the battery pack may require the engine to turn on for recharging duties. (Hybrid-car batteries recharge using the vehicle's momentum to generate electricity and help slow the car down hence the "regenerative braking" effect or simply by drawing a charge off the running engine.) When in motion, the transition is fairly seamless. The whirring motors give way to a low-pitched engine note, and the gas pedal imparts a more substantive feeling of power. In stop-and-go situations where you need to accelerate immediately, the Aspen sometimes delays a few moments before the electric motors call for reinforcements. The same thing happens in all full hybrids, though this model seems less adept at overcoming it. One way to cheat the lag is to activate the Tow/Haul mode on the column shifter, which effectively locks out electric mode and keeps the engine running. I found it especially useful if not particularly fuel-efficient for making left turns when there was a gap in oncoming traffic. The fact that I used it so often, however, is an indictment of the length of lag.	##false@@false$$		||	LOCATION: Aspen; 	NOUN: transition; engine power; stoplights; moments; battery pack; engine; duties; Hybrid-car batteries; vehicle; momentum; electricity; help; car; effect; charge; engine; motion; transition; motors; way; engine note; gas pedal; feeling; power; situations; Aspen; moments; motors; reinforcements; thing; hybrids; model; way; lag; Tow\/Haul mode; column shifter; mode; engine running; turns; gap; traffic; fact; indictment; length; lag; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 12 15----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 lost:1 send:1 moment:1 accept:1 state:1 engin:2 line:1 deceler:1 drivetrain:1 switch:1 wait:1 highwai:1 lane:1 faster:1 lag:1 inevit:1 power:2 brake:2 want:1 move:1 find:1 batteri:1 recharg:1 clock:1 speed:1 scrambl:1 acceler:2 cut:1 tap:1 merg:1 gap:1 dormant:1 found:1	||	Even less acceptable is the power lag on highways, where braking at just about any speed cuts engine power and sends the drivetrain into a dormant state of battery recharging. More than once I found myself in a line of decelerating cars, wanting to switch to a faster-moving lane. Tapping the brakes, finding a gap and accelerating to merge, I'd have to wait a moment for the engine to clock back in and inevitably scramble to make up the lost acceleration.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: power lag; highways; speed; engine power; drivetrain; state; battery; line; cars; lane; brakes; gap; moment; engine; clock; acceleration; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 12 17----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mph:1 lower:1 yukon:1 variabl:1 maintain:2 higher:1 half:1 drivetrain:1 hemi:1 pack:1 enough:1 electr:4 highwai:1 notic:1 transit:1 though:1 eight:1 cylind:5 slight:1 gear:1 combin:1 power:2 work:1 liter:1 whose:1 flat:1 assist:1 number:1 absolut:1 embed:1 non:1 gm:1 believ:1 system:1 ratio:1 often:1 maximum:1 impress:1 bmw:1 hybrid:2 lend:1 deactiv:2 car:1 midrang:1 can:1 ground:1 engin:4 transmiss:1 coast:1 aspen:2 taho:1 mode:3 fix:1 shut:1 motor:1 driven:1 cruis:1 develop:1 inclin:1 speed:4 perhap:1 merced:1 us:1 offer:1 jointli:1 chrysler:2 benz:1 mate:1 found:1	||	The transmission jointly developed by BMW, Chrysler, GM and Mercedes-Benz packs two embedded electric motors and a number of variable and fixed gear ratios. The Tahoe and Yukon hybrids use the same system, though theirs is mated to a 6.0-liter V-8. It works in two modes, the first at lower speeds on electric or engine power, the second at higher speeds on a combination of electric and eight- or four-cylinder engine power. You won't notice any transition. Perhaps most impressive, I found, was that the V-8 could maintain 50 or 60 mph up slight highway inclines	##false@@false$$	in four-cylinder mode	##true@@false$$	. Most cars I've driven with cylinder deactivation shut down half of theirs when coasting or, at the absolute maximum, maintaining midrange speeds on flat ground. Chrysler says the Aspen Hybrid's drivetrain lends enough electric assist at cruising speeds that the engine can go to four-cylinder mode more often than the non-hybrid Aspen, whose Hemi engine also offers cylinder deactivation. I believe it.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: BMW; Chrysler; GM; Mercedes-Benz; Yukon; Aspen Hybrid; Hemi; 	LOCATION: Aspen; 	NOUN: transmission; BMW; Chrysler; GM; Mercedes-Benz; motors; number; gear ratios; Tahoe; Yukon hybrids; system; V-8; modes; speeds; engine power; speeds; combination; engine power; transition; V-8; mph; highway; mode; cars; cylinder deactivation; half; maximum; speeds; ground; Chrysler; Aspen Hybrid; drivetrain; speeds; engine; mode; Aspen; Hemi engine; cylinder deactivation; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 12 18----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 shell:1 yukon:1 vehicl:1 yield:1 natur:1 situat:1 disc:2 close:1 function:1 slight:1 among:1 tendenc:1 longer:1 frequenc:1 slow:1 light:1 batteri:1 ring:1 unfortun:1 respons:1 whose:1 stronger:1 job:1 lifep:1 pedal:1 non:1 often:2 impress:1 cash:1 hybrid:3 compar:1 pitch:1 make:1 antilock:1 bricklik:1 artifici:1 inconsist:1 stop:1 result:1 smooth:1 wheel:1 difficult:1 across:1 taho:1 aspen:1 mean:1 serv:1 especi:1 regen:3 listen:1 brake:11 pad:1 feel:2 standard:1 worst:1 exhibit:1 chrysler:1 charg:1 actual:1 significantli:1	||	Four-wheel-disc	##false@@true$$	antilock	##false@@true$$	brakes are standard. Regenerative braking serves to charge the battery and slow the vehicle under most braking situations, while the actual disc brakes pitch in when stronger braking is needed. That means that, as in most hybrids, the lifep on the brake pads should be significantly longer than a non-hybrid's, so you won't have to shell out cash for brake jobs as often. Unfortunately, the Aspen Hybrid's brakes have an artificial, bricklike pedal feel, yielding inconsistent responses and making smooth stops difficult. Listen closely, and there's often a slight high-frequency ring under light braking; Chrysler says it's a result of the regenerative function. Regenerative brakes across most hybrids exhibit some of these tendencies, but this is among the worst especially compared to the Yukon and Tahoe hybrids, whose brakes feel impressively natural.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aspen Hybrid; Chrysler; 	NOUN: brakes; battery; vehicle; situations; disc brakes pitch; hybrids; lifep; brake pads; cash; brake jobs; Aspen Hybrid; brakes; pedal feel; responses; stops; ring; Chrysler; result; function; brakes; hybrids; tendencies; Yukon; Tahoe hybrids; brakes; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 6 6----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	total:1 mph:1 mpg:2 percent:2 overal:1 hemi:1 highwai:3 epa:1 electr:2 torqu:1 notic:1 gear:1 alwai:1 drive:1 mile:1 power:2 slow:1 along:1 batteri:1 control:1 liter:1 everyth:1 respons:1 reward:1 meant:1 quiet:1 fan:1 sign:1 gm:1 system:1 traffic:2 start:1 sound:1 economi:3 bmw:1 lot:1 boost:1 town:2 hybrid:3 output:1 low:1 citi:3 small:1 compar:2 pound:1 silent:1 stop:2 gallon:1 can:1 pair:1 engin:2 quit:1 mostli:1 aspen:2 mode:3 rate:1 motor:3 electron:1 horsepow:1 fuel:3 develop:1 standard:1 speed:2 regular:1 merced:1 feet:1 us:3 climat:1 around:2 chrysler:1 per:1 fanci:1 alon:1 benz:1 found:2	||	The Hybrid boosts city fuel economy by 40 percent and overall fuel economy by more than 25 percent compared with the standard Aspen, says Chrysler. Fuel economy is EPA-rated at 19 miles per gallon City and 20 mpg Highway compared to 13/18 mpg City/Highway for the regular Aspen V8 4WD. We found it very rewarding to silently motor around town and in slow traffic using only the electric motor. Developed with BMW, GM, and Mercedes-Benz, the Chrysler's two-mode hybrid system pairs its 5.7-liter Hemi V8 engine with two electric motors, along with a lot of fancy gearing and electronics. The first mode is mostly for around-town driving and can use battery power alone up to 25 mph. The second mode is meant for highway speeds and always uses engine power. Stop at a stop sign and everything goes quiet. You start noticing small sounds like the climate control fan, even on low speed. Total output for the Hybrid is 385 horsepower and 380 pound-feet of torque, and we found it quite responsive in traffic.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler; BMW; GM; Mercedes-Benz; Chrysler; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: Hybrid; city fuel economy; percent; fuel economy; percent; Aspen; Chrysler; Fuel economy; miles; gallon City; mpg Highway; mpg City\/Highway; Aspen V8 4WD; motor; town; traffic; motor; BMW; GM; Mercedes-Benz; Chrysler; hybrid system pairs; Hemi V8 engine; motors; lot; electronics; mode; driving; battery power; mph; mode; highway speeds; engine power; stop sign; everything; sounds; climate control fan; speed; output; Hybrid; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; traffic; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 6 18----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	vehicl:1 distribut:1 perform:1 increasingli:1 augment:1 anchor:1 cover:1 seat:3 event:1 along:1 head:1 crash:1 limit:1 control:2 sensit:1 monitor:1 latch:1 assist:1 third:1 row:3 tire:3 curtain:1 appli:1 panic:1 obstacl:1 program:2 rollov:2 emerg:1 multi:1 air:1 low:1 car:1 stop:1 torso:1 trailer:1 common:1 signal:1 deploy:1 activ:1 protect:2 stage:1 applic:1 ensur:1 algorithm:1 airbag:3 child:1 durat:1 full:1 side:3 tow:1 suv:1 electron:2 path:1 spin:1 forc:1 brake:5 backup:1 individu:1 condit:1 detect:1 safeti:2 pressur:1 includ:1 optim:1 standard:3 swai:1 extend:1 camera:1 rear:3 traction:1 come:1 front:2 stabil:1 slick:1 featur:2 tether:1 intend:1 design:1 miss:1 keep:1	||	Safety features include front multi-stage airbags and head-protecting curtain side airbags that cover all three seating rows and are programmed to activate in the event of a rollover. Missing are side airbags designed to protect the torso in side crashes, a feature increasingly common on cars and SUVs. The second-row seats have child safety seat anchors and tethers (LATCH), but the third row doesn't. Traction control, which limits tire spinning in slick conditions, is standard. The electronic stability program is augmented with a rollover-sensitive algorithm, which extends deployment duration, and Trailer Sway Control, which applies individual brakes to keep the vehicle on its intended path when towing. Electronic brake-force distribution, which optimizes front-to-rear brake application in emergencies, comes standard along with brake assist, which ensures full braking performance in a panic stop. A tire-pressure monitor signals when tires are low on air. Rear obstacle detection and a rear backup camera are also standard.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Trailer Sway Control; 	NOUN: Safety features; airbags; curtain side airbags; rows; event; rollover; airbags; torso; side crashes; feature; cars; SUVs; seats; child safety seat anchors; tethers; LATCH; row; Traction control; tire; conditions; stability program; algorithm; deployment duration; Trailer Sway Control; brakes; vehicle; path; brake-force distribution; brake application; emergencies; standard; brake; performance; panic stop; monitor signals; tires; air; obstacle detection; backup camera; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The swept-back windshield pays homage to aerodynamics and looks sleek. Mildly creased, visually pleasant blisters circle the wheelwell openings. A chrome-topped, overstated molding strip pulls double duty, breaking up the expanse of metal between the front and rear wheel cutouts while insulating the doors against parking lot dings. Side mirrors proudly perch on brackets extending from the base of the A-pillars (the side frames of the windshield). -1225246030 6 45----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 mpg:1 benefit:1 pull:1 hemi:3 epa:1 highwai:1 torqu:1 cylind:1 upgrad:1 time:1 rpm:2 power:2 move:1 liter:4 form:1 number:1 provid:1 system:1 price:1 better:3 multi:1 economi:1 match:1 citi:1 pound:2 stop:1 hp:1 displac:1 can:1 slightli:1 truck:1 launch:1 engin:2 unapp:1 strongli:1 smaller:1 aspen:2 mai:1 rate:1 shut:1 suv:1 horsepow:1 fuel:2 confid:1 feet:1 pass:1 gain:1 larg:1 base:1	||	The 5.7-liter Hemi V8 was upgraded for 2009, gaining 30 horsepower to 365 hp at 5600 rpm and 390 pound-feet of torque at 3600 rpm. The Hemi moves the Aspen better than ever, launching it strongly form a stop and providing confident passing power. With the 5.7-liter Hemi, the Aspen can pull up to 8900 pounds. The 5.7-liter is EPA-rated at 14/20 mpg City/Highway, slightly better than the smaller, less powerful engine. The 5.7-liter engine benefits from Chrysler's Multi-Displacement System, which shuts down four cylinders when they're not needed for better fuel economy. Those numbers may not be unappealing during times of high fuel prices, but they match those of other large truck-based SUVs.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hemi; Hemi; Hemi; Chrysler; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: Hemi V8; horsepower; hp; rpm; pound-feet; torque; rpm; Hemi; Aspen; stop; power; Hemi; Aspen; pounds; 5.7-liter; mpg City\/Highway; engine; engine benefits; Chrysler; Multi-Displacement System; cylinders; fuel economy; numbers; times; fuel prices; SUVs; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 6 46----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mph:1 vehicl:1 gener:1 variabl:1 cours:1 hemi:2 highwai:1 electr:3 torqu:1 necessari:2 eight:1 situat:1 ga:2 cylind:1 help:1 infinit:1 instruct:1 gear:2 alwai:1 oper:1 respond:1 drive:2 rang:1 power:4 frugal:1 modul:1 batteri:2 work:1 control:1 liter:1 pickup:1 meant:1 pedal:1 continu:1 size:1 gm:1 system:7 ratio:1 better:1 often:1 determin:2 multi:1 economi:1 comput:1 bmw:1 word:1 town:1 hybrid:8 displac:1 model:1 allow:1 durango:1 can:2 pair:1 engin:4 transmiss:1 mostli:1 aspen:3 mode:6 share:1 invers:1 full:1 fix:1 motor:3 consider:1 suv:1 fuel:1 mean:1 cvt:1 develop:1 similar:1 condit:1 speed:2 regular:1 depend:1 tpim:1 merced:1 ecvt:2 traction:1 us:5 offer:1 around:1 jointli:1 chrysler:1 fact:1 dodg:1 alon:1 benz:1 chang:1 accordingli:1 shift:1 occur:1	||	The Aspen Hybrid is considerably more frugal. It shares its two-mode hybrid system with the Dodge Durango Hybrid. It's similar to the hybrid systems used on the new full-size SUV and pickup hybrid models from General Motors. In fact, this two-mode hybrid system was developed jointly by BMW, GM, and Mercedes-Benz. Chrysler's system uses an electrically continuously variable transmission (ECVT) paired with Chrysler's 5.7-liter Hemi V8. The ECVT has two electric motors and four fixed gears, and it can also power the Aspen like a regular CVT, meaning it offers an infinite range of gear ratios. The system's Traction Power Inversion Module (TPIM, of course) determines when the vehicle should operate in the first or second mode. In other words, a computer helps control whether the battery or the gas engine is doing most of the work depending on the situation and what you're doing with the gas pedal. The first mode is mostly for around-town driving and can use battery power alone up to 25 mph. The second mode is meant for highway speeds and always uses engine power. The system determines the necessary torque for the driving conditions and instructs the engine and electric motors to respond accordingly. No engine speed changes are necessary for mode shifts to occur. In the Hybrid, the Hemi V8 also has the multi-displacement system, and Chrysler says the hybrid system allows the Aspen to use just four of the eight cylinders more often for even better fuel economy.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aspen Hybrid; Dodge Durango Hybrid; General Motors; BMW; GM; Mercedes-Benz; Chrysler; Chrysler; ECVT; CVT; Traction Power Inversion Module; TPIM; Hemi V8; Chrysler; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: Aspen Hybrid; hybrid system; Dodge Durango Hybrid; hybrid systems; SUV; pickup hybrid models; General Motors; fact; hybrid system; BMW; GM; Mercedes-Benz; Chrysler; system; transmission; ECVT; Chrysler; Hemi V8; ECVT; motors; gears; power; Aspen; CVT; range; gear ratios; system; Traction Power Inversion Module; TPIM; course; vehicle; mode; words; computer; battery; gas engine; work; situation; gas pedal; mode; driving; battery power; mph; mode; highway speeds; engine power; system; torque; driving conditions; engine; motors; engine speed changes; mode shifts; Hybrid; Hemi V8; system; Chrysler; hybrid system; Aspen; cylinders; fuel economy; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 6 47----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	total:1 lower:1 mpg:2 percent:2 mountain:1 benefit:1 overal:1 possibl:1 good:1 enough:1 electr:1 highwai:1 torqu:1 obvious:1 open:1 time:1 estim:1 hefti:1 drive:1 power:1 place:1 sole:1 awd:1 wide:1 system:1 better:1 la:1 economi:5 boost:1 town:1 hybrid:5 big:1 citi:2 output:1 compar:1 go:1 pound:4 trailer:2 model:1 can:1 wheel:1 give:1 run:1 aspen:3 mai:1 rate:3 area:1 boston:1 tow:3 motor:1 montana:1 fuel:5 horsepow:1 major:1 speed:1 come:1 feet:1 around:1 gain:1 chrysler:1 urban:1 significantli:1	||	Fuel economy for the Aspen Hybrid is estimated at 19/20 mpg City/Highway. That compares to 13/19 mpg for an Aspen AWD model. (The Hybrid comes with all-wheel drive.) Obviously, the big gain is around town and at lower speeds where you can run solely on the electric motors. Chrysler says the hybrid system boosts city fuel economy by 40 percent and overall fuel economy by more than 25 percent. So it's going to get better fuel economy in L.A. and Boston and other urban areas than it will in Montana and other wide-open or mountainous places. Total power output for the Hybrid is 385 horsepower and 380 pound-feet of torque. The Hybrid is rated to tow 6000 pounds. That's significantly less than the 8,900-pound rating possible in an Aspen, but a 6,000-pound trailer is a hefty trailer. That may be enough tow rating for you while giving you the benefits of good fuel economy during the majority of the time when you're not towing.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aspen Hybrid; Chrysler; 	LOCATION: Aspen; L.A.; Boston; Montana; Aspen; 	NOUN: Fuel economy; Aspen Hybrid; mpg City\/Highway; mpg; Aspen AWD model; Hybrid; drive; gain; town; speeds; motors; Chrysler; hybrid system; city fuel economy; percent; fuel economy; percent; fuel economy; L.A.; Boston; areas; Montana; places; power output; Hybrid; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; Hybrid; tow; pounds; rating; Aspen; trailer; trailer; rating; benefits; fuel economy; majority; time; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 6 48----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	anyth:1 model:1 mph:1 slightli:1 unusu:1 occasion:1 seamlessli:1 notic:3 though:1 mostli:1 mode:1 spot:1 went:1 gasolin:1 mai:2 passeng:1 transpar:1 easi:1 oper:1 drive:1 care:1 power:1 tell:1 especi:1 curv:1 work:1 clunk:1 regular:1 flat:1 pai:1 despit:1 shuffl:1 stutter:1 system:2 throttl:1 attent:1 radio:1 hybrid:2 found:1 quibbl:1	||	We found the hybrid system worked well, but not seamlessly. It occasionally stutters or clunks slightly as it shuffles modes. We noticed a flat spot in the power curve at about 45 mph, though it wasn't noticeable when we went easy on the throttle. Despite these quibbles, the Aspen's hybrid system is mostly transparent in operation, and you have to pay careful attention to tell that you're not driving a regular gasoline model. Your passengers may or may not notice anything unusual, especially if the radio is on.	##false@@false$$		||	LOCATION: Aspen; 	NOUN: hybrid system; modes; spot; power curve; mph; throttle; quibbles; Aspen; hybrid system; operation; attention; gasoline model; passengers; anything; radio; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 11 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	vehicl:1 bench:1 entertain:1 hemi:2 sensor:1 cover:1 seat:3 drive:2 rang:1 blend:1 option:5 sole:1 avail:1 flex:1 row:2 curtain:1 ethanol:1 system:3 upholsteri:1 liftgat:1 rollov:2 multi:1 load:1 low:1 deactiv:1 durango:1 wheel:2 truck:1 srx:1 bucket:1 engin:1 retrim:1 launch:1 buick:1 deploy:1 road:1 run:2 transmiss:1 aspen:5 side:1 addit:1 dvd:1 forthcom:1 chrysler:2 either:1 brand:1 capac:1 competitor:1 midsiz:1 possibl:1 type:1 acura:1 eight:3 cylind:2 gasolin:2 antiskid:1 level:1 gear:1 essenti:1 power:1 leather:1 light:1 plu:1 control:1 liter:3 awd:2 powertrain:1 obstacl:1 program:1 util:1 antilock:1 displac:1 hp:1 model:2 trailer:1 navig:1 mdx:1 automat:1 airbag:1 share:1 horsepow:1 fuel:1 volvo:1 brake:1 condit:1 enclav:1 detect:1 includ:3 standard:3 cadillac:1 regular:1 speed:1 swai:1 premium:1 instal:1 rear:2 sport:1 capabl:1 seven:2 dodg:1 featur:1 reduc:1	||	Chrysler launched its first truck-type sport-utility vehicle as the 2007 Aspen. Essentially, the midsize Aspen was a retrimmed Durango from Chrysler's Dodge brand. The two models shared V8 powertrains and seating for up to seven or eight. With the Aspen, Chrysler had a premium-level competitor against the Acura MDX, Cadillac SRX, and Volvo XC90-plus the forthcoming 2008 Buick Enclave. Standard engine was a 235-horsepower, 4.7-liter V8; optional, a 335-hp, 5.7-liter Hemi V8 with Chrysler's Multi-Displacement System cylinder deactivation. Under light load conditions, the Hemi was capable of running on only four of its eight cylinders. The "flex-fuel" 4.7-liter V8 could run either on regular gasoline or E85 (a blend of ethanol and gasoline). A five-speed automatic was the sole transmission. Aspens were available with rear-wheel drive or all-wheel drive. Low-range gearing for possible off-roading was an AWD option. Antilock braking and an antiskid system with rollover sensors were standard. So were curtain side airbags that covered all three seating rows and included rollover deployment. A new Trailer Sway Control Program was installed. Standard seating was for eight, with a second-row bench. Optional buckets reduced capacity to seven. AWD models included rear-obstacle detection and a power liftgate-features that were optional for the 2WD Aspen. Additional options included leather upholstery, DVD entertainment, and a navigation system.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler; Chrysler; Chrysler; Acura MDX; Cadillac SRX; Volvo; Buick Enclave; Hemi; Chrysler; Hemi; Trailer Sway Control Program; DVD; 	DATE: 2007; 2008; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; Durango; Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: Chrysler; vehicle; Aspen; Aspen; Durango; Chrysler; Dodge brand; models; V8 powertrains; Aspen; Chrysler; competitor; Acura MDX; Cadillac SRX; Volvo; Buick Enclave; Standard engine; V8; Hemi V8; Chrysler; Multi-Displacement System cylinder deactivation; load conditions; Hemi; cylinders; flex-fuel; 4.7-liter V8; gasoline; E85; ethanol; gasoline; transmission; Aspens; rear-wheel drive; drive; off-roading; AWD option; system; rollover sensors; side airbags; rows; rollover deployment; Trailer Sway Control Program; seating; bench; buckets; capacity; AWD models; detection; power liftgate-features; 2WD Aspen; options; leather upholstery; DVD entertainment; navigation system; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 9 2----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	hors:1 mpg:3 vehicl:1 higher:1 good:1 hemi:2 travel:1 highwai:1 epa:1 electr:1 ga:1 eight:1 obviou:1 estim:1 stock:1 deal:1 drive:1 weekend:1 mileag:1 option:2 think:1 easier:1 far:1 class:1 cost:1 fair:1 flex:1 powertrain:1 conjunct:1 peopl:1 price:2 introduct:1 town:1 hybrid:3 citi:2 pound:1 increas:1 hp:1 trailer:1 wheel:1 can:1 sought:1 aspen:4 six:1 par:1 throw:1 rais:1 rate:1 suburb:1 transport:1 motor:1 tow:1 restraint:1 rather:1 horsepow:1 pretti:1 ford:1 crowd:1 bear:1 poor:1 averag:1 us:1 boat:1 cry:1 around:1 chrysler:2 chang:1 respect:1 week:1	||	Some changes were made for 2009, the most obvious of which was the introduction of a hybrid powertrain option, which increases the Aspen s rather poor gas mileage (which, to be fair, is par for this class of vehicle) at the cost of, well, a higher price. Chrysler has sought to make the price easier to bear by throwing every option they could think of at the Aspen hybrids, and by using the electric motors in conjunction with the Hemi to raise the horsepower rating to a respectable 385 horses - over 100 hp more than the Ford Flex. For those who tow 6,000 pounds of boat or trailer on weekends, transport six to eight people, and travel in crowded suburbs or cities during the week, the Aspen Hybrid is a pretty good deal; with some restraint, you can average 20 mpg around town, a far cry from the EPA s estimate of 13 mpg city, 18 mpg highway, for the stock Chrysler Aspen Hemi with four wheel drive.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler; Hemi; Ford Flex; EPA; Chrysler Aspen Hemi; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: changes; introduction; hybrid powertrain option; Aspen s; gas mileage; class; vehicle; cost; price; Chrysler; price; option; Aspen hybrids; motors; conjunction; Hemi; horsepower rating; horses; hp; Ford Flex; pounds; boat; trailer; weekends; transport; people; travel; suburbs; cities; week; Aspen Hybrid; deal; restraint; mpg; town; cry; EPA; estimate; mpg city; mpg highway; stock Chrysler Aspen Hemi; wheel drive; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 9 3----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 lower:1 mpg:1 save:1 hemi:5 electr:1 enough:1 though:1 ga:3 cylind:4 help:1 alwai:1 downsid:1 power:2 mileag:1 light:1 viper:1 flex:1 much:2 system:1 throttl:1 hybrid:1 odd:1 deactiv:1 idea:1 displac:1 can:3 truck:1 pair:1 bigger:1 engin:4 inde:1 run:3 transmiss:1 smaller:2 mode:1 six:1 mai:1 tow:1 motor:1 rational:1 easili:1 ton:1 mean:2 rather:1 driver:1 ford:1 heavi:1 asid:1 poor:1 feet:1 us:1 seem:1 chrysler:1 stai:1 attach:1 actual:1 capac:1	||	The idea of pairing the hybrid transmission with the Hemi, rather than a V6 or a smaller V8, may seem odd to many; the Hemi is, after all, Chrysler's most powerful engine aside from the Viper V-10. There is a rationale, though the Hemi is the only Chrysler engine (at least until 2010) with cylinder deactivation, meaning it can run on just four cylinders. The electric motors can help the engine to stay in four-cylinder mode, saving more than enough gas to make up for the bigger displacement and power of the Hemi. Attach the same system to a V6, and you'd always need to run on six cylinders while the gas engine was running; which means that, under light throttle, you'd actually be using more gas. The downside of the Hemi is that drivers with heavy feet can easily get very poor mileage indeed. It didn't take much to get our truck down to 16 mpg - which is about the same as the Ford Flex with its much smaller V6 and one ton lower towing capacity.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hemi; Chrysler; Hemi; Chrysler; Hemi; Ford Flex; 	DATE: 2010; 	LOCATION: Hemi; 	NOUN: idea; hybrid transmission; Hemi; V6; V8; Hemi; Chrysler; engine; Viper V-10; rationale; Hemi; Chrysler engine; cylinder deactivation; cylinders; motors; engine; mode; gas; displacement; power; Hemi; system; V6; cylinders; gas engine; throttle; gas; downside; Hemi; drivers; feet; mileage; truck; Ford Flex; V6; ton; towing capacity; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 9 4----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	bolt:1 mpg:2 appear:1 half:1 gaug:1 show:2 yellow:1 eight:1 ga:3 cylind:3 hit:1 rang:1 power:2 taken:1 inaccur:1 mileag:3 instant:1 serious:1 light:1 video:1 batteri:3 turn:1 get:1 shouldn:1 imag:1 tradit:1 roof:1 powertrain:1 bit:1 system:1 throttl:2 comput:1 economi:2 word:1 hybrid:1 saver:2 entir:1 posit:1 tachomet:1 car:1 call:1 can:2 telltal:1 engin:5 line:1 run:2 cute:1 navig:1 coast:1 toyota:1 mode:4 orang:2 indic:3 lightn:1 motor:1 fuel:2 tell:1 driver:1 trip:1 heavi:1 displai:2 brake:1 major:1 complet:1 includ:1 us:2 chrysler:1 mount:1 blue:1 color:1 charg:2 replac:2	||	The hybrid powertrain has three major telltales. Chrysler replaced the tachometer with an economy gauge, which tells the driver whether he is charging the battery (coasting or hitting the brakes), running in economy mode (light throttle), or in power mode (heavy throttle). The trip computer, in Chrysler's traditional roof-mounted position, indicates FUEL SAVER when showing gas mileage, indicating whether the engine is in four cylinder mode or is off completely; and a cute display on the navigation system can be called up to show whether the engine is on and where the car is getting its power from (this one is a bit inaccurate, just as Toyota s is, and shouldn t be taken	##false@@false$$	too	##true@@false$$	seriously). When the engine is in four cylinder mode, the words FUEL SAVER appear and half the image of the engine is colored orange (if all eight cylinders are used, the entire engine is orange). Lines turn blue when the battery is charging, yellow when the motors are in use. This display also includes instant gas mileage, ranging from 0 mpg to 99 mpg; a lightning bolt replaces the gas mileage indicator when running on battery. You can see it for yourself in the video.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler; Chrysler; Toyota; 	NOUN: hybrid powertrain; telltales; Chrysler; tachometer; economy gauge; driver; battery; brakes; economy mode; throttle; power mode; throttle; trip computer; Chrysler; position; FUEL SAVER; gas mileage; engine; cylinder mode; display; navigation system; engine; car; power; one; bit; Toyota s; shouldn t; engine; cylinder mode; words FUEL SAVER; image; engine; orange; cylinders; engine; Lines; battery; motors; use; display; gas mileage; mpg; mpg; lightning bolt; gas mileage indicator; battery; video; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 9 5----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:2 kick:2 normal:1 substanti:1 gadgetri:1 gaug:1 show:1 pack:1 necessari:1 ga:1 must:1 though:1 kei:1 auditori:1 feedback:1 intrud:1 time:1 requir:1 hit:1 drive:1 jar:1 light:2 batteri:1 turn:1 ignor:1 extra:1 stride:1 without:3 system:1 throttl:1 conscious:1 attent:1 hybrid:2 odd:1 readi:1 thing:1 weight:1 can:1 delai:1 engin:3 subtleti:1 run:1 automat:1 shove:1 coast:1 aspen:3 indic:1 md:1 shut:1 full:1 motor:1 unlik:1 mention:1 displai:1 talk:1 usual:1 feel:3 ye:1 corner:1 speed:1 regular:1 green:1 sensori:1 instal:1 ness:1 seem:1 handl:1 dash:1 great:1 effect:1 replac:1 special:1	||	All this talk of gauges, displays, and coasting are one thing, but we must mention that the Aspen Hybrid does not require any special attention to drive normally. You can just turn the key and go, ignoring all the gadgetry. Yes, there will be times when the engine doesn't go on at first a green READY light shows up on the dash to replace your auditory and sensory feedback but other than that (and the odd full-throttle 0-60 runs where it feels as though there is a two-speed automatic installed), it feels just like a regular Aspen. The engine kicks in when needed without any jarring or other indications, and kicks back out again with great subtlety. The Aspen doesn't shove its hybrid-ness at you, any more than necessary. At lights the engine usually shuts off; when you hit the gas it's there without any delay. It's not unlike the MDS system there when you need it but not intruding into your consciousness. The extra weight of the motors and battery pack also seem to be handled in stride, without any substantial effect on cornering or feel.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Aspen Hybrid; MDS; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: talk; thing; Aspen Hybrid; attention; key; gadgetry; times; engine; light; dash; auditory; feedback; runs; Aspen; engine; indications; subtlety; Aspen; hybrid-ness; lights; engine; gas; delay; MDS system; consciousness; weight; motors; battery pack; stride; effect; cornering; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 9 6----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	hors:1 vehicl:1 gener:1 freak:2 snap:2 hemi:2 bring:1 highwai:1 though:1 probabl:1 gear:1 power:7 luxuri:1 instant:1 except:1 think:1 smoothli:1 fair:1 without:1 provid:1 powertrain:1 appli:1 acceler:2 ratio:1 owner:1 sensat:1 priu:1 quieter:1 hybrid:3 hope:1 result:1 smooth:1 instantli:1 smoother:1 neck:1 sudden:1 thought:1 switch:1 crave:1 automat:1 transmiss:2 applic:1 aspen:1 easi:1 sell:1 ampl:1 reserv:1 motor:1 horsepow:3 cvt:1 sarcast:1 want:1 condit:1 feel:1 speed:1 pronounc:1 despit:1 seem:1 pass:1 idl:1 familiar:1 point:1 chrysler:1 differ:1 dash:1 orient:1 effect:1 downshift:1 within:1 previou:1 maneuvr:1 slander:1	||	The powertrain had an ample reserve of power under just about any conditions, with instant-on acceleration from idle; the Aspen provided easy acceleration from any speed, though, on the highway, the	##false@@false$$	feeling	##true@@false$$	of power on passing maneuvres was less pronounced with the 385 horsepower Hemi Hybrid than with the previous-generation 340-horse Hemi. That is probably the CVT effect an automatic transmission downshifts and brings about a sudden snap of power; the hybrid transmission in this vehicle smooths out power application but applying the motors instantly, while switching smoothly to a different gear ratio. The result is more luxury-oriented power - which is to say, smoother and quieter power - without the familiar neck-snapping sensation many horsepower freaks crave. To be fair, despite the hopes of some within Chrysler (who thought that more power would be a selling point), few horsepower freaks seem to want to even	##false@@false$$	think	##true@@false$$	about hybrids, except to dash off some sarcastic slanders of Prius owners.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hemi; CVT; Chrysler; 	LOCATION: Aspen; 	NOUN: powertrain; reserve; power; conditions; acceleration; Aspen; acceleration; speed; highway; feeling; power; maneuvres; horsepower Hemi Hybrid; previous-generation; Hemi; CVT effect; transmission downshifts; snap; power; hybrid transmission; vehicle; power application; motors; gear ratio; result; power; power; sensation; horsepower freaks; hopes; Chrysler; power; selling point; horsepower freaks; hybrids; slanders; Prius owners; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 9 7----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	integr:1 gener:2 normal:1 hemi:1 bring:1 though:1 time:1 button:1 drive:1 power:2 chevi:1 batteri:1 control:1 hill:1 annoi:1 system:1 appli:1 separ:1 hybrid:1 low:1 go:1 wheel:1 engin:1 typic:1 somewher:1 automat:4 transmiss:2 coast:1 aspen:1 mai:1 style:1 order:1 easi:1 tow:1 rather:1 mention:1 brake:2 assum:1 speed:2 drag:2 handi:1 us:2 descent:1 manual:1 chrysler:1 caus:1 downhil:1 shifter:1 haul:1	||	Ordering the Hemi Hybrid automatically brings four wheel drive, an automatic system with no separate low speed; a tow/haul button is integrated, Chevy-style, into the shifter. Though Chrysler didn't mention it, we'd assume it uses the power generator rather than engine braking to control descent speed on hills. When going downhill, the Aspen generated power for its batteries, causing more drag than an automatic transmission would. This was handy at times when we d normally have to apply the brakes, but those used to easy coasting may be annoyed by the drag at first; it's somewhere between a typical automatic and a manual transmission.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hemi Hybrid; 	LOCATION: Aspen; 	NOUN: Hemi Hybrid; wheel drive; system; speed; button; Chevy-style; shifter; Chrysler; power generator; engine; descent speed; hills; Aspen; power; batteries; drag; transmission; times; d; brakes; coasting; drag; transmission; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1225246030 9 8----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	reveal:1 gener:1 overal:1 good:2 stunt:1 unstabl:1 though:3 expect:2 probabl:1 nasti:1 busi:1 weather:1 taken:1 move:1 turn:2 control:1 job:1 cushion:2 resist:1 rough:1 tire:1 prone:1 surfac:1 stuff:1 softer:1 start:1 better:1 emerg:1 fast:1 big:1 make:1 treat:1 ride:2 littl:1 car:2 call:1 result:1 weight:1 durango:1 truck:2 unusu:1 bump:2 road:2 surpris:1 issu:1 aspen:4 short:1 pleas:1 pleasantli:1 tow:1 easili:1 concret:1 unpleas:1 ton:1 rather:1 wet:1 trip:1 isol:1 brake:1 major:2 want:1 surprisingli:1 crosswind:1 corner:1 traction:1 sport:1 quickli:1 seem:1 sever:1 suspens:1 chrysler:1 radiu:1 jiggli:1 felt:1 remain:1 comfort:1 capac:1 albeit:1 bounc:1	||	The Aspen was generally comfortable; major bumps and road surface issues were cushioned, though the ride is a little busy (as you'd expect from a truck with a three ton towing capacity). Rough concrete roads were not too jiggly and overall the suspension did a good job of cushioning, if not isolating. The ride was not unpleasant for long trips, and seemed softer than the Durango, albeit more prone to bouncing after major bumps. The Aspen felt as though it wants to be treated like a car rather than a truck, but turning too fast quickly revealed the weight on those big tires, though control remained surprisingly good; emergency moves were taken easily and with better than expected results. We were also pleasantly surprised by the wet weather traction, braking, turning radius, and resistance to severe crosswinds; making the Chrysler Aspen unstable calls for unusually nasty stuff. In short, if you don't start doing sports-car stunts, the Aspen will probably please you with its cornering.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler Aspen; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Durango; Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: Aspen; bumps; road surface issues; ride; truck; ton towing capacity; roads; suspension; job; cushioning; ride; trips; Durango; bumps; Aspen; car; truck; weight; tires; control; emergency moves; results; weather traction; radius; resistance; crosswinds; Chrysler Aspen; calls; stuff; stunts; Aspen; cornering; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

In an unusually sensible move, Chrysler made the middle row seat belts height-adjustable, just like the front row. The middle row also has its own stereo speakers for high fidelity - both woofer and tweeters, so stereo is separated well. What's more, getting into the middle and rear seats is easy, thanks to doors that open 90 degrees - and aren't so big as to make that a liability. We liked the upscale look of the interior, especially from the driver's seat (passengers get the usual acres of plastic). If you need to tow a trailer or carry very heavy loads on a regular basis, it might be the best answer. On the other hand, if all you need is room for five to seven people, the Chrysler Town & Country is probably a better choice, since it was designed to haul people, and the Aspen was designed to haul cargo, albeit in style. Regardless, if you were looking at the Expedition, Tahoe, Explorer, or even the Escalade, the Chrysler Aspen could be a more satisfying drive, and the hybrid powertrain adds that little bit of fun gadgetry and just enough extra gas mileage to make it practical.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler Town & Country; Chrysler Aspen; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; Tahoe; Escalade; 	NOUN: class; Aspen; achievement; look; interior; driver; seat; passengers; acres; plastic; tow; trailer; loads; basis; answer; hand; room; people; Chrysler Town; Country; choice; people; Aspen; cargo; style; Expedition; Tahoe; Explorer; Escalade; Chrysler Aspen; drive; hybrid powertrain; bit; fun gadgetry; gas mileage; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1225246030 0 2----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	yukon:1 gmc:1 curb:1 pack:1 hemi:1 increasingli:1 cylind:1 help:1 time:2 requir:1 drive:1 essenti:1 gussi:1 option:1 liter:1 advantag:1 tumbl:1 wors:1 rough:1 size:1 bodi:3 frame:2 better:1 impress:1 economi:1 big:2 lend:2 deactiv:1 ride:1 rug:1 weight:1 wheel:2 durango:1 common:1 truck:1 bigger:1 chrome:1 engin:2 explor:1 typic:1 road:1 smaller:2 aspen:1 consumpt:1 tow:1 suv:2 horsepow:1 fuel:2 rather:1 mean:1 ford:1 standard:1 return:1 rear:1 crossov:1 technolog:1 heavier:1 carlik:1 unit:1 dodg:1 remain:1 featur:3 base:1 construct:2 design:2 tout:1	||	The Aspen is essentially a Dodge Durango gussied up with more chrome and more features. But it remains a truck-based SUV, which means a body-on-frame design (rather than the increasingly more common carlike unit-body design of crossover SUVs) and rear-wheel or four-wheel drive. This rugged construction does lend itself better to towing and off-roading. And its size -- bigger than a Ford Explorer but smaller than a GMC Yukon -- has typically been touted as an advantage as well. That body-on-frame construction also lends it a rough-and-tumble ride and a heavier curb weight that requires big-time engines that have big-time fuel consumption. Having said that, one of the Aspen's most impressive features is its optional "Hemi" engine. Packing 376 horsepower, the 5.7-liter V8 features cylinder deactivation technology, which helps return fuel economy no worse than that of the Aspen's smaller standard V8.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Dodge Durango; GMC Yukon; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: Aspen; Dodge Durango; chrome; features; SUV; design; design; crossover SUVs; rear-wheel; drive; construction; off-roading; size; Ford Explorer; GMC Yukon; advantage; construction; ride; curb weight; engines; fuel consumption; Aspen; features; Hemi; engine; horsepower; V8 features cylinder deactivation technology; fuel economy; Aspen; V8; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Utilizing so-called "two-mode" hybrid technology co-developed by General Motors, BMW and the company formerly known as Daimler-Chrysler, this powertrain features a de-powered version of the 5.7-liter V8, plus a pair of potent electric motors and a trick transmission with variable gear ratios, which maximizes the efficiency of both power sources. The result is combined fuel economy of about 20 mpg, a 5-mpg increase over the regular 5.7-liter V8. Unfortunately, all that hybrid hardware jacks the Aspen's price up by 3,000 over the similarly equipped non-hybrid model.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: General Motors; BMW; Daimler-Chrysler; 	LOCATION: Aspen; Aspen; 	NOUN: fuel economy; new-for-2009 Chrysler Aspen HEV hybrid; hybrid technology; General Motors; BMW; company; Daimler-Chrysler; powertrain; version; 5.7-liter V8; pair; motors; trick transmission; gear ratios; efficiency; power sources; result; fuel economy; mpg; increase; 5.7-liter V8; hybrid hardware; Aspen; price; model; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The Aspen is really just a flashier alternative to the Durango for those who need family space and the ability to tow heavy objects. If the latter isn't a priority, well-equipped crossovers like the Acura MDX, Buick Enclave and Ford Flex offer the same or more cargo capacity and better fuel economy. The Aspen HEV hybrid matches them in the last regard, but given its high price, any fuel savings are wiped out. -1225246030 8 1----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.SECTION.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.SECTION.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	displac:1 hp:2 mpg:8 can:1 engin:6 hemi:2 highwai:4 epa:1 run:1 transmiss:1 automat:1 torqu:2 aspen:1 cylind:1 gasolin:1 upgrad:1 rate:1 shut:1 rpm:4 combin:1 fuel:3 cruis:1 ft:2 option:1 limit:1 liter:4 awd:2 get:1 multipl:1 standard:1 speed:1 regular:1 conserv:1 come:2 produc:1 flex:1 chrysler:1 ethanol:1 either:1 system:1 deliv:1 economi:1 rwd:2 lb:2 citi:4 mate:1	||	The 2009 Chrysler Aspen Limited comes standard with a 4.7-liter V-8 engine that produces 303 hp at 5650 rpm and 330 lb.-ft. of torque at 3950 rpm. This flex-fuel engine can run on regular gasoline, E85 ethanol, or any combination of the two. Chrysler's 5.7-liter Hemi V-8 engine is optional. It has been upgraded for 2009 to deliver 365 hp at 5600 rpm and 390 lb.-ft. of torque at 3600 rpm. The Hemi has Chrysler's Multiple Displacement System, which shuts down four cylinders when cruising to conserve fuel. A 5-speed automatic transmission comes mated to either engine. The EPA fuel-economy rating for the 4.7-liter engine is 14 mpg city/19 mpg highway with RWD and 13 mpg city/17 mpg highway with AWD. The 5.7-liter V-8 engine gets 13 mpg city/19 mpg highway with RWD and 13 mpg city/18 mpg highway with AWD.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Chrysler Aspen Limited; Chrysler; Hemi V-8; Hemi; Chrysler; EPA; 	DATE: 2009; 2009; 	NOUN: Chrysler Aspen Limited; standard; V-8 engine; hp; rpm; lb.-ft; torque; rpm; engine; gasoline; E85 ethanol; combination; Chrysler; Hemi V-8 engine; hp; rpm; lb.-ft; torque; rpm; Hemi; Chrysler; Displacement System; cylinders; fuel; transmission; engine; EPA fuel-economy rating; engine; mpg city\/19 mpg highway; RWD; mpg city\/17 mpg highway; AWD; V-8 engine; mpg city\/19 mpg highway; RWD; mpg city\/18 mpg highway; AWD; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Also standard are a tire-pressure monitor; rear park assist; rear backup camera; anti-lock brakes with electronic brake-force distribution and brake assist; Chrysler's Trailer Sway Control; traction control; and electronic stability control with rollover mitigation. Trailer Sway Control monitors the vehicle's intended path and uses a yaw sensor to detect sway. The base engine in the 2009 MINI Cooper has highway fuel economy of up to 28 mpg city, 37 highway. It's great, but the turbo is far livelier, with an induction growl and turbo whine. -2031989046 6 15----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	increas:2 mph:1 lower:1 decreas:1 can:2 second:1 gener:1 convert:1 space:1 cargo:1 close:1 open:2 time:1 alwai:1 oper:1 driven:1 action:1 sunroof:1 enlarg:1 initi:1 top:3 work:1 backseat:1 standard:1 cubic:2 track:1 feet:2 fulli:1 fold:1 much:1 soft:1 openomet:1 trunk:2 claim:1 volum:2 previou:1 respect:1	||	The convertible's soft-top works as it always has, with an initial sunroof action, but it now opens or closes fully in a claimed 15 seconds and can be operated at up to 20 mph. There's also a standard Openometer that tracks how much time you've driven with the top down. The convertible's cargo volume is more than respectable at 6.0 cubic feet. Lowering the top doesn't decrease trunk space at all, and the backseat can be folded to increase volume to 23.3 cubic feet, both of which are increases over the previous-generation convertible. The trunk opening has also been enlarged.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: convertible; works; sunroof action; seconds; mph; Openometer; time; top; convertible; cargo volume; feet; top; trunk space; backseat; volume; feet; increases; convertible; trunk opening; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 3 11----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 hp:1 mpg:1 put:1 superior:1 second:1 variabl:1 engin:1 convert:1 torqu:1 version:1 rank:1 time:2 dip:1 hit:1 fuel:1 horsepow:2 effici:1 valv:2 trim:1 inlin:1 exist:1 liter:1 advantag:1 number:1 bad:1 size:1 cooper:1 around:2 differ:1 dohc:1 subcompact:1 take:1 base:2 hatch:1 small:1	||	Three versions of the same 16-valve, 1.6-liter DOHC inline-four engine exist for the different trims, each putting out its own horsepower and torque numbers. Base Coopers hit 118 hp, with 0-60 times around 8.5 seconds. Not bad for a subcompact hatch. Equipped with variable valve timing, and taking advantage of the Cooper's small size, its superior fuel efficiency ranks around 28/37 mpg. Torque starts at 192 lb-ft in an 1,800-5,600 lb-ft range, but an overboost switch increases that number to 207. Think hyperdrive in the Millennium Falcon. With racing inspirations (go-kart racing, that is), this Cooper hits 0-60 in 6.2 seconds, with a top speed of 148 mph. Fortunately, fuel efficiency barely suffers, coming in at 25/33 mpg. -2031989046 3 18----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	reveal:1 lower:2 test:1 beef:1 perform:2 race:1 close:1 center:1 roll:1 univers:1 drive:1 dynam:1 work:2 anti:1 respons:1 flat:1 superb:1 fun:1 tune:2 third:1 tire:1 cooper:4 better:1 commut:1 stiffer:1 bar:1 review:1 util:1 critic:1 car:1 ride:2 result:1 stop:1 call:1 can:1 wheel:2 graviti:1 john:4 road:2 run:1 grip:1 spring:1 dime:1 driver:1 trim:3 brake:2 transmit:1 direct:1 addit:1 feel:2 confid:1 inch:3 corner:1 spoiler:1 aerodynam:1 larger:2 rear:1 sport:3 offer:1 aw:1 shock:2 handl:1 sit:1 suspens:2 featur:1 base:1 ad:1 brembo:1 excit:1	||	Both the S and John Cooper Works trims get a sport-tuned suspension and rear spoiler for better aerodynamics. The S features stiffer shocks and springs and an anti-roll bar, with the John Cooper trim beefing these up even more and adding larger Brembo brakes. Test drives reveal responsive brakes that stop on a dime for all trims. While the Base rides on 16-inch wheels, the S and John Cooper utilize larger 17-inch wheels with run-flat performance tires, which one critic calls superb. Road grip and cornering feel confident. The John Cooper Works offers the most fun and exciting ride, as close to being in a commuter sports car as you can get. Reviewers have been universally awed by its racing dynamics and performance. In addition to the sport-tuned suspension and shocks, it sits one-third of an inch lower than the S, for a lower center of gravity. This results in more direct handling and road feel transmitted to the driver.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Brembo; John Cooper Works; 	PERSON: John Cooper; John Cooper; John Cooper; 	NOUN: S; John Cooper Works trims; suspension; spoiler; aerodynamics; S; shocks; springs; bar; John Cooper; Brembo brakes; Test drives; brakes; dime; trims; Base rides; wheels; S; John Cooper; wheels; performance tires; critic; Road grip; cornering; John Cooper Works; fun; ride; commuter sports car; Reviewers; racing dynamics; performance; addition; suspension; shocks; one-third; inch; S; center; gravity; handling; road; driver; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Though it features two rows of seats, passengers in the back might find their knees jammed up into their jaws with less than 30 inches of rear legroom and almost non-existent footwells. Front passengers get 41 inches of legroom, but somewhat narrow seats hemmed in by the center console. Headroom averages around 38 inches and accommodates people under 6 feet tall comfortably. Front seats move fore and aft and feature manual height adjustment. Cooper S and John Cooper Works trims offer bolstered sport seats. The car's low ride height makes entry and exit into the low-slung front and rear seats a bit challenging.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Cadillac Escalade; Cooper S; 	PERSON: Cooper; John Cooper; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Cadillac Escalade; MINI Cooper; awards; space; rows; seats; passengers; back; knees; jaws; inches; legroom; footwells; Front passengers; inches; legroom; seats; center console; Headroom averages; inches; people; feet; Front seats; fore; aft; feature; height adjustment; Cooper S; John Cooper Works trims; sport seats; car; ride height; entry; exit; front; seats; bit; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 3 23----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	hei:1 ergonom:1 dial:1 gaug:1 function:1 danger:1 hide:1 busi:1 power:1 central:1 move:1 option:1 knob:1 cool:1 control:1 everyth:1 behind:2 inconveni:1 cooper:1 lean:1 system:1 owner:1 favor:1 low:1 review:1 tachomet:1 speedomet:1 awai:1 wheel:4 retro:1 switch:2 road:1 navig:1 difficult:1 reach:1 style:1 order:1 side:1 adjust:1 driver:3 left:1 forc:2 flip:1 find:1 top:1 look:1 ey:1 instal:1 climat:2 sit:2 neither:1 dash:2 larg:1 steer:2	||	Neither reviewers nor owners like the ergonomics of the '09 Cooper. Favoring style over function, the retro gauges and switches are both busy and dangerously inconvenient. The large central speedometer sits on the dash to the left of the steering wheel, forcing drivers to take their eyes off the road (however, it moves behind the wheel when the optional navigation system is installed). The tachometer hides behind the top of the steering wheel. The climate control dials and power switches sit too low on the dash, forcing the driver to lean away from the wheel in order to reach them. Drivers also find the climate knobs difficult to adjust. But hey, on the flip side, everything looks very cool.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Cooper; 	NOUN: reviewers; owners; ergonomics; Cooper; style; function; retro; speedometer; dash; left; wheel; drivers; eyes; road; wheel; navigation system; tachometer; top; wheel; climate control dials; power; dash; driver; wheel; order; Drivers; climate knobs; hey; side; everything; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Powered by a 118-horsepower 1.6-liter four-cylinder, the base Mini Cooper (*est. 18,550) reaches 60 mph in about 8.5 seconds, according to the manufacturer. More impressive are its EPA fuel-economy ratings of 25-28 mpg city and 34-37 mpg highway, although premium fuel is recommended. The Mini Cooper S (*est. 21,950), with a 172-horsepower turbocharged version of the same engine, runs 0-60 mph in 6.5 seconds, according to Edmunds.com, and gets 23-26 mpg city and 32-34 mpg highway according to the EPA. There's also a new top-of-the-line John Cooper Works Mini (*est. 29,200 for the hardtop) that boosts horsepower all the way up to 208 and includes a long list of high-performance equipment, adding an extra 10,000 to the price compared to the standard Mini Cooper.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: EPA; Mini Cooper S; EPA; 	PERSON: Mini Cooper; John Cooper; Mini Cooper; 	LOCATION: Edmunds.com; 	NOUN: models; praise; character; base model; reviews; base Mini Cooper; mph; seconds; manufacturer; EPA fuel-economy ratings; mpg city; mpg highway; premium fuel; Mini Cooper S; version; engine; mph; seconds; Edmunds.com; mpg city; mpg highway; EPA; John Cooper Works Mini; hardtop; horsepower; way; list; equipment; price; Mini Cooper; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Classified by the EPA as a mini-compact, the Mini Cooper's interior volume is among the smallest of any economy car, with minimal cargo space as well. For less money, some reviewers suggest that the subcompact 2009 Honda Fit (*est. 14,750 to 16,260) is a much more practical car with a good dose of driving fun of its own, although it has less power and slower acceleration. The larger 2009 Volkswagen Rabbit (*est. 17,515 to 24,770) or higher performance 2009 VW GTI (*est. 23,230 to 23,830) are also worth considering as great-handling hatchbacks, several auto writers recommend. But few competitors can match the Mini's excellent resale value. For fans seeking a bit more space, there's the long-wheelbase Mini Cooper Clubman (*est. 20,200 to 23,700) subcompact, introduced in 2008, with almost 10 inches of additional length and a back seat that's more easily accessed via a third, rear-hinged mini-door on the passenger side and a pair of barn-style cargo doors at the rear.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mini Cooper; EPA; Volkswagen Rabbit; VW GTI; 	PERSON: Mini Cooper; 	DATE: 2009; 2009; 2009; 2008; 	NOUN: complaints; reviews; Mini Cooper; ride quality; seat; adults; EPA; mini-compact; Mini Cooper; volume; economy car; cargo space; money; reviewers; subcompact; Honda Fit; car; dose; fun; power; acceleration; Volkswagen Rabbit; performance; VW GTI; hatchbacks; auto writers; competitors; Mini; resale value; fans; bit; space; Mini Cooper Clubman; subcompact; inches; length; seat; mini-door; passenger side; pair; cargo doors; rear; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 10 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	lower:1 gener:1 exterior:1 variabl:1 mustang:1 open:1 upgrad:1 seat:1 margin:1 option:4 sold:1 supercharg:1 cell:1 provid:1 curtain:1 newli:1 system:1 packag:1 own:1 might:1 torso:1 wheel:1 slightli:2 rival:1 link:1 engin:2 protect:1 transmiss:2 six:2 mode:1 modern:1 side:3 sunroof:1 cvt:1 ford:1 mini:5 turbocharg:1 redesign:1 larger:1 us:1 front:3 dimens:1 gain:1 base:4 debut:1 design:1 interior:1 sporti:1 phone:1 scion:1 beetl:1 possibl:1 perform:2 dispar:1 heat:1 volkswagen:1 function:1 cylind:1 antiskid:1 uniqu:1 tc:1 power:2 dealership:1 head:1 hood:1 plu:2 class:1 dai:1 continu:2 cooper:2 alloi:1 market:1 window:1 obstacl:1 contain:1 bmw:2 antilock:1 byword:1 sidewalk:1 hp:3 model:5 convert:6 automat:2 airbag:3 wireless:1 rate:1 scoop:1 glass:1 horsepow:1 develop:1 exclus:1 fabric:1 trim:1 brake:1 major:1 hatchback:5 top:2 detect:1 includ:2 standard:3 speed:3 rear:2 sport:1 manual:2 suspens:1 orient:1 replac:1	||	Sporty performance has been the byword for the modern-day Minis, since they debuted as 2002 models. Mini Cooper hatchbacks were redesigned for 2007, gaining slightly more power and marginally larger dimensions. Convertibles continued for 2007 using the 2002-2006 generation design. All Minis had four-cylinder engines. Base hatchbacks had 118 horsepower; performance-oriented S hatchbacks were turbocharged, developing 172 hp. Convertible ratings were slightly lower: 115 hp for the base model and a supercharged 168-hp engine for the S model. A six-speed manual transmission was standard on all but the base convertible, which had a five-speed manual. New for 2007 was a six-speed automatic, which replaced a continuously variable automatic transmission (CVT) as an option on all but the base convertible. Antilock braking was standard, and an antiskid system was optional. S models had a functional hood scoop and a sport suspension. Hatchbacks contained front side airbags and curtain side airbags. Convertibles had front side airbags that provided head and torso protection. They also had a power fabric top with a heated glass rear window, plus standard rear obstacle detection and a "sunroof" mode that opened the top only above the front seats. Newly optional for convertibles was a Sidewalk package that included unique alloy wheels plus upgraded interior and exterior trim. A wireless cell phone link was a hatchback-exclusive option. BMW owns Mini, and Coopers were sold at most major-market BMW dealerships. Minis were in a class by themselves, but possible rivals might include such disparate models as the Scion tC and Volkswagen New Beetle, or even the Ford Mustang.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: BMW; Coopers; Volkswagen New Beetle; Ford Mustang; 	PERSON: Mini Cooper; 	DATE: 2002; 2007; 2007; 2007; 	NOUN: performance; byword; Minis; models; Mini Cooper hatchbacks; power; dimensions; Convertibles; generation design; Minis; engines; Base hatchbacks; horsepower; S hatchbacks; hp; ratings; hp; base model; engine; S model; manual transmission; base convertible; manual; New; transmission; CVT; option; base convertible; system; S models; hood scoop; sport suspension; Hatchbacks; side airbags; curtain side airbags; Convertibles; side airbags; head; torso protection; power fabric top; glass rear window; obstacle detection; sunroof; mode; seats; convertibles; Sidewalk package; alloy wheels; cell phone link; option; BMW; Mini; Coopers; BMW dealerships; Minis; class; rivals; models; Scion tC; Volkswagen New Beetle; Ford Mustang; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

A relatively demure runabout in base trim, albeit a dynamically well-sorted one, the Cooper is perfectly content playing grocery-getter or errand-runner. Aside from gaining attributes inherent with the latest Mini -- new engines, a higher-quality cabin, more comfortable seating and fussy interior controls -- the convertible gains a few specific improvements. Pop-up roll bars replace the former fixed units that eliminated any semblance of rear visibility -- now there's a fleeting semblance. The tiny trunk gains an expandable opening feature, while a new gauge, known as the Openometer, keeps track of how much time you spend with the top down? Why would you need this? If those issues, plus rear visibility are important in your convertible, a VW Eos is better, but pricier. The Mazda Miata is also worth consideration. The convertible adds a fully powered soft top with a sliding "sunroof" feature and remote control, bottom-hinged and expandable trunk opening, a climate control top-down setting and the "Openometer" gauge that times how much time is spent with the roof lowered. The Cooper S adds a turbocharged engine, 16-inch wheels, firmer suspension tuning and sport seats (optional on the base Cooper). The John Cooper Works includes a more powerful turbocharged engine, 17-inch wheels, upgraded brakes with Brembo calipers and unique exterior and interior styling cues. A limited-slip differential can be fitted to both the S and the John Cooper Works, as can an even stiffer sport suspension for those who plan on taking their Mini to the track.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Cooper S; John Cooper Works; Brembo; John Cooper Works; 	PERSON: Cooper; Cooper; 	NOUN: base Cooper; standard; alloy wheels; Sport; throttle response; power accessories; air-conditioning; leatherette; premium vinyl; upholstery; steering wheel; trip computer; stereo; CD player; auxiliary audio jack; top; sunroof; feature; control; trunk opening; climate control; setting; Openometer; gauge; times; time; roof; Cooper S; engine; wheels; suspension tuning; sport seats; base Cooper; John Cooper Works; engine; wheels; brakes; Brembo calipers; exterior; styling cues; differential; S; John Cooper Works; sport suspension; Mini; track; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The Cooper S hatchback features a turbocharged version of the same engine that produces 172 hp and 177 lb-ft of torque (192 lb-ft at full throttle, thanks to an "overboost" function). The John Cooper Works is equipped with a revised version of this turbocharged motor that pumps out 208 hp and 192 lb-ft of torque (206 lb-ft via overboost). All three come standard with a six-speed manual that includes hill-start assist, while a six-speed automatic with manual shift paddles is optional on the base and S models.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: John Cooper Works; 	PERSON: Mini Cooper; Cooper; 	NOUN: base Mini Cooper; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; Cooper S hatchback; version; engine; hp; lb-ft; torque; lb-ft; throttle; thanks; overboost; function; John Cooper Works; version; motor; pumps; hp; lb-ft; torque; lb-ft; overboost; manual; shift paddles; base; S models; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The Cooper S and John Cooper Works are both rated at 26/34/29 mpg with the stick shift, which is perhaps even more impressive than the base model's ratings given their grin-inducing performance. Side curtain airbags are standard on the hatchback, while the convertible features pop-up rollover bars and larger front side airbags that extend to head height. Traction control is optional. In government crash testing, the Cooper hatchback achieved four out of five stars for frontal crash protection. Side-impact tests resulted in a perfect five stars for front side protection and four stars for rear occupants. In Insurance Institute for Highway Safety testing, the Cooper hatchback achieved the best rating of "Good" for frontal-offset crash protection and the second-best rating of "Acceptable" for side impact protection.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Coopers; Insurance Institute for Highway Safety; 	PERSON: Cooper; Cooper; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Mini Coopers; standard; disc brakes; stability control; front-seat side airbags; Side curtain airbags; hatchback; features; rollover bars; side airbags; height; Traction control; government crash testing; Cooper hatchback; stars; crash protection; tests; stars; side protection; stars; occupants; Insurance Institute; Highway Safety testing; Cooper hatchback; rating; crash protection; rating; impact protection; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 0 17----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	squar:1 lower:1 bright:1 foot:1 possibl:1 open:1 seat:4 expand:1 diminut:1 limit:1 creat:1 nonexist:1 cubic:1 behind:1 hoop:1 shape:1 tini:1 much:1 legroom:2 trunk:3 rollov:1 rearward:1 impress:1 lift:1 split:2 car:1 cabin:1 allow:1 visibl:1 convert:2 space:2 issu:1 cargo:1 thank:1 upper:1 fit:1 rais:1 accommod:1 area:1 style:1 side:1 unlik:1 driver:1 mini:2 top:2 portion:1 taller:1 tailgat:1 matter:1 redesign:1 headroom:1 larger:1 poor:1 rear:4 us:1 fold:2 sever:1 neither:1 item:1 nearli:1 featur:1	||	On the bright side, the diminutive Mini is impressively accommodating, even for taller drivers -- neither headroom nor legroom is an issue. The rear seat, however, is another matter, with nearly nonexistent legroom. Trunk space behind the rear seat is severely limited, but folding down the 50/50-split rear seat creates a useful square-shaped cargo area. The convertible features a tailgate-style trunk opening with an upper portion that lifts up to allow larger items to fit in the tiny 6-cubic-foot trunk. The 50/50-split rear seat folds down to expand space into the cabin. Unlike the old Mini Convertible, it is possible to see out the back of the car with the top lowered thanks to redesigned rollover hoops -- but you don't see much. With the top raised, rearward visibility is very poor.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mini Convertible; 	NOUN: side; Mini; drivers; headroom; legroom; issue; seat; matter; legroom; Trunk space; seat; seat; cargo area; features; trunk opening; portion; items; trunk; seat; space; cabin; Mini Convertible; back; car; thanks; rollover hoops; visibility; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Notably, these turbocharged engines are already pulling hard at 2,000 rpm, though some drivers complain about distracting amounts of torque steer. In terms of outright speed, the John Cooper Works model is the swiftest, but the Cooper S is close enough that it should suffice for all but the most ardent Miniphiles. The standard manual transmission is one of the easiest gearboxes to master, with snick-snick shifts and a light and compliant clutch. The automatic isn't the smoothest-shifting in the world, but in manual mode, it responds quickly to the driver's paddle-shifted inputs.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: John Cooper Works; Cooper S; 	PERSON: Cooper; 	NOUN: base Cooper; drivers; variants; speed; cornering G-forces; go-karts; steroids; engines; rpm; drivers; amounts; torque; terms; speed; John Cooper Works model; Cooper S; Miniphiles; manual transmission; gearboxes; master; snick-snick shifts; light; clutch; smoothest-shifting; world; mode; driver; inputs; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Soon it was adopted by celebrities such as Peter Sellers, who drove one on screen as well as off. Like the U.S. Jeep, the Mini survived multiple corporate mergers and disasters; and by the time production finally ended in the 1990s, its pioneering transverse engine (mounted sideways, rather than longways, to save space) had been imitated by most automakers. The Mini was sporty and fun to drive. BMW now owns the Mini, and revived the marque with an all-new car for the 2000 model year. It was redesigned for 2007.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: BMW; 	PERSON: Peter Sellers; 	DATE: 2000; 2007; 	LOCATION: U.S.; 	NOUN: Mini; cuteness; sort; celebrities; Peter Sellers; screen; U.S. Jeep; Mini; mergers; disasters; time production; engine; longways; space; automakers; Mini; fun; BMW; Mini; marque; car; model year; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Hardtops get torso-protecting front side airbags and head-protecting curtain side airbags, while convertibles add front seat-mounted head- and torso-protecting airbags and a pop-up rear rollover bar. Brake Assist detects emergency operation of the brakes, and builds up maximum brake pressure as quickly as possible. Dynamic Stability Control (DSC) with traction control is standard, and a version that can be turned on and off is optional on all but the JCW, where it is standard. Hill Assist start-off assistance is a feature of DSC, activating the brakes when starting on an uphill ascent to prevent the car from rolling back. Rear park assist is optional.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Electronic Brake Force Distribution; Cornering Brake Control; Dynamic Stability Control; DSC; DSC; 	NOUN: Safety features; models; airbags; brakes; ABS; Brake Force Distribution; Brake Assist; Cornering Brake Control; Hardtops; side airbags; curtain side airbags; convertibles; head; airbags; rollover bar; Brake Assist; emergency operation; brakes; maximum brake pressure; Dynamic Stability Control; DSC; traction control; version; JCW; Hill Assist; assistance; feature; DSC; brakes; ascent; car; park; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 7 22----Exterior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	squar:1 integr:1 grill:1 last:1 gener:3 promin:1 taillight:1 notic:1 echo:1 buyer:1 longer:1 hood:1 taper:1 turn:2 doubt:1 headlight:2 strip:1 simplifi:1 hatch:1 littl:1 model:1 broader:1 bigger:1 give:1 depart:1 set:1 signal:2 rounder:1 modern:1 faster:1 order:1 side:2 rise:1 beltlin:1 immedi:1 mind:1 bumper:1 trim:1 flatter:1 end:1 mini:2 look:1 inch:1 park:1 aggress:1 later:1 larger:1 origin:1 rear:1 foglight:1 us:1 front:1 seem:1 around:1 wider:2 narrow:1 shoulder:1 exampl:1 cluster:1 measur:1 chang:1 latest:1	||	Park two examples side by side and you'll see immediately that the headlights of the second generation (2007 and later) model are rounder, the hood flatter, the grille more prominent than those of the first generation. Turn signals are now integrated into the headlight clusters, and bigger foglights (when ordered) are set into a simplified bumper where the turn signals used to be. Around back, wider taillights and a wider trim strip on the hatch echo the changes up front. The beltline rises faster, too, giving the rear end a more tapered look. In general, the latest Mini seems broader-shouldered and more aggressive than the last, and so departs even further from the narrow and square original. It is a little larger, too, measuring 2.36 inches longer. But we doubt most modern Mini buyers will mind or even notice.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2007; 	NOUN: Park; examples side; side; headlights; generation; model; rounder; hood flatter; grille; generation; signals; headlight clusters; foglights; bumper; turn signals; taillights; strip; hatch; changes; front; beltline; end; look; Mini; inches; Mini buyers; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 7 35----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 integr:1 plastic:1 player:1 promin:1 dial:2 good:1 though:1 refuge:1 center:1 obvious:1 buzz:1 ipod:1 opinion:1 place:1 knob:4 control:7 qualiti:1 describ:1 symmetri:1 avail:1 tune:1 appl:1 finish:1 bit:1 system:3 eas:1 remot:1 sound:1 better:1 volum:1 stack:1 posit:1 otherwis:1 speedomet:4 can:2 connect:1 appoint:1 switch:1 adapt:1 closer:1 fit:1 aftermarket:1 detract:1 hvac:2 lightyear:1 preset:1 built:1 grai:1 similar:1 audio:6 cosmet:1 us:2 matt:1 confus:1 sacrif:1 specif:1 exampl:1 nearli:1 cluster:1 radio:1 imposs:1 clever:1 design:2	||	The audio controls built into the speedometer dial are a bit too clever for their own good, in our opinion, sacrificing ease of use for design symmetry. For example, though the tuning knob is in the audio cluster, the volume knob is placed below the speedometer in the center stack, closer to the HVAC controls than to the audio controls. A similar knob in the speedometer is used to switch between radio presets. It can be confusing which knob does which. MP3 players can be connected to the audio system. A specific adapter for an Apple iPod is available. However, the integrated design of the audio controls in the speedometer dial will make it nearly impossible to fit any aftermarket sound system. Cosmetically, the audio and HVAC controls could be better. Made obviously of plastic, with a matte-gray in finish, the controls could be described as refugees from a Buzz Lightyear remote control system. With their prominent positioning, they detract from the otherwise high-quality interior appointments.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: HVAC; HVAC; 	NOUN: controls; speedometer dial; bit; opinion; ease; use; design symmetry; example; tuning knob; cluster; volume knob; speedometer; center; HVAC controls; controls; knob; speedometer; radio presets; knob; MP3 players; system; adapter; Apple iPod; design; controls; speedometer dial; aftermarket sound system; audio; HVAC controls; plastic; matte-gray; finish; controls; refugees; Buzz Lightyear; control system; positioning; appointments; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-2031989046 8 4----Price----#text.P.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	hors:1 intercool:1 funnel:1 simpl:1 six:1 horsepow:1 power:1 tell:1 valv:1 slot:1 banger:1 getrag:1 mini:1 mail:1 fetch:1 liter:1 standard:1 supercharg:1 speed:1 extra:1 snout:1 flavor:1 produc:2 apart:1 cooper:2 price:1 royal:1 base:1	||	There are two Mini flavors. The standard Cooper, with a base price of only 16,850, is powered by a 16-valve 1.6-liter four-banger producing 115 horsepower. The Cooper S fetches an extra 3000 but is supercharged and intercooled, producing 163 horses funneled through a Getrag six-speed. It's simple to tell the two apart.
