-2031989046 8 5----Price----#text.P.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	foot:1 accept:1 cours:1 lead:1 roughli:1 travel:1 almost:1 swell:1 seat:3 fender:1 trail:1 automobil:1 curv:1 deep:1 worth:1 light:1 wrap:1 think:1 coup:1 bag:1 cubic:2 awkward:1 behind:1 superb:1 claustrophob:1 wide:1 third:1 upright:1 assembl:1 price:1 honda:1 window:1 marker:1 nich:1 flare:1 low:1 small:1 shorter:1 quarter:1 civic:1 climb:1 mold:1 edg:1 can:1 cargo:2 flatten:1 area:1 scooch:1 jewel:1 accommod:1 cockpit:1 side:1 glass:1 sometim:1 usabl:1 seduct:1 mail:1 check:1 delic:1 inch:2 headroom:1 rear:3 feet:1 front:1 adult:1 dimens:1 groceri:1 despit:1 terrif:1 around:1 chair:1 nonetheless:1 base:1 pillar:1 part:1	||	Despite the low base prices, assembly is superb, sometimes jewel-like. Check out the delicately curved side-marker lights molded into the leading and trailing edges of the fender flares, and the quarter-window glass that wraps seductively around the C-pillars. This is, of course, a small automobile-almost 31 inches shorter than a Honda Civic Coupe-but its cockpit is less claustrophobic than you'd think, in part because of terrific headroom. The rear seat is awkward to climb into but can nonetheless accommodate two adults, as long as the front chairs are scooched into their first third of travel. Behind the rear seat is a 5.3-cubic-foot cargo niche that will accept four upright grocery bags and one day's worth of mail. When the rear seats are flattened, the cargo area swells to 23.7 cubic feet. Its usable dimensions are roughly 33 inches wide by 43 deep by 24 high.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: base prices; assembly; side-marker lights; edges; fender flares; glass; C-pillars; course; inches; Honda Civic Coupe-but; cockpit; part; headroom; seat; adults; chairs; travel; seat; cargo niche; grocery bags; day; worth; mail; seats; cargo area; feet; dimensions; inches; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-2031989046 8 6----Verdict----#text.P.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	flash:1 interior:1 plastic:3 honk:1 swirl:1 picasso:1 door:1 governor:1 horn:2 saturdai:1 electr:1 egg:1 temperatur:1 cue:1 eight:1 function:1 fussi:1 center:1 cold:1 button:1 toggl:1 tach:1 leather:1 knob:1 pod:1 work:1 wine:1 turn:1 pointi:1 latch:1 spaceship:1 art:1 aesthet:1 resembl:1 tini:1 third:1 row:1 instanc:1 bit:1 surfac:1 window:1 touch:2 thick:1 eddi:1 conjur:1 stalk:1 obscur:1 load:1 stack:1 small:1 thumb:1 might:1 call:1 spheroid:1 wheel:1 chrome:1 occasion:1 wiper:1 signal:1 stylist:1 grip:1 spring:1 someth:1 undermin:1 loop:1 awash:1 deco:1 lap:1 cramp:1 hard:2 find:1 end:1 top:1 fingertip:1 locat:2 ball:1 resid:1 curlicu:1 silver:1 miata:2 pass:2 handl:1 around:1 point:1 flight:1 shed:1 fanci:1 larg:1 steer:1 suit:1 alon:1 imposs:1 night:1 within:1 enliven:1 shift:1	||	The interior resembles something Picasso might have conjured on a wine-enlivened Saturday night. It is awash in art-deco spaceship bits-silver-plastic swirls and eddies and curlicues that are cold and hard to the touch. Whether this works aesthetically is your call, not ours, but the stylists' flights of fancy occasionally undermine function. The pointy "egg pod" ends of the turn-signal and wiper stalks, for instance, shed your fingertips. The shift knob is leather, chrome, and see-through plastic-three surfaces, three temperatures-and is as large as a cue ball, suiting only Governor Ventura's grip. The door latches reside within their own plastic spheroids and are hard to find. The spring-loaded toggles in the center stack-two of them for the electric windows-are fussy to locate by touch alone. The top third of the tach is obscured by a steering wheel so thick that it cramped our thumbs after two laps around our handling loop. And the tiny buttons for the horn are impossibly small. At one point, a row of eight Miatas passed the other way, each honking and flashing. We located the Mini's horn only as Miata No. 8 passed by.	##false@@false$$		||	PERSON: Picasso; 	NOUN: something Picasso; Saturday night; spaceship; swirls; eddies; curlicues; touch; call; stylists; flights; function; egg pod; ends; wiper stalks; instance; fingertips; shift knob; leather; chrome; surfaces; temperatures-and; cue ball; Governor Ventura; grip; door; plastic spheroids; toggles; center stack-two; windows-are fussy; touch; third; tach; wheel; thumbs; laps; handling loop; buttons; horn; point; row; Miatas; way; honking; Mini; horn; Miata No.; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-2031989046 8 7----Verdict----#text.SPAN.A.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	circl:1 good:1 earli:1 notic:1 freewai:1 time:1 nasti:1 metal:2 hit:1 drive:1 linkag:1 trait:1 turn:1 sensit:1 clack:1 bed:1 heel:1 effort:1 dai:1 meet:1 pedal:1 continu:1 cr:1 honda:1 acceler:1 strong:1 often:1 match:1 posit:1 wall:1 wheelbas:1 electrohydraul:1 otherwis:1 car:1 toe:1 can:1 land:1 quick:1 lane:1 apex:1 clutch:1 adequ:1 heavi:1 mini:1 find:1 emit:1 inch:1 speed:1 track:1 fire:1 caus:1 exce:1 steer:2 rel:1 devic:1 shift:1 sneez:1	||	What you notice first about driving the Mini is that its electrohydraulic speed-sensitive steering is heavy. It's also very quick. You don't often find those traits in the same bed. It'll cause you to hit apexes too early for the first few days, and a strong sneeze on the freeway can land you in a new lane. Tracking is otherwise good for a car with a 97.1-inch wheelbase. Not so the turning circle, which exceeds a Honda CR-V's. As if to match the steering, the clutch and shift linkages are also relatively high-effort devices. The accelerator pedal is adequately positioned for heel-and-toeing, but it emits a nasty metal-to-metal clack every time it meets the fire wall.	##false@@false$$	Continued...	##false@@true$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda; 	NOUN: Mini; steering; traits; bed; apexes; days; sneeze; freeway; lane; car; wheelbase; circle; Honda CR-V; steering; clutch; shift linkages; devices; accelerator pedal; heel-and-toeing; clack; time; fire wall; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
